Title: R&D Laboratory & Pilot Plant Technician
HTML:
Future Manager World

Il nostro cliente √® Ballestra Spa, azienda internazionale leader nello sviluppo, ingegnerizzazione e fornitura di tecnologie, impianti di lavorazione e attrezzature per il settore chimico.

Il Gruppo oggi consolidato √® il risultato di una crescita costante avvenuta negli anni, grazie anche alla fusione di diverse aziende leader operanti nei settori dei detergenti, tensioattivi e saponi, e di prodotti chimici e fertilizzanti.

Ad oggi, l'azienda √® alla ricerca di un R&D Laboratory & Pilot Plant Technician da inserire all'interno del team di R&D Pilot Plant e si occuper√† di eseguire progetti di sviluppo.

Il profilo che deve aver maturato esperienza, anche minima (2/3 anni), nella conduzione di impianti chimici industriali e/o nella gestione ed esecuzione di test in scala di laboratorio e nell'esecuzione di analisi chimiche strumentali e non.

La Figura Si Occuper√† Nello Specifico Di

  • ricerca e sviluppo: ricerca bibliografica, analisi delle richieste, definizione degli aspetti tecnici e di logistica;
  • gestione dei progetti: gestione dei protocolli, conduzione dei test sperimentali, analisi dei dati;
  • conduzione di apparecchiature: gestione dei software di controllo e acquisizione dati, gestione di apparecchiature bench-scale e pilota;
  • Redazione delle procedure SOP e di sicurezza;
  • Redazione dei report finali descrivendo scopo, materiali, metodi, risultati e conclusioni.

La figura avr√† modo di interfacciarsi con i colleghi di team e di altri dipartimenti, nonch√© con fornitori e clienti per il corretto svolgimento dei progetti assegnati.

La risorsa ricercata ha capacit√† di lavorare sia in autonomia che in team, possiede una comunicazione assertiva, onesta e trasparente ed √® disponibile a lavorare in orari estesi in caso di test prolungati.

Requisiti

  • Diploma Superiore o Laurea in chimica, chimica analitica, chimica industriale;
  • Lingue: inglese letto/scritto buono;
  • Ottima conoscenza del pacchetto office (excel e power point avanzato);
  • Esperienza (minimo 2/3 anni) nella conduzione di impianti chimici industriali, nella gestione ed esecuzione di test in scala di laboratorio e nell'esecuzione di analisi chimiche strumentali e non.
  • Conoscenza delle analisi strumentali (GC, HPLC, IC, Potenziometria, ...);
  • Gradite competenze di programmazione e gestione data base;
  • Competenze di chimica e dei processi chimici;
  • Abilit√† nella redazione di report tecnici, SOP, metodi e manuali analitici.

Sede di lavoro: Milano/Busto Arsizio

Inquadramento e retribuzione: Contratto di Assunzione a Tempo Indeterminato. RAL indicativa 35-40.000‚Ç¨ con premio su KPI aziendali, welfare e benefit.

La ricerca √® rivolta a persone di entrambi i sessi.

Inviare dettagliato curriculum vitae in italiano con autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali ex Reg. UE 679/16

Ruolo: Ingegneria/Progettazione

Tipo di occupazione: Contratto a tempo indeterminato

Title: HSE Engineer
HTML:
MAIRE S.p.A. guida un gruppo tecnologico e ingegneristico che sviluppa e implementa soluzioni innovative per facilitare la Transizione Energetica. Offriamo Soluzioni Tecnologiche Sostenibili e Soluzioni Integrate E&C nei fertilizzanti azotati, idrogeno, carbonio circolare, combustibili, prodotti chimici e polimeri. MAIRE crea valore in 45 paesi e conta su oltre 9.800 dipendenti, supportati da oltre 29.000 persone impegnate nei suoi progetti in tutto il mondo. MAIRE √® quotata alla Borsa di Milano.

Attivita‚Äô e Responsabilita‚Äô:

Maire e‚Äô alla ricerca di un HSE Engineer che si occupi di:

  • Seguire le tematiche ed il processo di rendicontazione in accordo alla CSRD e l‚Äôimplementazione dei rispettivi KPI di competenza;
  • Analisi degli impatti, rischi e opportunit√† di business propedeutici all'analisi di Doppia Materialit√†, di transizione connessi ai cambiamenti climatici (TCFD) e ai potenziali impatti sulle attivit√†/progetti e sulla strategia di Gruppo e all'individuazione dei temi materiali di rendicontazione;
  • Gestione e supervisione degli audit di assurance di terza parte sui dati di performance non finanziari ESG per uffici e cantieri del Gruppo;
  • Partecipazioni a task force nell‚Äôambito del Gruppo per la definizione e analisi degli impatti ambientali e elaborazione di specifiche iniziative per la riduzione delle emissioni e dei consumi.



Requisiti:

  • almeno 5 anni di esperienza in un ruolo analogo;
  • ottimo livello di inglese, scritto e parlato;

Title: PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
Description:
Fontana Pelletterie SpA dal 1915 √® leader nella produzione di borse ed accessori in pelle per il mercato del lusso. La sede principale, situata a Milano nella zona di Porta Romana, comprende, oltre agli uffici direzionali, anche uffici di progettazione e sviluppo, laboratori, magazzini ed un'esclusiva boutique monomarca.

Posizione:

La risorsa verr√† inserito all‚Äôinterno dell'ufficio Sviluppo Prodotto, rispondendo direttamente al Responsabile Collezione e supportandolo in tutte le attivit√† legate al ciclo di progettazione e produzione.

Missione:

Affianca il Responsabile nello svolgimento delle attivit√† quotidiane e garantisce il rispetto delle scadenze in base a quanto richiesto.

Attivit√†/responsabilit√† della posizione:

Il candidato svolge le seguenti attivit√†:


Inserisce le distinte base;
Lancia gli ordini di produzione;
Si interfaccia con la modelleria per garantire la corretta tempificazione del flusso;
Gestisce le cartelle colori ed effettua le prove di fili e tinte.


Requisiti:

Profilo ricercato:


Formazione tecnica specifica e/o laurea in ambito moda / design;
Precedente esperienza, anche breve, all‚Äôinterno di realt√† del modo moda / pellami;
Plus: conoscenza ERP STEALTH 3000.


Attitudini

Completano il profilo:


ottime capacit√† organizzative e di gestione delle priorit√†;
orientamento al risultato e proattivit√†;
capacit√† di lavoro in team.


Altre informazioni:

I principali valori aziendali, rappresentati da qualit√†, esclusivit√†, artigianalit√†, permeano la quotidianit√† di tutti i collaboratori. Grande attenzione viene data alle risorse umane, che costituiscono il pilastro fondante del successo aziendale; a loro, in un contesto caratterizzato da grande apertura e prossimit√†, viene fornito un percorso di valorizzazione e crescita volto a sviluppare il talento di ognuno, nell‚Äôambito di un imprescindibile gioco di squadra.

Il presente annuncio √® rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91 e ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company


Dynamic European organisation representing stakeholders of the EU healthcare and pharmaceutical supply chain.
Preventing falsified medicines from entering the legal supply chain.
Working closely with 2000+ pharmaceutical companies and 30 National Medicines Verification Organisations.
Permanent full-time position.
Innovative systems.
Involved in large-scale projects.
Friendly, multicultural, motivated colleagues.
Attractive remuneration package with many benefits.


Function

As EMVO‚Äôs Data Scientist you will be reinforcing the Digital Solution Team within EMVO and support the team performing analysis on the EMVS data.

More specifically, as Data Scientist within EMVO, you will be responsible for:


Creating data models and scripts to analyse data
Cleaning the data to make it more appropriate for analysis
Prepare the analyses data so they are ready for PowerBI visualisation
Building script to automate information sharing within a protected environment
Creating reports and presentations to communicate relevant information to the EMVO Management, the EMVO Stakeholders and the EMVS Stakeholders
Developing and implementing decision tree for users
Defining and implementing statistical analysis


Profile


Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer ScienceBusiness Analytics, Artificial Intelligence
Proficiency with Microsoft Office;
Programming skills;
Strong interpersonal skills, ability to adapt and to work in a Team;
Capability to work under pressure and strict timelines;
Positive attitude with a service-driven and problem-solving mindset;
Strong analytical, organisational and planning skills;
Excellent time management skills;
Ability to prioritise, work independently and accurately on tasks;
Ability to explain complex analytical methods to non-expert audience
Knowledge of Microsoft Fabric, Microsoft PowerBI is considered as a Plus
Experience with Machine Learning is considered as an asset


Offer


An exciting permanent position working with ground-breaking systems in major projects.
Full-time job (40h/week).
32 holidays.
We offer an attractive remuneration package including meal vouchers, eco vouchers, group insurance, (pension, death and invalidity), health insurance, (hospitalisation and ambulatory), public transport subscription and option to work remotely ,


Our office is based in the heart of Brussels and is easily accessible by public transport: Rue du commerce 123, 1000 Bruxelles.

Hiring Process


There will be maximum 3 interviews, always with members of the Digital Solutions Team and the HR Team.
The hiring process will take around 4 weeks.

Languages


Proficient use of business and technical English.
Knowledge of French or another European language is considered an asset

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you passionate about energy, sustainability, and technology, with a drive to create impactful data solutions?



Flexcity, a leading European energy tech company within the Veolia Group is looking for a resourceful Data Scientist to join our Data team.





















Job Description



As a Data Scientist, you will be the owner of data assets related to short-term electricity markets, for which Flexcity aims to deliver a best-in-class service. You will carry out quantitative analyses and design optimization solutions using Machine Learning or Linear Programming for our ‚ÄúSmart Grid‚Äù services. You will also collaborate with fellow Data Engineers and Developers to deploy these solutions into production.



By interacting with other Flexcity teams, you will gain hands-on experience in developing intelligent systems for both electricity markets (day-ahead, intraday, aFRR, ‚Ä¶) and flexible assets (BESS, CHPs, solar parks, ‚Ä¶). You will work with cutting-edge and innovative technologies used by Flexcity (Internet of Things, cloud-native development, ‚Ä¶) in a fast-moving industry that actively contributes to the energy transition.



As Data Scientist, your time will be divided into:







Research and Development of ML and Optimization Algorithms - 60%



Contribute to all stages of the R&D lifecycle, including design, development, testing, deployment and monitoring of optimization algorithms



Delivering Quantitative Insights to Portfolio Teams - 30%



Use data-driven tools and skills to support colleague portfolio managers in their day-to-day work (market bidding, account management, ‚Ä¶)



Data Architecture Improvement - 10%



Actively participate in initiatives to enhance the data stack, DevOps/MLOps practices and coding standards to foster a culture of continuous improvement





Qualifications







Experience



Master‚Äôs degree or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematical, Electricity or Energy Engineering, Mathematics or Physics with an excellent academic record



At least 4 years of professional experience working in a quantitative-savvy environment solving complex optimization problems using data



Hard Skills



Fluent in English



Mathematical modeling: Proficient in translating complex real-world systems into rigorous mathematical models



Python development: Proficient in writing Python scripts and building small Python prototypes (with libraries such as pandas, polars, requests, plotly, ‚Ä¶)



SQL: Experience in understanding and writing complex SQL queries



Optimization: Experience with either Linear Optimization or Machine Learning methods



Nice to Have - experience with Linux and Git as DevOps tools



Nice to Have - experience with cloud platforms (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure, ...)







Soft Skills



Strong analytical thinking: Independently deconstruct complex quantitative problems and apply a systematic, methodical approach to implement effective solutions



Effective communication skills: Effectively convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, fostering collaboration and understanding across teams



Project management expertise: Organise and prioritise tasks, coordinate cross-functional efforts, and ensure timely delivery of solutions that align with project goals



A positive, pragmatic and professional attitude



Comfortable in a fast changing work environment, you can easily adapt



Nice to Have: an interest for the energy sector





Additional Information



Why Join Flexcity?



Impact Be part of our key Datal team, with a direct impact in the decarbonisation of our industry



Purpose Contribute concretely to a greener future, both in France and globally



Scale-up Work in an agile environment, getting structured and more efficient, but still with a large freedom and strategic decision making available at all levels of the company



Group Benefit from a close relationship with the Veolia group, a global leader in the ecological and energy transformation



Innovation Engage with cutting-edge energy technology and markets



Supported Get backing from dedicated central support teams in R&D, Product and Portfolio, in order to get you the best tools, training and sounding board to work in the best environment



Community Engage with a team spread across multiple countries, learning and innovating together. Connect with diverse teams across Europe through regular team-building events, both within Flexcity and Veolia



Training Develop your hard and soft skills with dedicated training made available, as well as strong learning curve within your position



Hybrid Experience international collaboration and flexible work schedules, including 2 work-from- home days















About Flexcity



Flexcity is a uniquely positioned energy technology company in the Internet of Energy sector. It is a leading demand response aggregator in Europe, rapidly growing and expanding to new regions. Flexcity‚Äôs core activity consists of supporting the power grid balance through the operation of its large portfolio of flexible fully-automated assets.







The Flexcity portfolio consists of a wide range of technologies such as batteries, eBoilers, CHPs, generators, wind farms, solar parks and large industrial processes.







As a provider of smart energy management services based on innovative smart grid technology, Flexcity applications focus on demand-side optimization and management (Demand Response, Load Shifting, etc.). Flexcity supports many industrial companies in reducing their overall electricity costs by providing demand-side management services based on innovative optimization and modelling software applications.







Flexcity is truly at the cutting edge of energy innovation. As a member of the team, you will contribute to a sustainable low-carbon energy sector.







As an inclusive company, Veolia is committed to diversity and gives equal consideration to all applications, without discrimination.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM‚ÄôS SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

WHAT IS A DATA SCIENTIST AT CREAM?

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Fincons Group is an IT business consulting company that has been designing the digital future of leading companies on international markets for 40 years. Fincons Group built its reputation on foreseeing and interpreting new business models and the rapid evolution of IT systems by building a complete range of services: from research and consulting to design and development, from system integration of leading vendor software solutions right up to application management, supporting clients step by step along their digital transformation journey. Fincons is a multinational with over 2,600 people and several offices worldwide (in Italy, Switzerland, Germany, France, the United Kingdom, Belgium and the USA), but above all a Family Company where the founders play a strategic role with commitment and passion, grounding the company in the same principles of a united and caring family.

We firmly believe in the value of cooperation and in the contribution that every idea and intuition can bring. We believe that everyone‚Äôs effort can make a difference. Transforming knowledge into a strategic resource is our company mission, and we pursue it with the help of our most strategic asset: our people.




Fincons is looking for a Data Scientist




with strong hands-on experience in Microsoft Azure ecosystem, particularly with Azure Fabric, Power BI, and AI/ML integration to support the enhancement of existing systems and APIs through intelligent solutions.




Technical Skills




üîπ Cloud and Platform Expertise

Extensive hands-on experience with Microsoft Azure, including:
Azure Machine Learning
Azure Data Factory
Azure Synapse Analytics
Azure Data Lake Storage
Azure Databricks (nice to have)
Practical knowledge of Microsoft Fabric for data engineering and analytics scenarios.
Familiarity with Azure DevOps, including pipelines and automated deployment.




üîπ Data Science & AI

Solid practical experience in machine learning model development and deployment, including:
Supervised and unsupervised learning
Feature engineering and model evaluation
Experience with model integration into production systems/APIs
Strong Python programming skills, including:
Use of libraries like pandas, scikit-learn, numpy, matplotlib, TensorFlow or PyTorch (at least one)
Understanding of MLOps principles and lifecycle in Azure ML.




üîπ Data Integration & Engineering

Ability to connect and transform data from multiple sources using Azure services and APIs.
Experience working with structured and semi-structured data (SQL, JSON, XML).
Familiarity with data pipeline orchestration, performance tuning, and error handling.




üîπ Power BI & Visualization

Proficiency in Power BI, including:
Building dynamic dashboards
DAX expressions
DirectQuery vs Import models
Gateway setup and refresh optimization
Ability to translate analytical insights into business-friendly visualizations.




Additional Skills (Nice to Have)

Experience with OpenAI/ChatGPT or Azure OpenAI Services.
Knowledge of API architecture, RESTful APIs, and integrating AI models into API workflows.
Exposure to CI/CD pipelines and containerization (Docker/Kubernetes).
Microsoft certifications (e.g., Azure Data Scientist Associate, Power BI Data Analyst Associate).




Soft Skills

Strong problem-solving mindset and analytical skills.
Ability to work independently and within cross-functional Agile teams.
Clear communicator, capable of explaining complex models to non-technical stakeholders.
Attention to performance, scalability, and maintainability of AI-enhanced systems.




English (C!) required




Office: Brussels

modality of work: near-site




If interested, please apply!

Our personnel search is addressed to candidates of all genders.

The data will be processed and stored exclusively for the purposes of this or future selections, in compliance with the Federal Data Protection Law (LPD) and guaranteeing the rights referred to in art. 13 Legislative Decree 196/03 and EU regulation 679/2016 (GDPR)

Title: Freelance Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for a detail-oriented and technically skilled Data Scientist to support the analysis, documentation, and enhancement of existing programs developed in R, SAS, Excel, MS Access, and C#. The successful candidate will play a key role in improving performance, implementing quick wins, and increasing the efficiency of our data processing and reporting systems.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze and document existing R, Excel, MS Access, C#, and SAS programs.
Migrate existing SAS programs to R, ensuring functional equivalence and enhanced performance.
Improve performance and efficiency of existing R programs.
Collaborate with stakeholders to identify opportunities for quick wins and process enhancements.
Produce high-quality technical documentation for implemented changes and developments.




Languages

Verbal and written communication: Dutch and/or French (active knowledge required)
Written communication: English (proficient for documentation purposes)




Technical Knowledge

Strong programming skills in R, SAS, SQL, Python, and experience with Power BI.
Familiarity with database tools and data manipulation in large datasets.
Experience in test planning and execution using XRAY or similar testing frameworks.

Experience

Previous experience in business analysis, especially in analyzing processes involving large databases and data tools.
Proven track record of improving or optimizing legacy systems through code and process enhancements.

Preferred Qualifications

Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Relevant certifications in data analytics, programming, or business analysis are a plus.

Title: Data Scientist ‚Äì Artificial Intelligence & Advanced Analytics
Company: LOTUS HR | Executive Recruitment & Leadership Coaching van C-Suite en Management
Description:
We are currently supporting a leading organization in Belgium‚Äôs financial and tech ecosystem in their search for a Data Scientist (AI) to join a multidisciplinary advanced analytics team.

In this role, you will lead the design and deployment of AI-powered solutions to enhance operational efficiency, customer insights, fraud detection, and risk management. You will collaborate closely with internal business units, translating strategic questions into robust machine learning models and intelligent automation frameworks.




This opportunity suits candidates who are passionate about building responsible AI and delivering production-ready, value-adding models in complex environments




Key Responsibilities




Model Development & Deployment

Design, train, and deploy supervised and unsupervised ML models (e.g., classification, clustering, NLP, recommendation systems) with measurable business outcomes.

AI Strategy & Use Case Definition

Translate high-level business needs into data-driven use cases and proofs of concept. Prioritize projects in line with data governance and strategic goals.

Data Engineering & Feature Pipelines

Work with data engineers and architects to prepare clean, secure, and scalable datasets using modern cloud and on-prem solutions (Snowflake, Azure, Databricks, etc.).

Productionization & Monitoring

Ensure models are robust, explainable (XAI), and monitored post-deployment using MLOps tools (MLflow, Airflow, Azure ML).

Collaboration & Communication

Present findings and model performance clearly to non-technical stakeholders (risk, compliance, marketing, executive) and collaborate with IT & legal teams for ethical AI compliance.




Profile Sought




Master‚Äôs or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or Physics
3‚Äì7 years of relevant experience in a data science / ML engineering role
Expert in Python and key libraries (Scikit-learn, Pandas, PyTorch, TensorFlow, XGBoost, Transformers)
Strong understanding of statistics, ML algorithms, and data wrangling
Familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP) and containerized workflows (Docker, Kubernetes)
Knowledge of ethical and explainable AI principles and GDPR constraints
Fluent in English; French or Dutch is a strong advantage




Interested?

Please send your CV directly to sean@lotushr.be.

For any questions, feel free to contact Sean Tommissen at +32 488 985 145




üö´ Please note: Candidates who wish to work on a freelance or consultancy basis for this vacancy will not be considered ‚Äì this position is for permanent employment only.

At LOTUS HR, everything revolves around exceptional leadership.

We guide leaders throughout the entire Leadership Life Cycle ‚Äì from onboarding and development to succession planning and next-level growth.

As a boutique headhunting firm, we specialize in identifying and developing C-Suite Executives and Managers who can take your organization to the next level.

In addition to Executive Recruitment and Leadership Profiling, we offer targeted coaching and strategic HR guidance to support leaders in their personal and organizational impact. Through solution-focused coaching programs and the HR Strategy Scan, we help executive teams make the right decisions at critical moments.

Trust LOTUS HR to strengthen your team with leaders who inspire and excel. Together, we build a future of visionary leadership and exceptional performance.

Whether it‚Äôs a family business, SME, multinational in the private sector, government institution, non-profit, or healthcare organization ‚Äì our focus and expertise lie in finding the right leadership profile.

We have deep experience across various sectors, including:

Executives, Public Sector, Human Resources, Life Sciences ‚Äì Pharma & Chemicals, Finance & Accounting, Sales & Office, Technics & Engineering, Logistics & Supply Chain.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We're partnered with a VC-backed climate tech startup whose mission is to drive climate action through data. Their intelligent platform empowers organisations to tackle climate issues by monitoring their carbon footprint. It's currently being used by global sustainability leaders!




On the hunt for TWO talented Machine Learning Engineers with experience in Search, Recommendation Engines, and Text Classification to join our dynamic team. You'll collaborate with developers, scientists, and experts to improve AI features that are at the core of what we do. If you're someone who loves taking ownership of projects and working in a team, this could be a great fit for you!




What you‚Äôll do:

Build, develop, and maintain ML models, NLP, and Information Retrieval systems that power carbon intelligence globally.
Deliver key data and insights through platforms that support major enterprises in their climate action efforts.
Experiment and optimize models (like transformers, classifiers, LLMs) to improve our product‚Äôs search and recommendation engine.
Keep our data pipelines in check, ensuring everything‚Äôs ready for modeling.
Deploy and manage models using AWS SageMaker, Flask, and Pydantic.




What you‚Äôll need:

Extensive experience in Machine Learning, specifically with Search, Classification, and Information Retrieval.
Python experience, specifically working with data pipelines and REST APIs.
A self-starter who enjoys problem-solving and working independently.
Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate with remote teams.




What's in it for you?:

Genuinely making a positive impact on the planet
Salary ‚Ç¨100K-120K
Benefits, including employee stock options
As a remote-first company, their team collaborates from locations across Europe.




If this is of interest to you, please apply now!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models with a focus on generative AI (e.g., LLMs, diffusion models, GANs).
Apply generative AI for use cases such as text generation, summarization, classification, synthetic data creation, and intelligent assistants.
Collaborate with data engineers and ML engineers to build scalable pipelines.
Lead experimentation and validation of new GenAI models and tools.
Support prompt engineering and fine-tuning of foundation models where applicable.
Ensure compliance with data privacy, security, and ethical AI standards.
Present findings and models to stakeholders in clear, actionable formats.

Required Skills & Experience:

5+ years of experience as a Data Scientist or ML Engineer.
Strong proficiency in Python and ML libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face Transformers, LangChain).
Deep knowledge of foundational models, LLMs (GPT, Claude, LLaMA, Mistral, etc.), and associated tooling.
Hands-on experience with fine-tuning or customizing generative AI models.
Solid grounding in classical ML (supervised/unsupervised learning), statistics, and NLP.
Familiarity with deploying models via REST APIs, Docker, and cloud services (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
Experience working with enterprise data in complex environments (structured/unstructured).
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical audiences.

Nice to Have:

Experience with vector databases (e.g., FAISS, Pinecone, Weaviate).
Familiarity with GenAI enterprise platforms (e.g., OpenAI, Azure OpenAI, Cohere, Anthropic).
Experience in regulated industries (e.g., healthcare, finance, public sector).
Knowledge of European data protection regulations (e.g., GDPR).

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
As an Data Scientist, you will play a key role in developing end-to-end solutions for AI use cases. By taking up a use case right from the start you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right ML solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production. You will do so while ensuring that our internal governance processes and best practices are respected. You will also collaborate with other team members in knowledge sharing as well as continuously improving our way of working.

Responsibilities

  • Develop AI applications using state-of-the-art (Gen)AI technology;
  • Translate business requests into AI applications;
  • Identify high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization;
  • Pilot prototypes in production processes to demonstrate their value;
  • Deploy prototypes to production, with support of IT, to obtain reliable, scalable systems;
  • Present your results in a clear manner and discuss them with multi-functional project teams;
  • Work in close collaboration with business experts (e.g. for requirement gathering, data source identification, data and process understanding, feature engineering, result validation, etc.), with IT (e.g. for ETL, deployment to production, etc.) and with other AI engineers in the team (e.g. for knowledge sharing).

Profile

  • PhD or Master's degree in a quantitative field (Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.)
  • 3+ years of relevant work experience in a business environment

Technical Skills

  • Hands-on experience with Python and its AI ecosystem;
  • Strong knowledge of state-of-the-art AI and statistical methods;
  • Experience with cloud technology (Azure);
  • Experience using LLM‚Äôs and commonly used libraries to interact with LLM‚Äôs (Langchain, Llamaindex, ...) is an asset;
  • Proven proficiency in the end-to-end AI project life cycle, including:
  • Translating business requests into data requirements.
  • Identifying high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization.
  • Developing AI solutions (incl. feature engineering, model fitting, etc.).
  • Deploying scalable AI applications to production.
  • Any experience with following elements is a plus:
  • MLOps practices, e.g. orchestration with Airflow, Gitlab CI/CD, etc.

Attitudes/Behavior

  • Passionate about AI and a constant learner;
  • Result-oriented and highly proficient in transforming data into actionable insights that create business value;
  • Team player with strong communication and presentation skills;
  • Able to manage AI projects in an autonomous way and drive collaboration with domain experts, data engineers and other AI engineers;
  • Knowledge in the field of telecommunications is a plus.

Languages

  • Fluent in Dutch and/or French (mandatory) + Fluent in English.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About US (GEMS):

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE‚Äôs assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity "Global Energy Management & Sales" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group‚Äôs large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

Our 4 areas of expertise:


Asset management
Energy transition services
Energy supply & global commodities
Risk management & market access


At GEMS we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.

More info on GEMS Hub ( https://gems.engie.com ) or LinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions ).

Context: The position belongs to the Quantitative Data Analysts team in Belgium (Brussels) specifically dedicated to assist the management of risks for belgian B2C and B2B Energy Suppliers. As a member of the quantitative analysts community of the Business Platform Downstream, one can also contribute to transversal projects impacting the activity of other commercial BUs. The main missions associated with the position are :


Based on data collection and analysis, to build models, tools, processes and data representations, that are used to manage the commodity risks linked to the dynamics of a Supply portfolio
The purpose of this work is to operate and optimize costing, forecasting, sourcing and hedging strategies, within a defined mandate


The quantitative analyst / data scientist will do the design, but also the development and ensure the delivery of these models and tools. Beyond that, he will also provide scientific expertise for bespoke analysis, related to data or models. Role:

The daily responsibilities of the new role will include:


Contribute to the development of the tools, models, process and portfolio/data representation used for

Representation of all commodity exposures and associated risks (evolution of the commercial position, climatic impact on short term consumption forecasts, ...)
New commercial offers
Customer behavior analysis

Ensure the run of models and derived operations
Provide BUs B2C and B2B Belgium with a deep knowledge of its commodity sales portfolios (Natural Gas, Power and Certificates) and optimally structure the portfolio representation
Use large range of data to ensure correct representation
Promote good practice, especially around data and code
Ensure code quality by following general rules and standards
Interact with other quantitative analysts/data scientists, to exchange about models, data, business or technical topics beyond the team

Hard skills:


Must have:

Strong scientific background: mathematics (probability/statistics), data science, machine learning, ideally with good command of time series forecasting
Strong skills in software (ideally Python) programming and related tools (versioning, etc.)
Willingness to embrace data handling and operational analytics
Practical thinking, hands-on approach
Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues to non-experts in a simple and pedagogic way

Good to have:

Interest for the Energy markets and Energy-transition topics
Knowledge of modern data science platforms and engines such as Databricks and Spark is a plus

Soft skills:


Must have:

Team-player, Transparent, Favor collaboration and working together




Good to have:

Practical thinking

Education and professional background:


University degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or Physics
Ideally 1-2 years of experience in the development of modelling tools, ideally with a good knowledge of electricity & gas markets


Languages:


F lu ent in En g lish


Travels:


Occasional travels (mostly to CWE countries)


If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!

Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals. All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

About ENGIE:

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (‚Äúraison d‚Äô√™tre‚Äù) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, power, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 96,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
(Medical R&D Sector ‚Äì Confidential Client)




About the role




On behalf of one of our clients ‚Äî a leading innovator in the medical research and development sector (Software and ML integrated Product)‚Äî we are recruiting for two open positions within the same dynamic R&D team:

Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Medior Machine Learning Engineer




This company is dedicated to improving healthcare outcomes through advanced statistical analysis and machine learning innovation. The ideal candidates will have a strong technical foundation, a passion for scientific research, and a deep interest in applying AI to solve meaningful real-world challenges in the healthcare domain.




Responsibilities

Research, design, and implement new machine learning models to enhance clinical data quality and support healthcare decision-making.
Continuously analyze scientific literature to identify promising algorithms and evaluate their practical application.
Produce robust, efficient Python code aligned with best software development practices.
Leverage open-source libraries and frameworks to drive experimentation and model optimization.
Apply best practices for experiment tracking, model validation, and deployment.
Explore new areas for machine learning applications in the medical and clinical research domain.
Actively contribute to scientific visibility through conferences, workshops, and potential publications.
Collaborate closely with data engineers, domain experts, and statisticians to bring prototypes into production.




Profile Sought

Master‚Äôs or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or other quantitative fields.
Solid professional experience in machine learning, data science, or applied AI roles.
Excellent command of Python.
Practical experience with at least one deep learning framework (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Comfortable with Git and collaborative development workflows.
Proven ability to translate theoretical research into operational AI solutions.
Language requirements: Fluent English is sufficient; no other languages are required




Nice to Have

Experience with deep learning and natural language processing (NLP).
Practical experience with deployment and monitoring of machine learning models.
Previous exposure to medical data or work in highly regulated industries (healthcare, life sciences, etc.).
Knowledge of GPU computing environments.




Offer

Two open roles: one Senior and one Medior Machine Learning Engineer.
Remote-first working model: nearly fully remote; only 1 day/week minimum presence on-site South Brussels
Opportunity to work on scientifically impactful projects with real-world healthcare applications.
Competitive salary package including bonuses, mobility benefits, healthcare insurance, and more.
Dynamic, multicultural team environment focused on research excellence, technical innovation, and personal development.
Access to powerful computing infrastructure, learning materials, and career growth opportunities.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist - Gen AI
Description:
Data Scientist - Gen AI

2 year contract

2 days a week on site




A leading financial services company based in Brussels is seeking a skilled Data Scientist with expertise in Generative AI. You will work in a dynamic and collaborative environment, applying your analytical and technical skills to solve internal business challenges. You will help identify impactful use cases, developing AI-driven solutions, and contributing to the evolution of internal GenAI capabilities and best practices.




Skills Required




5‚Äì8 years of experience in data science
Fluent in French or Dutch
Strong business acumen with the ability to translate business needs into technical solutions
Expertise in data wrangling, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and machine learning
Proficiency in Python and libraries such as Pandas & NumPy
Cloud platform experience, particularly with Azure
Deep knowledge of LLM libraries like Langchain, LangGraph
Experience deploying and monitoring GenAI models




Contact Adam Morgan for more information

Title: Data Scientist AI/ML
Description:
AI/ML Data Scientist - contract 6 months - Remote - Pharma




We are seeking a skilled Data Scientist with hands-on experience in Python programming, statistical modeling, and machine learning to join pharmaceutical and clinical analytics team. In this role, you will leverage advanced analytics to drive innovation in drug discovery, clinical development, and real-world evidence generation.




Key Responsibilities:




Proven experience/ hands on experience in coding (Python)
Develop and implement advanced statistical models and machine learning algorithms to analyze large-scale pharmaceutical and clinical datasets.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design experiments and derive actionable insights from data related to drug discovery, clinical trials, genomics, and patient outcomes.
Explore real-world evidence (RWE) and real-world data (RWD) to support drug development and market access strategies.
Design and deploy AI models to predict drug efficacy, optimize clinical trial designs, and identify novel drug targets.
Develop natural language processing (NLP) algorithms to analyse unstructured medical literature, electronic health records (EHRs), and clinical trial documents.
Utilize deep learning techniques for image analysis in pathology and radiology or biomarker discovery.
Clean, pre-process, and manage large datasets from various sources including clinical, omics (genomics, proteomics), and commercial datasets.
Integrate public and proprietary datasets to develop comprehensive datasets for machine learning models.
Work closely with bioinformaticians, clinical researchers, and other stakeholders to translate business objectives into technical solutions.
Present findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders and help guide strategic decision-making.
Publish research findings in peer-reviewed journals and present at conferences where applicable.
Show more
HTML:
AI/ML Data Scientist - contract 6 months - Remote - Pharma


We are seeking a skilled Data Scientist with hands-on experience in Python programming, statistical modeling, and machine learning to join pharmaceutical and clinical analytics team. In this role, you will leverage advanced analytics to drive innovation in drug discovery, clinical development, and real-world evidence generation.


Key Responsibilities:


  • Proven experience/ hands on experience in coding (Python)
  • Develop and implement advanced statistical models and machine learning algorithms to analyze large-scale pharmaceutical and clinical datasets.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design experiments and derive actionable insights from data related to drug discovery, clinical trials, genomics, and patient outcomes.
  • Explore real-world evidence (RWE) and real-world data (RWD) to support drug development and market access strategies.
  • Design and deploy AI models to predict drug efficacy, optimize clinical trial designs, and identify novel drug targets.
  • Develop natural language processing (NLP) algorithms to analyse unstructured medical literature, electronic health records (EHRs), and clinical trial documents.
  • Utilize deep learning techniques for image analysis in pathology and radiology or biomarker discovery.
  • Clean, pre-process, and manage large datasets from various sources including clinical, omics (genomics, proteomics), and commercial datasets.
  • Integrate public and proprietary datasets to develop comprehensive datasets for machine learning models.
  • Work closely with bioinformaticians, clinical researchers, and other stakeholders to translate business objectives into technical solutions.
  • Present findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders and help guide strategic decision-making.
  • Publish research findings in peer-reviewed journals and present at conferences where applicable.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are seeking a talented and passionate Data Scientist to join our client team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for extracting valuable insights from complex datasets, building predictive models, and contributing to data-driven decision-making. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to solve challenging business problems and drive innovation.




Responsibilities:

Develop and implement machine learning models using Python libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch.
Perform data cleaning, preprocessing, and feature engineering to prepare data for analysis.
Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify patterns and trends in data.
Visualize data using libraries like Matplotlib and Seaborn to communicate findings effectively.
Collaborate with engineers and product managers to deploy and monitor machine learning models.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science and machine learning.
Communicate complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Scientist or similar role.
Strong proficiency in Python and relevant libraries (scikit-learn, pandas, NumPy, etc.).
Experience with machine learning algorithms and techniques (regression, classification, clustering, etc.).
Solid understanding of statistical concepts and methods.
Experience with data visualization tools and libraries.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Experience with SQL and databases.
Experience with Cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Experience with Big Data technologies like Spark or Hadoop.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Experience with natural language processing (NLP).
Experience with time series analysis.
Experience with A/B testing.




Other information:

Location: Hungary or Bulgaria

Work Mode: 100% Remote

Contract type: B2B/Freelance

Contract: 6 months (Possibility of extension)

Show more

More info on GEMS Hub ( https://gems.engie.com ) or LinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions ).

Context: The position belongs to the Quantitative Data Analysts team in Belgium (Brussels) specifically dedicated to assist the management of risks for belgian B2C and B2B Energy Suppliers. As a member of the quantitative analysts community of the Business Platform Downstream, one can also contribute to transversal projects impacting the activity of other commercial BUs. The main missions associated with the position are :

  • Based on data collection and analysis, to build models, tools, processes and data representations, that are used to manage the commodity risks linked to the dynamics of a Supply portfolio
  • The purpose of this work is to operate and optimize costing, forecasting, sourcing and hedging strategies, within a defined mandate

The quantitative analyst / data scientist will do the design, but also the development and ensure the delivery of these models and tools. Beyond that, he will also provide scientific expertise for bespoke analysis, related to data or models. Role:

The daily responsibilities of the new role will include:

  • Contribute to the development of the tools, models, process and portfolio/data representation used for
    • Representation of all commodity exposures and associated risks (evolution of the commercial position, climatic impact on short term consumption forecasts, ...)
    • New commercial offers
    • Customer behavior analysis
  • Ensure the run of models and derived operations
  • Provide BUs B2C and B2B Belgium with a deep knowledge of its commodity sales portfolios (Natural Gas, Power and Certificates) and optimally structure the portfolio representation
  • Use large range of data to ensure correct representation
  • Promote good practice, especially around data and code
  • Ensure code quality by following general rules and standards
  • Interact with other quantitative analysts/data scientists, to exchange about models, data, business or technical topics beyond the team
Hard skills:

  • Must have:
    • Strong scientific background: mathematics (probability/statistics), data science, machine learning, ideally with good command of time series forecasting
    • Strong skills in software (ideally Python) programming and related tools (versioning, etc.)
    • Willingness to embrace data handling and operational analytics
    • Practical thinking, hands-on approach
    • Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues to non-experts in a simple and pedagogic way
  • Good to have:
    • Interest for the Energy markets and Energy-transition topics
    • Knowledge of modern data science platforms and engines such as Databricks and Spark is a plus
Soft skills:

  • Must have:
    • Team-player, Transparent, Favor collaboration and working together


  • Good to have:
    • Practical thinking
Education and professional background:

  • University degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or Physics
  • Ideally 1-2 years of experience in the development of modelling tools, ideally with a good knowledge of electricity & gas markets

Languages:

  • F lu ent in En g lish

Travels:

  • Occasional travels (mostly to CWE countries)

If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!

Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals. All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

About ENGIE:

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (‚Äúraison d‚Äô√™tre‚Äù) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, power, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 96,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress.

Business Unit: GEMS

Division: GEMS - EC QUANTITATIVE RESEARCH & MODELING

Legal Entity: ELECTRABEL

Professional Experience: Skilled ( >3 experience <15 years)

Education Level: Master's Degree

Title: Manager Data Scientist
Description:
Function

Advisory - Manager

Roles & Responsibilities


A corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other‚Äôs beliefs and background.
Professional experiences in an international and dynamic working environment with inspiring colleagues.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working on different locations: home office, on-site or on the go.
A wide range of teambuilding activities and social events that enable new joiners to meet colleagues within the wider KPMG community and have some fun along the way.




#technology

Location

Zaventem HQ

Skills & Qualifications

The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!

Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:


Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,‚Ä¶
Other types of eduction are also valued.
A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.
Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE‚Äôs, Git, Microsoft Azure,
Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD‚Äôs, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
The desire to learn and grow
A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
Knowledge of dutch is a big plus


We offer

In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged ‚Äì to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.

What is the job about?


Contributing to the growth of Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning as a topic and as a competence at KPMG
Contributing to the growth of our project portfolio
Mentoring colleagues
Stepping ito conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutions
Gathering and organizing data
Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution
Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
Bringing your model into production ‚Äì and communicating with specialist IT profiles
Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders ‚Äì clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,‚Ä¶

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Organisation

Bluesquare is a fast growing technology company focusing on Global Health. Bluesquare‚Äôs goal is to help Global Health resources get where it matters the most. We partner with Global Health Funds, national governments, health service purchasers, and NGOs, to help them make smarter health investments. Bluesquare‚Äôs technologies are in use in more than 30 countries and support +60 different clients, including the World Bank, the WHO, the Global Fund to Fight HIV, TB and Malaria, the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, leading NGOs and consultancies.




For more information about who we are: https://bluesquarehub.com/




Mission and description of the role

We are looking for a Data Scientist with experience in data analysis and visualisation to join our data science team.




Start date: as soon as possible.




Location: Preferably based in Brussels, though remote work is possible.

The role requires occasional travel to other countries in order to support Bluesquare‚Äôs projects. Bluesquare takes into account the safety risks of its employees in the areas concerned.




Team: We are a horizontal company with more than 80 team members in multiple countries. The Data Science team is composed of friendly, supportive and enthusiastic young individuals distributed across Europe and Africa.




We value ownership, autonomy, flexibility, communication and teamwork. We strive for excellence in the solutions we provide for pressing challenges, emphasizing continuous self-improvement and supporting the individual development of our team members. Nevertheless, we firmly prioritize work-life balance, well-being, and recognizing each person as a unique individual for an optimal working environment.




Role and Responsibilities




Data Management & Analysis:

In collaboration with the data science team, develop scripts in R or Python for data cleaning, data processing, data integration and data quality screening.
Apply your technical skills in DHIS2 to contribute to improving the management of health data.




Automation of procedures

Contribution to the automation of the procedures via different scripting languages (Python, R) in command line or on the Bluesquare data analytics platform OpenHexa in collaboration with the development team.
Provide technical support and documentation on the procedures established.
Write code documentation, user guidelines, articles and other materials that will be useful to communicate with our clients and other partners.




Product development:

Contribute to Bluesquare‚Äôs products, processes, procedures and tools (product roadmap, user manual, training material, etc.) based on ongoing client needs analysis.




Data visualisation:

Set up dashboards using different BI and visualisation tools (Tableau, Power BI..) to answer clients‚Äô needs, and develop customised applications for data visualisation.




Quality control:

Review and automate scripts to ensure quality control of the released data integration work.




Technical writing:

Write code documentation, users guidelines, articles and other materials that will be useful to communicate with our clients and other partners.




Capacity building

Provide internal and external trainings for stakeholders in the use of different tools and in-house data solutions
Adapt the curricula of the training sessions to the specific needs of the respective stakeholders
Support other teams in their needs for data analysis based on ongoing needs assessment




Additional responsibilities

Contribute to the company visibility/networking on health data systems and Bluesquare visibility (blogs, product descriptions, events)




Our technical stack

You will have to work with the following technologies and software:

Python or R for data processing (data wrangling, forecasting, operational research, geospatial)
The Jupyter data science ecosystem
Data visualisation tools and BI software (Tableau, PowerBI, Superset, Matplotlib, Plotly, Dash,‚Ä¶)
Our own platforms, such as OpenHexa, Iaso and OpenIMIS
Industry-standard tools such as DHIS2 and ODK
Geospatial Software (GDAL, QGIS, Cartographic Rendering Software, etc.)
Data




Profile

Required

Master degree in data management and analysis, statistics, econometrics‚Ä¶
Strong quantitative and analytical skills
Working experience in data analysis (e.g. R or Python), in database management (e.g. SQL)
1-3 years of experience in R/Python programming and with creating scripts to manipulate, clean and analyse data
Good working knowledge of the Jupyter ecosystem
Excellent oral and written communication skills in French and English
Ability to work autonomously
Team player with good interpersonal skills




Preferred

Experience with Docker, Kubernetes or deployment of containerized applications.
Experience with Google Cloud Platform, AWS or Azure.
Experience and familiarity with practices, software and working environment of CICD, DevOps.
Experience with time series forecasting, operational research, supply chain, geosciences
Experience in Global health, Health financing, Disease Surveillance, Geospatial or Monitoring and Evaluation in another sector a plus
Experience with GIS (Geographical Information System) and familiarity with Environmental dataset sources (ex: Google Earth Engine)
Experience with DHIS2 configuration for management of health and with ODK for the creation of forms
Experience with BI tools & with the creation of interactive dashboards (Tableau, Power BI, Superset)
Working experience in Africa, Asia or Latin America




What we offer

We are open to considering candidates on a freelance basis.




Competitive Salary and benefits package
Flexible work hours and extensive remote working options, as we entrust our team members, anticipating a responsible and conscientious utilisation of this trust.
Exciting projects: use data to solve major issues (Health, Education, Waste management, Public Funding Optimization and more)
Impact: manage data platforms impacting the lives of thousands of people
Network: work in collaboration with a wide variety of actors within countries (Ministries, Donors, NGOs, Implementing partners, field staff, etc.)
Hands-on experience: on-site visits and in-depth situation analysis, because we believe that nothing compares to experiencing first-hand the change one is contributing to.
Exciting work environment: join a result-oriented, dynamic & diverse team committed to improve the accessibility and quality of health services, especially for the poorest




To apply, please send your CV and motivation letter to datascientistbru@bluesquare1.odoo.com.

To apply, please send your CV and motivation letter to datascientistbru@bluesquare1.odoo.com.

Title: AI/ ML Engineer - (PyTorch, Hugging Face, NLP, Content Moderation)
Description:
Job Title: ML/ AI Engineer - Content Moderation

Location: Remote (Global - 3hr CEST timezone)




This fast-growing conversational AI startup is building immersive experiences across roleplay, gaming, social interactions, and creative writing. Since launching in September 2023, the platform has scaled rapidly to 26 million users, with plans to expand into exciting areas such as group chat, AI-powered calls, video conversations, AI-generated video, and AR/VR features.




Why This Opportunity?:




Join a groundbreaking project in the early stages of AI evolution
Work alongside a top-tier founding team with multiple startup successes
Be part of a product already used by 26M+ users in under a year
Work in a global, fully distributed team environment




Key Responsibilities:




Content Moderation: Monitor and filter inappropriate content to ensure a safe and positive user experience, Maintain and improve classifiers for detecting sensitive topics, Uphold community standards through proactive content management
Behaviour Adjustment: Use prompt engineering to steer AI behaviour while keeping interactions natural and engaging
Policy & Compliance: Define and enforce moderation policies aligned with company values and legal standards, Ensure compliance with global content regulations and ethical expectations, Distinguish between socially acceptable NSFW content and prohibited behaviour
User Feedback & System Improvement: Gather and analyse user feedback to refine moderation tools, Adapt systems to evolving trends and user behaviour
Multilingual & Cultural Adaptation: Guide LLM behaviour across multiple languages and cultural contexts, Ensure culturally sensitive and inclusive user experiences




Requirements:




Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or a related field
3+ yrs of experience in AI/ ML Engineering, building & deploying ML models, built ML systems from scratch
Experience with content moderation systems and sensitive topic classifiers
Prompt engineering experience with LLMs, fine-tuning for classification/ detection tasks
MUST HAVE Python, PyTorch, Hugging Face, NLP experience
Proficient in administering computer systems
Ability to simplify and communicate technical concepts clearly
Familiarity with large-scale user feedback and system iteration
Fluent English




Salary/ Benefits:




100% Remote ‚Äì work from anywhere (3hrs of CEST)
‚Ç¨80-100k salary range
4 weeks paid time off
Annual team retreat
Wellbeing budget (up to $200/year)
Flexible working hours

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Jouw rol is het analyseren en interpreteren van complexe datasets met behulp van AI en machine learning technieken, en deze om te zetten in technische oplossingen om op die manier het gewenste eindresultaat voor de klant te produceren.

Je analyseert grote datasets om trends, patronen en inzichten te ontdekken.

Je ontwikkelt en implementeert machine learning modellen om voorspellingen te doen of beslissingen te automatiseren.

Je neemt ook deel in de ontwikkeling van nieuwe machine learning modellen en prototypes en evalueert deze met de data analisten.

Je communiceert bevindingen en aanbevelingen aan belanghebbenden, vaak door middel van visualisaties en presentaties.




Skills

Je bent pas afgestudeerd of hebt al ervaring, en beschikt over een masterdiploma in IT, Science (zoals wiskunde of fysica), of bent burgerlijk of industrieel ingenieur.
Je hebt kennis van R, Python (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, Pandas, NumPy), Exploratory Data Analysis.
Je hebt een affiniteit voor verschillende machine learning-algoritmen, zoals regressie, classificatie, clustering en deep learning.
Een eerste ervaring met Matplotlib, Seaborn, of Tableau en met big data technologie√´n (Hadoop, Spark of NoSQL databases) is een plus.
Je bent vertrouwd met databases en query-talen zoals SQL om gegevens effici√´nt te kunnen opslaan en ophalen.
Je spreekt Nederlands en je kunt je vloeiend uitdrukken in het Engels.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Data Scientist to join our team and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.




Who We Are

At Seedtag our goal is to lead the change in the advertising industry because we believe that effective advertising should not be at odds with users‚Äô privacy.

By combining Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision our proprietary, Machine Learning-based technology provides a human-like understanding of the content of the web that finds the best context for each ad while providing unparalleled risk-mitigation capabilities that protect advertisers from showing their ads on pages that could be damaging for their brand. All of this, without relying on cookies or any other tracking mechanisms.

Every day, our teams develop new services that reach over 200 million users worldwide with fast response times to ensure that we deliver the best user experience. We‚Äôre fully committed to the DevOps culture, where we provide the platform that our Software Developers and Data Scientists use to manage over 100 different microservices, pushing dozens of changes to production every day. All of this is built on top of Kubernetes in Google Cloud Platform and Amazon Web Services.

If you are interested in joining one of the fastest-growing scale-ups in Europe and working on massive scalability challenges, this is the place for you.




Your Challenge

As a member of our data science team, you will take on the task of developing bidding optimizations through NLP applications, such as large language models, scalable embeddings, and network analysis solutions.
You will be responsible for building and improving bidding functionalities which will have a direct impact on our client‚Äôs advertising KPIs.
You will explore the applicability of LLMs for production, crafting solutions that can handle real-world, large-scale challenges, particularly in areas like contextualization, personalization, and relevance optimization.
You will work on end-to-end projects, taking solutions from concept to production, and focusing on creating scalable, efficient, and impactful solutions.
Collaborating closely with our cross-functional teams, your work will be aligned with business goals and drive the practical application of your solutions.




Our core values

Outcome over output

Our core tech values reflect our commitment to delivering exceptional results, fostering a culture of continuous learning, and always putting the customer's needs first. We believe that success comes from focusing on the outcomes rather than just the output. Our tech team aims to solve problems that make a meaningful difference, and we measure our success by the impact we have on the customer.

Failure is allowed, learning is a must

We also recognize that failure is an inevitable part of the innovation process. Our team understands that setbacks are opportunities to learn and grow. We believe in testing early and often, and we continuously iterate and improve until we arrive at the best solution.

We are all scouts

Another core value we hold is that we are all scouts. We believe in leaving things better than we found them. This means we take ownership of our work and strive to improve the systems and processes we touch. We encourage our team members to be proactive in identifying areas for improvement, and we value those who take the initiative to implement positive changes. Our goal is to leave a lasting, positive impact on our projects and our team.

We are data-driven

Lastly, our team is data-driven. We believe that making informed decisions based on data is crucial to our success. Our team uses data to guide our decision-making process and to identify opportunities for improvement. We are committed to using data to continuously monitor and optimize our models and processes to ensure that we are delivering the best possible outcome for our customers.




Tech Stack

We have to support 120k requests per second running with ML models in production answering within 10 milliseconds! We have this running in production with Python and GoLang microservices using datalakes, GCS, Redis, Kinesis or Kafka. All this is constantly deployed in GCP using Kubernetes and other kinds of production stacks. The current stack outputs 20 TB of daily data having them ready to use for analytics and more with easy and low latency access.

In the rest of the company, we also develop in Typescript for Nodejs and Scala making use of technologies like Kafka, Druid and MongoDB all over the Google Cloud Platform.




What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed

You bring 3-5 years of experience in data science and machine learning, with relevant experience in developing ML/NLP applications at scale to address real-world business challenges.
You possess strong software engineering skills and a track record of deploying machine learning models in production environments, with proficiency in Python and experience in libraries relevant to NLP and embedding frameworks.
You have a strong academic background in fields such as Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar, with a focus on quantitative analysis and problem-solving.
You have hands-on experience with end-to-end project workflows, from data exploration to deployment, proven ability to scale embeddings for high-volume data environments, and are skilled at managing both the technical and business aspects of data projects.
You are proactive, entrepreneurial, and adaptable, with a commitment to leveraging data and machine learning to drive impactful, measurable business outcomes in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.




Why Join Seedtag?

Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to a 100% remote (Please note that while we operate as a 100% remote company, we can only extend contracts within Europe in countries where we have established legal entities: Spain, Italy, the UK, Belgium, the Netherlands, France, and Germany) or hybrid work setup, depending on what works best.

Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!




Additional Perks

Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.
Build your home office with a gross budget of up to 1K‚Ç¨ (external screen, chair, table...)
Paid travels to our HQ in Madrid to work p2p with your squad members
Macbook Pro M3




Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV and let‚Äôs grow together!




At Seedtag, we‚Äôre committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we‚Äôll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Show more
HTML:
We‚Äôre looking for a Data Scientist to join our team and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.


Who We Are

At Seedtag our goal is to lead the change in the advertising industry because we believe that effective advertising should not be at odds with users‚Äô privacy.

By combining Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision our proprietary, Machine Learning-based technology provides a human-like understanding of the content of the web that finds the best context for each ad while providing unparalleled risk-mitigation capabilities that protect advertisers from showing their ads on pages that could be damaging for their brand. All of this, without relying on cookies or any other tracking mechanisms.

Every day, our teams develop new services that reach over 200 million users worldwide with fast response times to ensure that we deliver the best user experience. We‚Äôre fully committed to the DevOps culture, where we provide the platform that our Software Developers and Data Scientists use to manage over 100 different microservices, pushing dozens of changes to production every day. All of this is built on top of Kubernetes in Google Cloud Platform and Amazon Web Services.

If you are interested in joining one of the fastest-growing scale-ups in Europe and working on massive scalability challenges, this is the place for you.


Your Challenge

  • As a member of our data science team, you will take on the task of developing bidding optimizations through NLP applications, such as large language models, scalable embeddings, and network analysis solutions.
  • You will be responsible for building and improving bidding functionalities which will have a direct impact on our client‚Äôs advertising KPIs.
  • You will explore the applicability of LLMs for production, crafting solutions that can handle real-world, large-scale challenges, particularly in areas like contextualization, personalization, and relevance optimization.
  • You will work on end-to-end projects, taking solutions from concept to production, and focusing on creating scalable, efficient, and impactful solutions.
  • Collaborating closely with our cross-functional teams, your work will be aligned with business goals and drive the practical application of your solutions.


Our core values

Our core tech values reflect our commitment to delivering exceptional results, fostering a culture of continuous learning, and always putting the customer's needs first. We believe that success comes from focusing on the outcomes rather than just the output. Our tech team aims to solve problems that make a meaningful difference, and we measure our success by the impact we have on the customer.

  • Failure is allowed, learning is a must

We also recognize that failure is an inevitable part of the innovation process. Our team understands that setbacks are opportunities to learn and grow. We believe in testing early and often, and we continuously iterate and improve until we arrive at the best solution.

  • We are all scouts

Another core value we hold is that we are all scouts. We believe in leaving things better than we found them. This means we take ownership of our work and strive to improve the systems and processes we touch. We encourage our team members to be proactive in identifying areas for improvement, and we value those who take the initiative to implement positive changes.   • We are data-driven
