The current stack outputs 20 TB of daily data having them ready to use for analytics and more with easy and low latency access.

In the rest of the company, we also develop in Typescript for Nodejs and Scala making use of technologies like Kafka, Druid and MongoDB all over the Google Cloud Platform.


What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed

  • You bring 3-5 years of experience in data science and machine learning, with relevant experience in developing ML/NLP applications at scale to address real-world business challenges.
  • You possess strong software engineering skills and a track record of deploying machine learning models in production environments, with proficiency in Python and experience in libraries relevant to NLP and embedding frameworks.
  • You have a strong academic background in fields such as Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar, with a focus on quantitative analysis and problem-solving.
  • You have hands-on experience with end-to-end project workflows, from data exploration to deployment, proven ability to scale embeddings for high-volume data environments, and are skilled at managing both the technical and business aspects of data projects.
  • You are proactive, entrepreneurial, and adaptable, with a commitment to leveraging data and machine learning to drive impactful, measurable business outcomes in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.


Why Join Seedtag?

Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to a 100% remote (Please note that while we operate as a 100% remote company, we can only extend contracts within Europe in countries where we have established legal entities: Spain, Italy, the UK, Belgium, the Netherlands, France, and Germany) or hybrid work setup, depending on what works best.

Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!


Additional Perks

  • Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
  • Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
  • Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
  • Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We have an exiting freelance opportunity for a Machine Learning engineer to work for a rapidly growing Retail organisation who are investing heavily in their AI/ML capability.




This is a remote role, but you must be eligible to work in the European Union for this one!




The opportunity:




This role will offer the selected contractor the opportunity to work to work on some truly cutting edge solutions, utilising their experience working with modern MLOps practices and large-scale, heterogeneous datasets.




You will be responsible for the design and development of robust AI/ML-based software solutions, including experimentation with large datasets, model selection, feature engineering, evaluation, deployment, and production monitoring.




The experience you need:




To be successful in this role, you will need to have at least 3 years Machine Learning experience, with a core 5-10 years software development background to compliment.




You will need to have proven experience programming in Python and deploying machine learning models in production with modern MLOps practices (e.g., CI/CD pipelines, containerization, automated testing).




The ideal candidate will also have Experience building ML platforms or developer tools, with exposure to experimentation platforms and statistical evaluation techniques.




Next steps:




We have interview slots pencilled in so please apply immediately if this sounds like the next role fo you.

Title: Data Scientist - Market Intelligence
Description:
CROSS-BORDER COMMERCE EUROPE MISSION




Cross-Border Commerce Europe is the EU Retail business accelerator providing valuable information and partner connections for companies that want to start or scale their cross- border e-trading within, from and to Europe. This positioning is unique on the EU market.




Cross-Border Commerce Europe, CBCommerce.eu, has become the recognized publishing, research and event group on EU Commerce business intelligence. This fast-growing knowledge and network platform boosts the International C-Level Retail executives‚Äô community from 9000+ companies. Members and partners of this European platform have access to bi-annual Cross-Border C-Suite events, quarterly Cross-Border eCommerce market research reports, weekly industry insights newsletter, blog and knowledge center with global benchmarking.




CROSS-BORDER COMMERCE EUROPE CORE VALUES




At CBCommerce.eu, we cultivate the following core values:




Customer first. At CBCommerce.eu, we provide our members and partners exceptional customer experience focusing on their cross-border interests and challenges to bring them added value. Not on competition.
Authenticity and transparency earn trust. We strive to build long-term relationships with members and partners, our team and third-party stakeholders.
Surprise and innovate. Creative and innovative ideas are part of our daily life. CBCommerce.eu states that innovation is one of the top company goals.
High quality standards. Focusing on high quality content, network events, research, working groups, C-Level Cross-Border Retail community.
Deliver ‚ÄúEurope First‚Äù results. With our HQ in Brussels, near the EU Commission and Parliament, we act and think ‚ÄúEurope First‚Äù to achieve major change.




Your Responsibilities:¬†

To support our core values and our record growth, we onboard a new position: Data Scientist - Market Intelligence. You will rework our database with a focus on the customer experience and its life- time value. You will develop, optimize and implement a data strategy to reinforce the company focus. You will work closely with the Market Research Manager as well as the Founder of Cross-Border Commerce Europe.¬†You are responsible for online European Retail surveys, online European Retail Market Intelligence project and CRM data collection and optimization. Playing with figures, data and trends for projects like the ranking TOP 500 EU is your daily activity. Your focus will be eCommerce Cross-Border within and outside Europe zooming on special topics like marketplaces, sustainability or specific countries and sectors like Fashion & Beauty, Consumer Electronics, DIY, Home & Garden.




Your focus:¬†

Develop an ambitious data structure aligned with the different activities of the company.¬†
Refine KPI‚Äôs segmentation features based on the set up of a customer lifetime value.¬†
Actualize the current data based on the previous findings.¬†
Define an NPS customer care strategy for both members and partners.¬†




Your Profile:




You have 2-3 years experience as Data Scientist - Market Research
Data is your passion. You master analytical skills and data-driven thinking and possess those skills.
Digital metrics and statistics. E-research, E-analytics, E-CRM.
You can demonstrate experience in running market research projects
You are Google Analytics certified
Knowledge of Similarweb, Woorank is an added value
You master Python, Github as well as Power BI
Fluent command of English is required
Affinity with e-commerce is a must
Digital-minded
You shine with your personality and your drive
You have studied Statistics & Economics with a data specialty
You are wanting and able to work from our HQ in Brussels¬†
You would like to grow together with this fast-growing start-up and young team¬†




OUR OFFER




CBCommerce offers an attractive package contract in line with your profile. You will have the unique opportunity to work in a fast-growing start-up. Boosting and shaping the future of EU Cross-Border Commerce. You will be part of an innovative Market Intelligence team.




Are you the Data Scientist - Market Research we are looking for?




We would be glad to hear from you!

We would be glad to hear from you!

Title: AI Scientist
Description:
Purpose

The AI Scientist at Keytrade Bank is a critical role in leveraging the potential of artificial intelligence to drive innovation, efficiency, and compliance within the bank. This individual will design, develop, and maintain AI systems while addressing governance, compliance, and ethical considerations. They will also enhance existing AI products and integrate advanced cloud-based technologies, ensuring Keytrade Bank remains a leader in the responsible and effective use of AI within the financial sector.







Reporting Line

The AI Scientist will report to the AI Innovation Lead and collaborate closely with the data feature team.







Responsibilities

Design, implement and test AI models to enhance decision-making, customer experiences, and operational efficiencies.
Maintain, optimize and test existing AI solutions, ensuring they adapt to emerging technologies and evolving business needs.
Collaborate with teams to integrate AI systems with UI technologies, such as Mendix, to enhance usability and functionality.
Implement and enhance MLOps/DevOps best practices for streamlined development, deployment, and monitoring of AI solutions.
Ensure responsible and ethical use of AI at Keytrade Bank, following guidelines of EU regulations (EU AI Act, GDPR‚Ä¶)
Help in establishing policies to govern the lifecycle of AI models, including accountability, fairness, and transparency.
Work with cross-functional teams to embed governance practices into the deployment of AI systems.
Collaborate with internal security and risk teams to assess and mitigate AI-related risks.
Stay informed about emerging trends in AI and cloud computing to recommend innovative solutions.
Translate technical AI concepts into actionable insights for stakeholders, including non-technical teams.
Support product teams in implementing AI-driven solutions and aligning them with business objectives.
Provide insights on AI products, data and AI governance, and emerging technology trends to colleagues and stakeholders through targeted workshops and ‚Äúlunch and learn‚Äù sessions.
Participate in training sessions, conferences, and industry events to enhance professional growth.
Provide training sessions as trainer in our data & AI Academy.




Skills and Requirements

Proficiency in Python, SQL, and familiarity with machine learning libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlo
w).Experience with cloud technologies (Azure or AW
S).Proficiency in MLOps/DevOps best practices, including CI/CD pipelines, containerization, and monitoring too
ls.Ability to manage AI and analytics projects with clear deliverables and KP
Is.Experience in AGILE development and cross-department collaborati
on.Excellent communication skills to present AI insights to diverse stakeholde
rs.Familiarity with UI/UX design principles and tools like Mendix for integrating AI products into customer-facing applicatio
ns.Knowledge of financial regulations affecting AI, including the EU AI Act, GDPR and other data protection laws.




Preferred attitude

Curiosity, humility and critical thinking
Problem-solving mindset and willingness to adapt to new challenges
Proactive, ethical, pragmatic and customer-focussed
Result-oriented with a strong focus on delivering high-quality outcomes for assigned tasks




Education and Experience

Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related fi

eld.2‚Äì6 years of experience in AI or data science roles, preferably within the banking or financial industry.




Our Offer

A 100 % Belgian contract in Brussels.
Keytrade Bank is a young and dynamic organization with a lean structure, that evolves in an Agile ecosystem. The tempo and the atmosphere are upbeat and no day goes by without an element of fun!
The company works in an agile setup with a lot of flexibility regarding remote work. This means that you will be guaranteed at least 50% homework with a high degree of flexibility.
Offices are in Watermael-Boitsfort in a peaceful, green surrounding.
A competitive salary with extra-legal advantages such as meal vouchers, group insurance, health insurance and many other.
Continued education and access to trainings.
Stepping stone for a continued career within Keytrade Bank.
Open, inclusive culture and dynamic working environment.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Join Our Team as a Data Scientist in the thriving iGaming Industry! üöÄ




üß©Who we are?

Ludicrum is redefining iGaming, blending creativity with technology to deliver world-class gaming experiences. From marketing and product development to customer support and financial reporting, our teams are changing the game. Our vision is to create ultra-intuitive and engaging platforms to fuel growth through strategic partnerships and market expansion.

Our success is driven by core values deeply embedded in our culture. We believe in transparency, always being clear, open, and honest. We are goal-focused, relentlessly pursuing our targets. Adaptability is key‚Äîwe embrace change and use it to excel. Kaizen guides us, as we continuously improve, test, and refine.

With a dynamic and collaborative culture and fast career growth, our 250+ global team thrives!




ü•ú In a nutshell

As a Data Scientist, you will turn complex data into impactful insights through statistical analysis, machine learning models, and experimental design. Your work will inform key decisions across product, marketing, and operations‚Äîhelping us uncover player behavior, improve retention, and scale smartly.




üéØ The responsibilities & the impact YOU will have:

Analyze large structured and unstructured datasets to identify trends and generate actionable insights.
Build and deploy machine learning models for forecasting, classification, and recommendation use cases.
Collaborate with stakeholders across departments to translate business problems into analytical solutions.
Design and run A/B tests and other experiments to measure the impact of product or process changes.
Create clear dashboards and visualizations that effectively communicate results to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Work closely with data engineers to ensure data quality and pipeline reliability.
Maintain thorough documentation of code, models, methodologies, and assumptions.
Stay current on emerging tools, techniques, and best practices in data science.




‚ö° All you need is‚Ä¶

Minimum 2 years of experience as a Data Scientist or similar analytical role, with strong command of SQL and experience working with large datasets.
Proficiency in Python (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn) or R for data analysis and building predictive models.
Hands-on experience with statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and A/B testing methodologies.
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Oracle BI, and ability to present insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Solid grasp of experimental design and a structured approach to validating data-driven decisions.
Working knowledge of version control tools like Git and collaboration across cross-functional teams.

Nice to have

Familiarity with streaming data tools like Apache Kafka or Spark Streaming.
Hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines and reproducible workflows.
Experience with distributed systems and working with large-scale datasets.
Proficiency with Oracle BI for dashboards and reporting.
Comfort using Jira for task and project tracking.




üåü Why You‚Äôll love working here:

Flexible and Remote Working: Work from anywhere, supporting your work-life balance.
Career Growth: We‚Äôre committed to your development, offering training and advancement opportunities.
Performance Bonuses: Earn bonuses based on company and personal performance.
Health and Fitness Benefits: Receive fitness reimbursements from day one, and after one year of employment, gain access to a health budget to support your well-being.
Extra Paid Annual Leave: Enjoy 22 days of vacation, with an additional day added for each year of employment, up to a maximum of 26 days.
Special Birthday Perk: Take your birthday off after a year of employment to celebrate!




We are not just offering a job; we offer the chance to be part of something bigger. Apply today! Submit your resume in English and join us in creating unforgettable experiences. We can‚Äôt wait to hear from you!

  • Build and deploy machine learning models for forecasting, classification, and recommendation use cases.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders across departments to translate business problems into analytical solutions.
  • Design and run A/B tests and other experiments to measure the impact of product or process changes.
  • Create clear dashboards and visualizations that effectively communicate results to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Work closely with data engineers to ensure data quality and pipeline reliability.
  • Maintain thorough documentation of code, models, methodologies, and assumptions.
  • Stay current on emerging tools, techniques, and best practices in data science.


‚ö° All you need is‚Ä¶

  • Minimum 2 years of experience as a Data Scientist or similar analytical role, with strong command of SQL and experience working with large datasets.
  • Proficiency in Python (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn) or R for data analysis and building predictive models.
  • Hands-on experience with statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and A/B testing methodologies.
  • Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Oracle BI, and ability to present insights to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Solid grasp of experimental design and a structured approach to validating data-driven decisions.
  • Working knowledge of version control tools like Git and collaboration across cross-functional teams.

Nice to have

  • Familiarity with streaming data tools like Apache Kafka or Spark Streaming.
  • Hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines and reproducible workflows.
  • Experience with distributed systems and working with large-scale datasets.
  • Proficiency with Oracle BI for dashboards and reporting.
  • Comfort using Jira for task and project tracking.


üåü Why You‚Äôll love working here:

  • Flexible and Remote Working: Work from anywhere, supporting your work-life balance.
  • Career Growth: We‚Äôre committed to your development, offering training and advancement opportunities.
  • Performance Bonuses: Earn bonuses based on company and personal performance.
  • Health and Fitness Benefits: Receive fitness reimbursements from day one, and after one year of employment, gain access to a health budget to support your well-being.
  • Extra Paid Annual Leave: Enjoy 22 days of vacation, with an additional day added for each year of employment, up to a maximum of 26 days.
  • Special Birthday Perk: Take your birthday off after a year of employment to celebrate!


We are not just offering a job; we offer the chance to be part of something bigger. Apply today! Submit your resume in English and join us in creating unforgettable experiences. We can‚Äôt wait to hear from you!

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
(FREELANCE)

Job Title: AI Engineer




Location: Brussels, Belgium

Job Type: Freelance

Industry: Manufacturing

Work Mode: Hybrid (On-site presence required 2 days/week)




About the Client:

Our client is a leading manufacturing company based in Brussels, committed to driving innovation through digital transformation and smart automation. They are currently investing in Artificial Intelligence to enhance operations, streamline production, and boost efficiency across their facilities.




Role Overview:

We are seeking a skilled AI Engineer to develop, implement, and optimize AI/ML solutions within the manufacturing environment. The ideal candidate will work closely with domain experts, data scientists, and process engineers to identify opportunities for AI integration, improve operational processes, and support data-driven decision-making.




Key Responsibilities:

Design and develop AI and ML models for use cases such as predictive maintenance, defect detection, process optimization, and demand forecasting.
Work with industrial IoT data, machine logs, and sensor data to train and validate models.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define AI opportunities and implement prototypes or production-grade solutions.
Deploy and monitor AI models in production environments using appropriate MLOps practices.
Translate business requirements into technical solutions that deliver real business impact.
Document models, processes, and findings in a clear and structured way for stakeholders.




Required Skills & Qualifications:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, AI, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field.
4+ years of experience in building and deploying AI/ML models, preferably in an industrial or manufacturing setting.
Strong experience with Python and libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP) and MLOps tools (MLflow, Kubeflow, etc.).
Experience working with time-series, sensor data, and/or image data (e.g., computer vision).
Knowledge of manufacturing systems (MES, PLCs, SCADA) is a plus.
Fluent in English; knowledge of French or Dutch is a strong advantage.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Over de functie

Als Data Scientist met een focus op het ontwikkelen van Proof of Concepts (POC's), speel je een sleutelrol in het verkennen, testen en valideren van innovatieve datagedreven oplossingen. Je werkt nauw samen met collega‚Äôs uit verschillende disciplines zoals business, IT en data engineering om snel idee√´n te vertalen naar werkende prototypes die de potentie hebben om op te schalen naar productie.

Jouw verantwoordelijkheden

Uitwerken en implementeren van POC‚Äôs op basis van businessvragen of nieuwe technologie√´n.
Analyseren van gestructureerde en ongestructureerde data om inzichten te genereren.
Ontwikkelen van voorspellende modellen, algoritmes of dataproducten in Python, R of vergelijkbare tools.
Visualiseren van resultaten en deze op een begrijpelijke manier presenteren aan stakeholders.
Samenwerken met data engineers en analisten om datamodellen te integreren in bredere oplossingen.
Signaleren van kansen voor data-innovatie binnen de organisatie.

Wat breng jij mee?

Minimaal 4-5 jaar ervaring als Data Scientist
Ervaring met programmeertalen zoals Python of R, en met tools als Jupyter, Git en SQL.
Bekendheid met machine learning libraries (scikit-learn, XGBoost, TensorFlow of vergelijkbaar).
Sterk analytisch denkvermogen en een pragmatische instelling.
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden en het vermogen om complexe materie helder uit te leggen.

Title: AI Scientist
Description:
The AI Scientist will play a key role in researching, designing, developing, and implementing AI-based solutions that drive business objectives and contribute to the advancement of our AI capabilities.




What we offer

Competitive compensation
Attractive benefits (security, flexibility, support and well-being)
Remote or hybrid working




What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Conduct in-depth analysis of project data from pharmaceutical companies, hospitals, and healthcare regions. This both includes executing existing code and adapting code to address novel questions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define project objectives and deliver actionable insights.
Explore and evaluate diverse datasets to identify patterns, trends, and correlations related to respiratory medicine.
Develop and implement data analysis methodologies and critically evaluate analysis pipelines and results, ensuring accuracy and reliability of results.
Utilize statistical techniques and machine learning algorithms to extract meaningful information from large datasets.
Work closely with clients to understand data requirements
Communicate findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through reports and presentations.
Meet project deadlines while maintaining a high level of accuracy and attention to detail.




Other responsibilities:

Maintain technical and industry knowledge by:
Following latest technical advancements and trends in the AI industry.
Attending and participating in applicable company-sponsored training.
Contribute to team effort by:
Working with internal staff to help solve problems and resolve issues.
Helping others achieve strong results.
Performing other duties as assigned.




What we look for

Master‚Äôs or PhD in Computer Science, Biomedical Engineering, Physics, or a related field.
Experienced with AI, including Machine learning, deep neural networks, data curation and model validation (2+ years of professional experience)
Efficient in Python and experience with code versioning tools such as Git
Previous experience with medical or clinical data
Previous experience with research projects (diagnostics, real world evidence or clinical trials projects are a plus)




At Clario, we put people first, always. We are united and driven by patients, committed to making a difference, and we are always looking for the best talent to help us transform lives. We value the contribution each of our people brings. It‚Äôs only through our people that we can continue to innovate technology that will shape the future of clinical trials.

Clario is committed to providing an inclusive workplace that welcomes diversity and equal opportunity. We encourage all qualified candidates who are passionate about sustainability, ethical business, and making a positive impact to apply for this role.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About US (GEMS):

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE‚Äôs assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity "Global Energy Management & Sales" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group‚Äôs large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

Our 4 areas of expertise:


Asset management
Energy transition services
Energy supply & global commodities
Risk management & market access


At GEMS we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.

More info on GEMS Hub ( https://gems.engie.com ) or LinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions ).

Context: The position belongs to the Quantitative Data Analysts team in Belgium (Brussels) specifically dedicated to assist the management of risks for belgian B2C and B2B Energy Suppliers. As a member of the quantitative analysts community of the Business Platform Downstream, one can also contribute to transversal projects impacting the activity of other commercial BUs. The main missions associated with the position are :


Based on data collection and analysis, to build models, tools, processes and data representations, that are used to manage the commodity risks linked to the dynamics of a Supply portfolio
The purpose of this work is to operate and optimize costing, forecasting, sourcing and hedging strategies, within a defined mandate


The quantitative analyst / data scientist will do the design, but also the development and ensure the delivery of these models and tools. Beyond that, he will also provide scientific expertise for bespoke analysis, related to data or models. Role:

The daily responsibilities of the new role will include:


Contribute to the development of the tools, models, process and portfolio/data representation used for

Representation of all commodity exposures and associated risks (evolution of the commercial position, climatic impact on short term consumption forecasts, ...)
New commercial offers
Customer behavior analysis

Ensure the run of models and derived operations
Provide BUs B2C and B2B Belgium with a deep knowledge of its commodity sales portfolios (Natural Gas, Power and Certificates) and optimally structure the portfolio representation
Use large range of data to ensure correct representation
Promote good practice, especially around data and code
Ensure code quality by following general rules and standards
Interact with other quantitative analysts/data scientists, to exchange about models, data, business or technical topics beyond the team

Hard skills:


Must have:

Strong scientific background: mathematics (probability/statistics), data science, machine learning, ideally with good command of time series forecasting
Strong skills in software (ideally Python) programming and related tools (versioning, etc.)
Willingness to embrace data handling and operational analytics
Practical thinking, hands-on approach
Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues to non-experts in a simple and pedagogic way

Good to have:

Interest for the Energy markets and Energy-transition topics
Knowledge of modern data science platforms and engines such as Databricks and Spark is a plus

Soft skills:


Must have:

Team-player, Transparent, Favor collaboration and working together




Good to have:

Practical thinking

Education and professional background:


University degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or Physics
Ideally 1-2 years of experience in the development of modelling tools, ideally with a good knowledge of electricity & gas markets


Languages:


F lu ent in En g lish


Travels:


Occasional travels (mostly to CWE countries)


If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!

Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals. All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

About ENGIE:

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (‚Äúraison d‚Äô√™tre‚Äù) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, power, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 96,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress.

Business Unit: GEMS

Division: GEMS - EC QUANTITATIVE RESEARCH & MODELING

Legal Entity: ELECTRABEL

Professional Experience: Skilled ( >3 experience <15 years)

Education Level: Master's Degree

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe‚Äôs leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let‚Äôs shape it together.

Job Description

We‚Äôre seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!‚ÄØ

You are fully convinced that data science isn‚Äôt a hype, but you also believe that, in order to be valuable and really make a company smarter, it must be done right. Your goal is therefore to create the most impactful solution possible in the quickest and easiest way possible so that real value can be extracted from data and artificial intelligence.‚ÄØ

Qualifications

We‚Äôre looking for someone who has:


A master‚Äôs degree in computer science, data science, mathematics, or a related field.
2 to 4 years of hands-on experience developing and implementing AI/ML models in production environments.
Strong Python programming skills, including experience with API-building frameworks such as FastAPI and prototyping tools like Streamlit.
Experience with machine learning libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar is considered a strong asset.
Solid understanding of machine learning including model evaluation techniques and familiarity with advanced applications such as: NLP, forecasting, optimization, computer vision.
Experience in working with cloud-based environments (Azure, AWS, or GCP) and ML pipelines is a strong asset.
Experience with Generative AI technologies, prompt engineering, and large language models, is a strong asset.
Hands-on knowledge of vector databases (e.g., FAISS, Pinecone, Azure AI Search) for semantic search and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipelines is a strong asset.
Strong communication and business analysis skills and genuinely interested in understanding the customer‚Äôs business context and challenges.
You can explain complex technical concepts in simple, accessible language to non-technical stakeholders.
A collaborative, open-minded mindset and a drive to keep learning in a fast-evolving field.
You're fluent in Dutch or French, as well as English.


What we can offer:


A dynamic role within OptimAI, a leading AI competence center focused on applied, impactful AI.
The opportunity to work on real-world projects across sectors, from logistics and government to healthcare and finance.
Access to expert colleagues, mentorship, and tailored learning opportunities to accelerate your growth.
A flexible hybrid work model and a strong focus on work-life balance.
A culture of innovation, inclusion, and continuous improvement where your ideas and input are valued.


Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe‚Äôs Leading Digital Service Provider.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That‚Äôs why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!‚ÄØ

At OptimAI, we combine the best of both worlds: data science and supply chain optimization. You will be part of a forward-thinking team where you can shape the future of data science and supply chain management. This is an excellent opportunity to make a real difference and grow your career in a field that is rapidly evolving and in high demand.

If you thrive on challenge, continuous learning, and want to make an impact in a fast-growing field, apply now to join the OptimAI Team.

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!‚ÄØ

You are fully convinced that data science isn‚Äôt a hype, but you also believe that, in order to be valuable and really make a company smarter, it must be done right. Your goal is therefore to create the most impactful solution possible in the quickest and easiest way possible so that real value can be extracted from data and artificial intelligence.‚ÄØ

Qualifications

We‚Äôre looking for someone who has:

  • A master‚Äôs degree in computer science, data science, mathematics, or a related field.
  • 2 to 4 years of hands-on experience developing and implementing AI/ML models in production environments.
  • Strong Python programming skills, including experience with API-building frameworks such as FastAPI and prototyping tools like Streamlit.
  • Experience with machine learning libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar is considered a strong asset.
  • Solid understanding of machine learning including model evaluation techniques and familiarity with advanced applications such as: NLP, forecasting, optimization, computer vision.
  • Experience in working with cloud-based environments (Azure, AWS, or GCP) and ML pipelines is a strong asset.
  • Experience with Generative AI technologies, prompt engineering, and large language models, is a strong asset.
  • Hands-on knowledge of vector databases (e.g., FAISS, Pinecone, Azure AI Search) for semantic search and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipelines is a strong asset.
  • Strong communication and business analysis skills and genuinely interested in understanding the customer‚Äôs business context and challenges.
  • You can explain complex technical concepts in simple, accessible language to non-technical stakeholders.
  • A collaborative, open-minded mindset and a drive to keep learning in a fast-evolving field.
  • You're fluent in Dutch or French, as well as English.

What we can offer:

  • A dynamic role within OptimAI, a leading AI competence center focused on applied, impactful AI.
  • The opportunity to work on real-world projects across sectors, from logistics and government to healthcare and finance.
  • Access to expert colleagues, mentorship, and tailored learning opportunities to accelerate your growth.
  • A flexible hybrid work model and a strong focus on work-life balance.
  • A culture of innovation, inclusion, and continuous improvement where your ideas and input are valued.

Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe‚Äôs Leading Digital Service Provider.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:

  • A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
  • Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
  • The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.

People are the cornerstone of our success. That‚Äôs why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!‚ÄØ

At OptimAI, we combine the best of both worlds: data science and supply chain optimization. You will be part of a forward-thinking team where you can shape the future of data science and supply chain management. This is an excellent opportunity to make a real difference and grow your career in a field that is rapidly evolving and in high demand.

If you thrive on challenge, continuous learning, and want to make an impact in a fast-growing field, apply now to join the OptimAI Team.

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
For an Insurance company, we are looking for a talented AI data scientist with a business mindset coupled with a strong expertise in (Gen)AI. The successful candidate will work in a dynamic environment that presents opportunities to apply analytical skills to solve business problems.




About the Role

The successful candidate will work in a dynamic environment that presents opportunities to apply analytical skills to solve business problems.




Responsibilities

Work closely with business and technical teams to identify high-impact use cases for Generative AI
Design, develop, and implement AI driven solutions for business needs, using both internal and external data sources.
Identify and communicate insights from data analysis to support decision-making and problem solving activities.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve data-related issues.
Continuously monitor AI models for accuracy, and proactively identify and resolve data discrepancies and drift.
Contribute to the development of a GenAI capability framework and internal best practices.




Qualifications

Master's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Business) or a related field with a strong focus on data analysis.




Required Skills

Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Manage multiple priorities
Meet tight deadlines
Availability for occasional travel and projects in other operating companies
Proven experience with data wrangling, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and machine learning.
Proficient in Python and commonly used libraries (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, etc.).
Strong knowledge of cloud platforms, especially Azure (Azure AI services, Azure ML, Vertex AI, Databricks, Azure OpenAI, etc.)
Deep expertise with Python libraries such as Langchain, LangGraph, Promptflow, Semantic Kernel, and Autogen.
Deep understanding of LLMs fine-tuning and/or training lifecycle (LLMops).
Proven experience in deploying and monitoring Gen AI models using CI/CD pipelines, Weight & Biases, and GitHub workflows.




Preferred Skills

Strong business acumen and the ability to understand and communicate business needs and requirements.
Data science, preferably in a business setting.







Start date & duration

Expected Start date: Asap

Duration: 24 months (Depending on project evolution, extension is possible)

Developing multi agent systems

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
We are building the world's greatest community of remote technologists!




Today, organizations that understand the value of remote working will reap the rewards. Because it doesn‚Äôt just provide team members with a healthier work-life balance ‚Äî it gives you the opportunity to access the brightest minds in the world.




Our clients access our community to build or extend their existing teams. All are made up of remote, distributed software engineering experts ‚Äî best-in-class. Rapidly deployed without compromising on quality.




Join our Remobi community to work on meaningful, innovative freelance projects and play a key role in shaping how companies operate.




üìÖ Duration: Until end of September 2025 (likely extension)

‚è± Hours: Part-Time ‚Äì 20 hours per week

üåç Location: Fully Remote (EU-based candidates only)

üìÑ Contract Type: Freelance / B2B / Contract




Summary:




We‚Äôre looking for a highly skilled AI Engineer to join a cutting-edge project with one of the world‚Äôs largest energy companies. You‚Äôll build AI-driven solutions that go beyond traditional NLP ‚Äî leveraging LLMs, RAG pipelines, and generative AI methods to transform how the business retrieves and interacts with unstructured data across the enterprise.




This is a part-time, high-impact role ideal for someone who thrives on solving complex NLP problems using modern AI tools and technologies.




How You‚Äôll Make an Impact




You will be responsible for:




Building and optimizing retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipelines to search and synthesize insights from internal documentation
Applying generative AI techniques and LLMs to enhance document intelligence and question-answering systems
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand NLP challenges and deliver tailored AI-powered solutions
Working with Python, vector databases (e.g., FAISS, Pinecone, Weaviate), and embedding models to create semantic search workflows
Integrating your work into production environments using scalable APIs and cloud infrastructure
Staying up to date on the latest advancements in open-source LLMs, prompt engineering, and NLP research




What You Bring (Skills, Capabilities)




Strong software engineering skills in Python, with a focus on AI/ML/NLP applications
Hands-on experience with LLMs (e.g., GPT-4, Claude, LLaMA, Mistral) and building RAG systems
Experience working with LangChain, LlamaIndex, or similar frameworks
Proficiency in vector search, embedding generation, and document chunking
Solid understanding of cloud infrastructure, containerization (Docker/Kubernetes), and deployment best practices
A proactive mindset and the ability to operate independently in a fully remote, part-time setting
Bonus: Experience in large enterprise or industrial domains (e.g., energy, manufacturing)

Title: Young Professional AI Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe‚Äôs leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let‚Äôs shape it together.

Job Description

Are you passionate about Data Science and AI? As a Young Professional AI Engineer, you‚Äôll be part of OptimAI, a dynamic team that drives innovation in the world of data science and supply chain management through cutting-edge technologies and data-driven solutions.

You‚Äôll join a highly collaborative team working on exciting and impactful projects focused on leveraging data science techniques to solve complex problems. Using agile methodologies, you will support the development of smart, innovative solutions for our clients, helping them navigate AI challenges and drive their digital transformation.

As part of the OptimAI Team, you will:


Contribute to the technical design and implementation of data science and AI solutions.
Work with state-of-the-art tools and techniques in data analysis, machine learning, optimization models, and predictive analytics.
Play an active role in analyzing large datasets, identifying trends, and creating actionable insights.
Collaborate with internal experts and clients to develop tailored solutions and ensure successful project execution.


Qualifications

Skills & Experience We‚Äôre Looking For:


A Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics or a related field.
Practical experience or strong interest in applying data science techniques such as machine learning, statistical modeling.
Knowledge of programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, and experience with tools like Pandas, TensorFlow, or scikit-learn is a plus.
Exposure to optimization algorithms (e.g., linear programming, heuristic methods) is highly desirable.
You're fluent in Dutch or French, have a strong grasp of the other, and speak English fluently as well.


What We Offer You:


A comprehensive training program with access to the Sopra Steria Academy, focused on both technical and personal development.
The opportunity to work with leading experts in data science and AI.
Access to over 250 training courses, specialized certifications, and coaching sessions to fast-track your professional growth.
Exposure to challenging and impactful projects with international clients across various industries.
A competitive salary, company car lease or mobility budget, laptop, smartphone, and other benefits like insurance, meal vouchers, and monthly office drinks.


Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe‚Äôs Leading Digital Service Provider.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That‚Äôs why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ

At OptimAI, we combine the best of both worlds: data science and supply chain optimization. You will be part of a forward-thinking team where you can shape the future of data science and supply chain management. This is an excellent opportunity to make a real difference and grow your career in a field that is rapidly evolving and in high demand.

Title: Data Scientist II - Agriculture Analytics (Machine Learning / Geospatial)
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues‚Äîat all levels‚Äîwill invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won‚Äôt find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have


Continuous learning Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You‚Äôll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm‚Äôs diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package, which includes medical, dental, mental health, and vision coverage for you, your spouse/partner, and children.


Your Impact

You will leverage industry knowledge and analytical expertise to provide insights both to clients as part of client service teams and within the agricultural analytics team (ACRE) by strengthening the core products and algorithms we build for clients. You can expect to split your time delivering impact at clients (including up to ~50% travel to client sites) and building up ACRE‚Äôs core analytical offerings.

As a member of client service teams, you will leverage your creativity and problem-solving skills to tackle clients‚Äô most pressing issues using an analytical lens, meeting client needs and communicating your work to executive audiences. Issues to solve could include determining the suitability (now and in the future given impacts of climate change) of growing different types of crops across different geographies, using local agronomic data and satellite imagery to determine market potential for input products, or optimizing farm operations using yield forecasting. Your work will often include heavy geospatial components and/or predictive analytics components.

When working internally with the ACRE team, you will build innovative algorithms and products (what we call ‚ÄúIP development‚Äù) to best meet our most common client needs. You will use global data such as geospatial, biological, economic and climatological data to develop proprietary solutions. You will work with our engineers to design new interfaces to deliver faster, more impactful insights to our clients.

Along the way, you will receive best-in-class training in structuring business problems and serving as a client adviser and have opportunities to work closely with and learn from our senior agriculture practitioners and industry players that are shaping the future of food production. You will get access to unparalleled career acceleration, with a huge amount of ownership and responsibility from the get-go in a collaborative, diverse, non-hierarchical environment. You will get the opportunity to travel to client sites, locally and around the world. Lastly, you will be able to provide direct and measurable impact to some of the largest agribusiness players around the globe.

We encourage you to submit a cover letter to highlight why you believe that you are a unique fit for our team and what we do! We will read it.

You‚Äôll work with McKinsey‚Äôs agricultural analytics team (ACRE) in Brussels.

Our Agriculture Practice advises agribusiness, consumer food, government, and investor clients on strategic, marketing & sales, and operations issues, helping support industry-shaping decisions that impact the future of global food production.

Within this group, ACRE is a team of expert consultants, data scientists, and engineers focused on bringing cutting-edge analytics to our agribusiness clients. We apply real-time data and advanced analytics ‚Äì generally predictive or geospatial in nature ‚Äì to solve the biggest problems currently facing global agricultural markets, driving insights at the micro and macro levels.

ACRE is an agile team within the firm whose goal is to use the latest analytical methods, incubate new technologies and drive innovative ways to develop new opportunities for the firm to make significant and lasting client impact ‚Äì redefining what it means to provide the ‚Äúbest of the firm‚Äù to our clients.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative and/or agriculture-related discipline, such as data science/computer science, crop science/agronomy, animal sciences, geography/GIS, mathematics/statistics, environmental sciences & engineering
Agronomy/crop science, animal sciences, field-level yield forecasting experience preferred
Geospatial and spatiotemporal analysis, remote sensing, image processing experience preferred
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, paired with the ability to develop creative and efficient solutions
Proven experience in applying data science and machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems, preferably in the agriculture sector
Strong proficiency in Python to develop clean, efficient pipelines and workflows, ensuring reproducibility and effective team collaboration
Experience with version control and frameworks methodologies, preferred
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Strong multitasking and parallel development abilities
Strong interpersonal communication skills
Creative, naturally curious, and willing to take intellectual risks
Able to work under competing, quickly changing priorities, manage expectations effectively and support the team under pressure; highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through
Willingness to travel up to 50%
Self-management skills and ability to work as part of an Agile team preferred
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
ü§ñ The Job

At Dataroots, we couple our excellent consulting services with our technical expertise to build advanced machine learning models to improve business processes across a variety of industries, with a strong focus on DataOps and MLOps. As a Machine Learning Engineer, you'll be an integral part of our in-house team of AI specialists, designing and implementing models that deliver robust, data-driven solutions for our clients.




Passionate about data, you enjoy diving deep to uncover actionable insights and develop machine learning models that enhance client operations. You‚Äôll experiment with different approaches, while collaborating with Data Engineers, Cloud Architects, and Data Strategists to drive the delivery of tailored, high-quality, end-to-end solutions.




You‚Äôll also have the opportunity to mentor colleagues, share knowledge, and stay on top of industry developments through a range of initiatives we support internally.




üéâ What you'll find at Dataroots

Since 2016, Dataroots has been committing its excellent consulting services to help clients excel in their data-driven operations. Our approach focuses on team well-being, fostering diversity, and promoting knowledge sharing. By focusing on these values, we've achieved healthy and sustainable growth over the years. Through our consulting services, we actively encourage professional growth by exposing our employees to different industries, tools, technologies,... broadening their scope in the process.

As part of the Talan Group, we are able to take this approach to the next level, adding the element of international mobility to our employees‚Äô career journey.

Join a team where your work will have a direct impact on both our clients and our journey. Learn more about our DNA at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].




üíº What we‚Äôre looking for

You bring the following qualities & experiences to the role:

A deep passion for Machine Learning and a Master‚Äôs or PhD in a quantitative discipline.
Strong foundation in software design principles.
A minimum of 2 years of experience in machine learning and big data.
Expertise in machine learning and deep learning, with both a theoretical and practical grasp.
Proficiency in Python & SQL is a must; knowledge of R is an advantage.
Experience with deploying machine learning models and familiarity with MLOps practices.
At least a first experience with AWS, Azure or GCP and a solid understanding of cloud engineering and its use in Machine Learning.
Experience with ML versioning tooling.
Enthusiasm for working with large datasets and a pragmatic approach to problem-solving.
Strong communication skills and the ability to simplify complex technical concepts for clients.
Fluency in English and Dutch.




Don't worry if you don‚Äôt meet every requirement from the start. Most of all we are looking for colleagues with the same passion for personal and team development as the rest of us.




üí∞ The Offer

An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:

+ Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card

+ Hospitalisation and group insurance

+ High-end laptop

+ Smartphone with subscription

+ Substantial amount of holidays

+ Meal vouchers

+ ...

Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you‚Äôll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organization of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
A training budget for individual and team learning opportunities.
Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.




üìç Where you‚Äôll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.




üéØ Ready to join Dataroots?

Excited to shape the future of AI as a Machine Learning Engineer with us? We‚Äôre looking forward to hearing from you! Apply now and start a new chapter with Dataroots! üéâ

Title: AI Scientist
Description:
Purpose

The AI Scientist at Keytrade Bank is a critical role in leveraging the potential of artificial intelligence to drive innovation, efficiency, and compliance within the bank. This individual will design, develop, and maintain AI systems while addressing governance, compliance, and ethical considerations. They will also enhance existing AI products and integrate advanced cloud-based technologies, ensuring Keytrade Bank remains a leader in the responsible and effective use of AI within the financial sector.







Reporting Line

The AI Scientist will report to the AI Innovation Lead and collaborate closely with the data feature team.







Responsibilities

Design, implement and test AI models to enhance decision-making, customer experiences, and operational efficiencies.
Maintain, optimize and test existing AI solutions, ensuring they adapt to emerging technologies and evolving business needs.
Collaborate with teams to integrate AI systems with UI technologies, such as Mendix, to enhance usability and functionality.
Implement and enhance MLOps/DevOps best practices for streamlined development, deployment, and monitoring of AI solutions.
Ensure responsible and ethical use of AI at Keytrade Bank, following guidelines of EU regulations (EU AI Act, GDPR‚Ä¶)
Help in establishing policies to govern the lifecycle of AI models, including accountability, fairness, and transparency.
Work with cross-functional teams to embed governance practices into the deployment of AI systems.
Collaborate with internal security and risk teams to assess and mitigate AI-related risks.
Stay informed about emerging trends in AI and cloud computing to recommend innovative solutions.
Translate technical AI concepts into actionable insights for stakeholders, including non-technical teams.
Support product teams in implementing AI-driven solutions and aligning them with business objectives.
Provide insights on AI products, data and AI governance, and emerging technology trends to colleagues and stakeholders through targeted workshops and ‚Äúlunch and learn‚Äù sessions.
Participate in training sessions, conferences, and industry events to enhance professional growth.
Provide training sessions as trainer in our data & AI Academy.




Skills and Requirements

Proficiency in Python, SQL, and familiarity with machine learning libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlo
w).Experience with cloud technologies (Azure or AW
S).Proficiency in MLOps/DevOps best practices, including CI/CD pipelines, containerization, and monitoring too
ls.Ability to manage AI and analytics projects with clear deliverables and KP
Is.Experience in AGILE development and cross-department collaborati
on.Excellent communication skills to present AI insights to diverse stakeholde
rs.Familiarity with UI/UX design principles and tools like Mendix for integrating AI products into customer-facing applicatio
ns.Knowledge of financial regulations affecting AI, including the EU AI Act, GDPR and other data protection laws.




Preferred attitude

Curiosity, humility and critical thinking
Problem-solving mindset and willingness to adapt to new challenges
Proactive, ethical, pragmatic and customer-focussed
Result-oriented with a strong focus on delivering high-quality outcomes for assigned tasks




Education and Experience

Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related fi

eld.2‚Äì6 years of experience in AI or data science roles, preferably within the banking or financial industry.




Our Offer

A 100 % Belgian contract in Brussels.
Keytrade Bank is a young and dynamic organization with a lean structure, that evolves in an Agile ecosystem. The tempo and the atmosphere are upbeat and no day goes by without an element of fun!
The company works in an agile setup with a lot of flexibility regarding remote work. This means that you will be guaranteed at least 50% homework with a high degree of flexibility.
Offices are in Watermael-Boitsfort in a peaceful, green surrounding.
A competitive salary with extra-legal advantages such as meal vouchers, group insurance, health insurance and many other.
Continued education and access to trainings.
Stepping stone for a continued career within Keytrade Bank.
Open, inclusive culture and dynamic working environment.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About US (GEMS):

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE‚Äôs assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity "Global Energy Management & Sales" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group‚Äôs large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

Our 4 areas of expertise:


Asset management
Energy transition services
Energy supply & global commodities
Risk management & market access


At GEMS we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.

More info on GEMS Hub ( https://gems.engie.com ) or LinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions ).

Context: The position belongs to the Quantitative Data Analysts team in Belgium (Brussels) specifically dedicated to assist the management of risks for belgian B2C and B2B Energy Suppliers. As a member of the quantitative analysts community of the Business Platform Downstream, one can also contribute to transversal projects impacting the activity of other commercial BUs. The main missions associated with the position are :


Based on data collection and analysis, to build models, tools, processes and data representations, that are used to manage the commodity risks linked to the dynamics of a Supply portfolio
The purpose of this work is to operate and optimize costing, forecasting, sourcing and hedging strategies, within a defined mandate


The quantitative analyst / data scientist will do the design, but also the development and ensure the delivery of these models and tools. Beyond that, he will also provide scientific expertise for bespoke analysis, related to data or models. Role:

The daily responsibilities of the new role will include:


Contribute to the development of the tools, models, process and portfolio/data representation used for

Representation of all commodity exposures and associated risks (evolution of the commercial position, climatic impact on short term consumption forecasts, ...)
New commercial offers
Customer behavior analysis

Ensure the run of models and derived operations
Provide BUs B2C and B2B Belgium with a deep knowledge of its commodity sales portfolios (Natural Gas, Power and Certificates) and optimally structure the portfolio representation
Use large range of data to ensure correct representation
Promote good practice, especially around data and code
Ensure code quality by following general rules and standards
Interact with other quantitative analysts/data scientists, to exchange about models, data, business or technical topics beyond the team

Hard skills:


Must have:

Strong scientific background: mathematics (probability/statistics), data science, machine learning, ideally with good command of time series forecasting
Strong skills in software (ideally Python) programming and related tools (versioning, etc.)
Willingness to embrace data handling and operational analytics
Practical thinking, hands-on approach
Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues to non-experts in a simple and pedagogic way

Good to have:

Interest for the Energy markets and Energy-transition topics
Knowledge of modern data science platforms and engines such as Databricks and Spark is a plus

Soft skills:


Must have:

Team-player, Transparent, Favor collaboration and working together




Good to have:

Practical thinking

Education and professional background:

About US (GEMS):

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE‚Äôs assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity "Global Energy Management & Sales" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group‚Äôs large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

Our 4 areas of expertise:

  • Asset management
  • Energy transition services
  • Energy supply & global commodities
  • Risk management & market access

At GEMS we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.

More info on GEMS Hub ( https://gems.engie.com ) or LinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions ).

Context: The position belongs to the Quantitative Data Analysts team in Belgium (Brussels) specifically dedicated to assist the management of risks for belgian B2C and B2B Energy Suppliers. As a member of the quantitative analysts community of the Business Platform Downstream, one can also contribute to transversal projects impacting the activity of other commercial BUs. The main missions associated with the position are :

  • Based on data collection and analysis, to build models, tools, processes and data representations, that are used to manage the commodity risks linked to the dynamics of a Supply portfolio
  • The purpose of this work is to operate and optimize costing, forecasting, sourcing and hedging strategies, within a defined mandate

The quantitative analyst / data scientist will do the design, but also the development and ensure the delivery of these models and tools. Beyond that, he will also provide scientific expertise for bespoke analysis, related to data or models. Role:

The daily responsibilities of the new role will include:

  • Contribute to the development of the tools, models, process and portfolio/data representation used for
    • Representation of all commodity exposures and associated risks (evolution of the commercial position, climatic impact on short term consumption forecasts, ...)
    • New commercial offers
    • Customer behavior analysis
  • Ensure the run of models and derived operations
  • Provide BUs B2C and B2B Belgium with a deep knowledge of its commodity sales portfolios (Natural Gas, Power and Certificates) and optimally structure the portfolio representation
  • Use large range of data to ensure correct representation
  • Promote good practice, especially around data and code
  • Ensure code quality by following general rules and standards
  • Interact with other quantitative analysts/data scientists, to exchange about models, data, business or technical topics beyond the team
Hard skills:

  • Must have:
    • Strong scientific background: mathematics (probability/statistics), data science, machine learning, ideally with good command of time series forecasting
    • Strong skills in software (ideally Python) programming and related tools (versioning, etc.)
    • Willingness to embrace data handling and operational analytics
    • Practical thinking, hands-on approach
    • Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues to non-experts in a simple and pedagogic way
  • Good to have:
    • Interest for the Energy markets and Energy-transition topics
    • Knowledge of modern data science platforms and engines such as Databricks and Spark is a plus
Soft skills:

  • Must have:
    • Team-player, Transparent, Favor collaboration and working together


  • Good to have:
    • Practical thinking
Education and professional background:

  • University degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or Physics
  • Ideally 1-2 years of experience in the development of modelling tools, ideally with a good knowledge of electricity & gas markets

Languages:

  • F lu ent in En g lish

Travels:

  • Occasional travels (mostly to CWE countries)

If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!

Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.

All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.
