Title: Machine Learning / AI Internship (f/m/x) 80‚Äì100%, 6‚Äì12 Months
Description:
About Us

comparis.ch is the leading comparison platform in Switzerland. We have been comparing the prices and products of health insurers, other insurance companies, telecom providers and banks for over 25 years and offer the largest Swiss online marketplace for cars and property. Our comprehensive comparisons ensure transparency for our users and help them make the right decisions. With over 80 million visits each year, we rank among the most widely used websites in Switzerland. Four out of five people recognize us as THE independent comparison platform in Switzerland.

Are you curious about machine learning and AI, and want to see how it all works in a real company? We‚Äôre looking for an open-minded and motivated intern to join our data team for 6 to 12 months. This is your chance to dive into real projects, bring your own ideas to the table, and learn how AI is used to solve practical problems.

What You Will Do


Help develop and improve machine learning models, especially in the area of Generative AI.
Work on a variety of use cases and support the implementation and optimization of ML algorithms.
Get involved in preparing training data: exploring, cleaning, and organizing data so it‚Äôs ready for our models.
Play a part in rolling out and shaping AI tools across the company.


What We Expect From You


Curiosity and a genuine interest in finding data-driven solutions.
Currently studying computer science, data science, or something similar.
Some experience with at least one programming language (like Python, Scala, or Java).
An interest in modern AI models (like large language models) is a plus.
Fluent English skills.


In return, here is what you can expect from us

At Comparis, we believe that empowered employees deliver the best results. We cultivate a culture of transparency, mutual respect and trust. Firm believers in lifelong learning, we are always trying out new things and continuously developing ‚Äì both as individuals and as a team. We also offer flat hierarchies, considerable autonomy and creative freedom, as well as a skilled and motivated team that will advise and support you in your work and make it easy for you to push your own boundaries. Finally, we offer flexible working hours and the freedom to work from almost anywhere you choose. Whether you're enjoying a workation in the Portuguese Algarve, collaborating from a caf√© in Barcelona, or connecting from a mountain chalet in the Swiss Alps, our diverse team of talented professionals spans across Europe, creating an inclusive and dynamic work environment

Then don't hesitate and apply for our position today. If you have any questions, Daphne, our People Management Lead, will be happy to help. We look forward to receiving your application!

With over 80 million visits each year, we rank among the most widely used websites in Switzerland. Four out of five people recognize us as THE independent comparison platform in Switzerland.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Vitol is a leader in energy and commodities. Vitol produces, manages and delivers energy and commodities to consumers and industry worldwide. In addition to its primary business of trading, Vitol is invested in infrastructure globally, with $10+billion invested in long-term assets.

Vitol‚Äôs customers include national oil companies, multinationals, leading industrial companies and utilities. Founded in Rotterdam in 1966, today Vitol serves its customers from some 40 offices worldwide. Revenues in 2023 were $400bn.

For more information: vitol.com

Job Description

As our portfolio of work continues to grow, we are looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer to join our data science and machine learning team. The individual will work closely with the data and machine learning specialists, software engineers and commercial teams to deliver machine learning models and applications.

We work across the trading business, operations, and other support functions; so the individual will need to be comfortable working with a variety of stakeholders and technologies.

The Machine Learning Engineer at Vitol has visibility and impact across the full project workflow: from working with business stakeholders to help define the project, to data collation and processing, exploratory analysis, model selection and tuning, and implementation of production models.

The successful candidate will join a team of experienced, collaborative practitioners, who are (pragmatically) solving some of the most challenging and impactful problems the energy industry is facing; as well as pushing the boundaries around the ‚Äòart of the possible‚Äô.

Core Responsibilities Include


Being an energetic and enthusiastic member of a team uniquely positioned to bring the power of data to bear on the inner workings of the energy industry
Leading design, development, and deployment of machine learning systems, bringing their technical knowledge and experience into the team, and using this to create real solutions to real problems
Collaborating with cross-functional technology teams to gather requirements and ensure the solutions align with business objectives
Helping integrate the team‚Äôs solutions (including generative AI) into existing systems and platforms to provide seamless user experiences and scale adoption
Actively participating in code reviews, experiment design and tooling decisions to help drive the team‚Äôs velocity and quality
Helping build data and machine learning expertise within the business through knowledge sharing


Qualifications


Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field. Ph.D. is a plus
Fluency in Python with the ability to write clean, modular, well-documented code as well as a solid understanding of coding best practices
3-5+ years in industry developing and deploying machine learning models
Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Transformers
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS) and containerization technologies (Docker)
Excellent problem-solving skills, ability to work independently and in a team
Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Understanding of machine learning fundamentals, including deep learning, generative models, NLP techniques, etc.


Desired Experience


Experience in the energy or commodities trading industry, with knowledge of financial markets and trading concepts
Experience integrating machine learning systems into interactive dashboards (e.g. Dash, Streamlit) and present use cases of machine learning to non-technical colleagues
Time series modelling (both machine-learning and econometric approaches)
Application of a wide range of ML methodologies to real life applications
Enterprise software development (systems design, code review, version control, etc.)
Data orchestrators (Airflow, Dagster) and cloud-based ETL/ELT pipelines
Awareness of continuous integration and delivery concepts/technologies


Additional Information

Personal Characteristics


A self-motivated individual who thrives on seeing the results of their work make an impact in the business
Strong communication skills, both verbally and in writing
Proven ability to be flexible, work hard, and a sense for the art of the possible
Methodical, organized and with an attention to detail - in general, in experimental design, and in code!
Willingness to share their knowledge and learn from others
An interest in learning about the commodities space
Resourceful, able to think creatively and adapt in a dynamic environment
Team player, with an open non-political style and a high level of integrity
Desire to be a thought-partner in a fast-growing team, and make an impact at a business that sits at the heart of the world‚Äôs energy flows


What We Offer


Competitive salary and benefits package
Large diversity of projects with real-world impacts on a truly global scale
Entrepreneurial environment within a flat hierarchy, where great ideas come to life quickly
Close collaboration with various business units across our key regions (eg. London, Singapore, Houston, Geneva)
A highly motivated DS and ML team comprised of experienced individuals with a supportive attitude and great team spirit
Being part of the energy transition through increased emphasis on renewable & alternative energy sources at a pivotal moment in the industry
Strong management commitment to incorporating machine learning into the future of Vitol‚Äôs operations
Show more

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
üß† Artificial Intelligence Engineer (Remote, Switzerland)

Build smarter systems. Shape the future. All from where you work best.

üìç Location: Remote (based in Switzerland)

üïí Type: Full-time

üíº Department: Engineering / R&D / AI

üöÄ About the Role

We‚Äôre looking for a talented and forward-thinking Artificial Intelligence Engineer to help us design, build, and deploy intelligent systems that make a real-world impact.

You‚Äôll work on cutting-edge machine learning models, natural language processing, computer vision, or recommendation systems (depending on your strengths). You‚Äôll collaborate across teams to turn ideas and data into working AI-powered products‚Äîfrom concept to deployment.

If you‚Äôre excited by building things that learn, think, and improve‚Äîthis is your moment. üåçü§ñ

üõ†Ô∏è What You‚Äôll Do
Design and implement AI/ML models using Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar frameworks
Preprocess and analyze large datasets to train and fine-tune models
Work with data scientists, product managers, and software engineers to bring AI solutions into production
Evaluate model performance and iterate for improvement (A/B testing, drift monitoring, etc.)
Build scalable APIs and integrate models into real-time systems
Stay up to date with state-of-the-art developments in AI/ML research
Help define and build internal AI tools or pipelines for long-term scalability
‚úÖ You‚Äôre a Great Fit If You:
Have 2‚Äì5+ years of experience in AI, machine learning, or deep learning engineering
Are fluent in Python and experienced with ML frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, scikit-learn)
Have worked on real-world ML projects (NLP, CV, time series, or similar)
Understand software engineering fundamentals, version control (Git), and cloud deployment
Can communicate technical ideas clearly in English (written & spoken)
Are self-motivated, curious, and thrive in a remote-first environment
‚öôÔ∏è Bonus Points For:
Experience with LLMs, transformers, or fine-tuning foundation models
Familiarity with MLOps tools (e.g., MLflow, Airflow, Weights & Biases)
Contributions to open-source AI projects or academic publications
Cloud experience (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Swiss/EU work permit or Swiss citizenship
üéÅ What We Offer
Fully remote role based in Switzerland üèûÔ∏è
Competitive Swiss-market salary üí∞
Flexible working hours (async-friendly team)
Annual learning & development budget for courses, conferences, or papers üìö
Paid vacation, public holidays & wellness days
Opportunity to work on real, production-grade AI systems‚Äînot just proof-of-concepts
A curious, friendly, and impact-driven team culture üöÄ
üì¨ How to Apply

Please send us:

Your CV or LinkedIn profile
A short note (or video) about an AI project you‚Äôve built or contributed to
GitHub, portfolio, or research links (if available)
Your location and availability

You build machines that learn.

We build a team that empowers you to do it from anywhere.

Title: Data Scientist in Sustainability
Description:
Why you'll love Quantis

For nearly two decades, our dynamic and visionary team has partnered with organizations across the globe to transform their industries and pave the way for a planetary economy that aligns business with nature. We strive to be agents of change, helping companies transform from business as usual to business at its best.

We believe that sustainable transformation is possible and within our power. We're contributing to this transformation by combining the latest science with strategic business insights. Our advice enables global leaders in the consumer goods and finance industries to understand how to reduce their environmental impacts, implement change successfully, and operate within planetary boundaries.

Motivated by this common purpose, our 300+ talented professionals cultivate a unique, collaborative culture that we call the Quantis Spirit. We are innovative. We are impact-oriented. We are science-based. We are Quantis.

Join us!

As a Data Scientist at Quantis, you will contribute to the development of digital products and Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) databases. Your work will support global companies in measuring, understanding, and reducing their environmental impact.

Joining the Quantis data team means...


Actively contribute to the evolution of Quantis LCA databases, by developing approaches for data collection, manipulation, processing, and maintenance.
Collaborate closely with LCA specialists and environmental engineers, ensuring rigorous scientific accuracy.
Develop deep sector-specific data expertise in our priority industries: food & beverage, apparel, and cosmetics.
Engage directly with leading sustainability professionals and leverage their insights to build impactful data solutions.



Does this describe you?


You are passionate and driven to use your technical and analytical expertise to advance global sustainability and align businesses with Planetary Boundaries.
You hold a Master's degree (or higher) in Data Science, Environmental Engineering, Computer Science, or a closely related field.‚ÄØ
You have robust data manipulation skills and a proven track record of building data-driven models and applications.
You are proficient in Python, enthusiastic about AI and machine learning, and actively exploring innovative applications of LLMs and related technologies.
You excel at working with structured and semi-structured data sets and enjoy transforming complex data into meaningful insights.
You have excellent interpersonal and communication skills, able to clearly present complex analytical concepts to diverse audiences.
You thrive in collaborative team environments, providing technical guidance, mentoring colleagues, and contributing to team growth.
You communicate clearly and confidently in fluent English; proficiency in French would be an advantage.



Additional nice-to-have knowledge:


You have prior experience or substantial familiarity with Life Cycle Assessment (LCA).
You possess knowledge in agricultural modeling or other sustainability-focused sectors.


Join us and be part of a dedicated team committed to making a tangible impact on environmental sustainability through advanced data science.

Some logistics to consider


Location: Lausanne or Z√ºrich
Optimal start date: as soon as possible
Frequent collaboration with other Quantis branches (Boston, Paris, Berlin, and Milan) via web-conferences or in-person
Ability to travel occasionally for internal meetings


Quantis has a distinctive, fluid structure nurtured by our Quantis Spirit and our way of collaborating that provides a positive and unique working environment.

Quantis Diversity-Equity-Inclusion Statement

At Quantis, the principles of DEI have always been an essential part of our identity, our values and our mission. Our commitment is to elevate the voices of all Quantisians to foster an inclusive culture where all employees feel that they belong and are valued. Our goal is to create a workforce that reflects the diversity of all the places where we live and work. This extends to our clients, their clients, and their entire value chain as sustainable thinking and collective representation are integral components of our purpose to transform the way that businesses operate.
Show more

Title: Head of Scientists
Description:
üöÄ Lead Strategic Science Across Key Therapeutic Areas




We‚Äôre looking for a visionary Head of Scientists to lead the pre-clinical research strategy. You‚Äôll oversee multiple therapeutic areas, with a strong focus on neuroscience and cardiometabolism. This is a senior leadership role for someone ready to shape impactful, translational research in the FMCG industry.




üî¨ Key Responsibilities

Define and lead scientific strategy across health and disease programs.
Guide high-impact research in neuroscience, cardiometabolic diseases & oral health.
Manage and mentor a multidisciplinary team of scientists.
Oversee project planning, execution, and scientific communication.

PhD
12+ years of preclinical or translational research experience.
Deep expertise in both neuroscience and cardiometabolism.
Preferred expertise in pharmacology.
Proven leadership in cross-functional research teams.
Strong communication and strategic planning skills.
Fluent in English.

Apply now and help transform global health through innovation.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About Us

Giotto.ai is a deep-tech growth start-up, headquartered in Lausanne, on a mission to turn frontier machine-learning theory into a production-grade product for enterprises (G-expert). We‚Äôre a 20-person, venture-backed team that values scientific rigor, clean engineering, and a healthy dose of audacity. Every line of code you ship will move the state-of-the-art forward fast.

What You‚Äôll do

Build and evolve G-Expert: design and develop new product components that enterprises rely on daily.

Tackle real-world problems with our customers: lead the implementation of G-expert within enterprise and government customers.

Advance the science: Experiment with novel architectures alongside our researchers, and bring the innovation back into our product.

Champion best practices: CI/CD, automated testing, observability, and ruthless optimisation for latency, cost, and reproducibility.

Grow the team culture: lead code reviews, mentor interns, and share learnings in internal knowledge sharing sessions.

You‚Äôll Thrive Here If You‚Ä¶

Hold a M.Sc./Ph.D. from EPFL, ETH Z√ºrich, or a peer-tier technical university with a focus on ML or a closely related field.
Have 1-3 years of professional experience‚Äîwe care more about the depth of your projects than the length of your CV.
Can point to hands-on ML work (research code, Kaggle gold, OSS contributions, start-up internship, etc.) that demonstrates mastery of:
Python, NumPy, Pandas
Deep learning frameworks (PyTorch, Transformers by HF, etc.)
Modern training tricks (tuning, quantisation, distributed training, etc.)
Write production-ready code: you test, profile, document, and CI/CD-all-the-things.
Communicate crisply in English and enjoy collaborating across disciplines.
Have the grit and curiosity to own problems end-to-end in a fast-moving environment.

Bonus Points

Publications at NeurIPS/ICML/CVPR/ACL or similar.
Experience with edge technologies such as text diffusion models, RLHF-frameworks,‚Ä¶
Familiarity with cloud-native ML stacks (AWS/GCP, Docker, K8s, Terraform).

What We Offer

Competitive salary & options‚Äîwe want you to think like an owner.
Hybrid-remote flexibility with modern offices steps from Lausanne Gare.
5 weeks paid vacation.
Annual learning stipend (conferences, MOOCs, textbooks), and the time to use it.
Top-of-the-line hardware budget‚Äîchoose your rig.
Relocation and visa support if needed.

HTML:
About Us

Giotto.ai is a deep-tech growth start-up, headquartered in Lausanne, on a mission to turn frontier machine-learning theory into a production-grade product for enterprises (G-expert). We‚Äôre a 20-person, venture-backed team that values scientific rigor, clean engineering, and a healthy dose of audacity. Every line of code you ship will move the state-of-the-art forward fast.

What You‚Äôll do

Build and evolve G-Expert: design and develop new product components that enterprises rely on daily.

Tackle real-world problems with our customers: lead the implementation of G-expert within enterprise and government customers.

Advance the science: Experiment with novel architectures alongside our researchers, and bring the innovation back into our product.

Champion best practices: CI/CD, automated testing, observability, and ruthless optimisation for latency, cost, and reproducibility.

Grow the team culture: lead code reviews, mentor interns, and share learnings in internal knowledge sharing sessions.

You‚Äôll Thrive Here If You‚Ä¶

  • Hold a M.Sc./Ph.D. from EPFL, ETH Z√ºrich, or a peer-tier technical university with a focus on ML or a closely related field.
  • Have 1-3 years of professional experience‚Äîwe care more about the depth of your projects than the length of your CV.
  • Can point to hands-on ML work (research code, Kaggle gold, OSS contributions, start-up internship, etc.) that demonstrates mastery of:
  • Python, NumPy, Pandas
  • Deep learning frameworks (PyTorch, Transformers by HF, etc.)
  • Modern training tricks (tuning, quantisation, distributed training, etc.)
  • Write production-ready code: you test, profile, document, and CI/CD-all-the-things.
  • Communicate crisply in English and enjoy collaborating across disciplines.
  • Have the grit and curiosity to own problems end-to-end in a fast-moving environment.

Bonus Points

  • Publications at NeurIPS/ICML/CVPR/ACL or similar.
  • Experience with edge technologies such as text diffusion models, RLHF-frameworks,‚Ä¶
  • Familiarity with cloud-native ML stacks (AWS/GCP, Docker, K8s, Terraform).

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary & options‚Äîwe want you to think like an owner.
  • Hybrid-remote flexibility with modern offices steps from Lausanne Gare.
  • 5 weeks paid vacation.
  • Annual learning stipend (conferences, MOOCs, textbooks), and the time to use it.
  • Top-of-the-line hardware budget‚Äîchoose your rig.
  • Relocation and visa support if needed.

Title: Data Scientist in Sustainability
Description:
Why you'll love Quantis

For nearly two decades, our dynamic and visionary team has partnered with organizations across the globe to transform their industries and pave the way for a planetary economy that aligns business with nature. We strive to be agents of change, helping companies transform from business as usual to business at its best.

We believe that sustainable transformation is possible and within our power. We're contributing to this transformation by combining the latest science with strategic business insights. Our advice enables global leaders in the consumer goods and finance industries to understand how to reduce their environmental impacts, implement change successfully, and operate within planetary boundaries.

Motivated by this common purpose, our 300+ talented professionals cultivate a unique, collaborative culture that we call the Quantis Spirit. We are innovative. We are impact-oriented. We are science-based. We are Quantis.

Join us!

As a Data Scientist at Quantis, you will contribute to the development of digital products and Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) databases. Your work will support global companies in measuring, understanding, and reducing their environmental impact.

Joining the Quantis data team means...


Actively contribute to the evolution of Quantis LCA databases, by developing approaches for data collection, manipulation, processing, and maintenance.
Collaborate closely with LCA specialists and environmental engineers, ensuring rigorous scientific accuracy.
Develop deep sector-specific data expertise in our priority industries: food & beverage, apparel, and cosmetics.
Engage directly with leading sustainability professionals and leverage their insights to build impactful data solutions.



Does this describe you?


You are passionate and driven to use your technical and analytical expertise to advance global sustainability and align businesses with Planetary Boundaries.
You hold a Master's degree (or higher) in Data Science, Environmental Engineering, Computer Science, or a closely related field.‚ÄØ
You have robust data manipulation skills and a proven track record of building data-driven models and applications.
You are proficient in Python, enthusiastic about AI and machine learning, and actively exploring innovative applications of LLMs and related technologies.
You excel at working with structured and semi-structured data sets and enjoy transforming complex data into meaningful insights.
You have excellent interpersonal and communication skills, able to clearly present complex analytical concepts to diverse audiences.
You thrive in collaborative team environments, providing technical guidance, mentoring colleagues, and contributing to team growth.
You communicate clearly and confidently in fluent English; proficiency in French would be an advantage.



Additional nice-to-have knowledge:


You have prior experience or substantial familiarity with Life Cycle Assessment (LCA).
You possess knowledge in agricultural modeling or other sustainability-focused sectors.


Join us and be part of a dedicated team committed to making a tangible impact on environmental sustainability through advanced data science.

Some logistics to consider


Location: Lausanne or Z√ºrich
Optimal start date: as soon as possible
Frequent collaboration with other Quantis branches (Boston, Paris, Berlin, and Milan) via web-conferences or in-person
Ability to travel occasionally for internal meetings


Quantis has a distinctive, fluid structure nurtured by our Quantis Spirit and our way of collaborating that provides a positive and unique working environment.

Quantis Diversity-Equity-Inclusion Statement

At Quantis, the principles of DEI have always been an essential part of our identity, our values and our mission. Our commitment is to elevate the voices of all Quantisians to foster an inclusive culture where all employees feel that they belong and are valued. Our goal is to create a workforce that reflects the diversity of all the places where we live and work. This extends to our clients, their clients, and their entire value chain as sustainable thinking and collective representation are integral components of our purpose to transform the way that businesses operate.

Title: Early Careers Programme, Fall 2025 Cohort
Description:
6-month duration based in Geneva, Beijing, Mumbai, Tokyo




Please note that we can offer work authorization support for Geneva-based roles only.




The World Economic Forum, committed to improving the state of the world, engages the foremost political, business, and other leaders of society to build coalitions and initiatives ‚Äì digitally and physically ‚Äì to address industry, regional and systemic issues.

As part of our global team of over 1‚Äô000+ employees across six offices representing more than 100 nationalities, you will have the opportunity to influence systems level change, build communities of action, and broaden your perspective.




Programme Overview




We believe that early career talents are an essential and vibrant part of our community. The Early Careers Programme provides an exciting opportunity for participants to get a feel for working at the Forum, bringing in fresh ideas and gaining valuable real-world experience.

The positions we offer are best suited to bachelor‚Äôs and master‚Äôs program graduates, with a maximum of 2 years cumulated work experience.

Conditions and benefits of the Early Careers Programme

Full-time onsite employment contract of 6 months at a World Economic Forum office
Programme start dates between 15 September and 15 October 2025
Monthly gross compensation of CHF 4‚Äô500 (salary and medical allowance) / CNY 12‚Äô500 (salary) / INR 91‚Äô666 / JPY 333‚Äô333




How to apply




Please review the opportunity below and use the ‚ÄúApply‚Äù link to submit your resume and responses application questions, indicating which functional and thematic areas are best suited for you.

Applications will be accepted until Sunday, 15 June 2025 at which point the talent acquisition team will initiate the screening process. Interviews with selected candidates will be scheduled throughout the month of June and July with the aim of completing the full hiring process by 15 August 2025.




What you will do




As a participant in our Early Careers Programme, you will have the opportunity to work within specific functional areas, gaining hands-on experience and contributing to impactful projects. Throughout the programme, you'll collaborate with experienced professionals and develop a diverse skill set that can accelerate your career.




Below are the different areas where you can work and develop your expertise:




Stakeholder engagement - Engage and maintain relationships with strategic partners and stakeholders or Project, content and policy management - responsible for research, project management, and content development to support various strategic initiatives, partnerships, or regional and industry contexts

Below are the possible thematic you chose to focus on:

Advanced Manufacturing and Supply Chains
AI, Technology and Digital Innovation
Economic Growth, Equity and Inclusion, Human Capital and Skills
Energy and Materials
Financial and Monetary Systems
Regional Agenda, Trade and Geopolitics
Health and Healthcare
Sustainability, Nature and Climate
Urban Transformation




Data and analytics - responsible for collecting, analysing, and interpreting data to support informed decision-making and strategic planning around Forum and Centre initiatives, or to support the development of research and flagship reports




Technology innovation and digital success - Drive the development and adoption of technologies and digital strategies to enhance the Forum's initiatives and maximize the impact of global collaboration




Core enabling Functions

Below are the functional areas the programme may be recruiting for:

Business development and key account management
Event management and global programming
Finance, Procurement, Legal and Compliance
Hospitality, Facility Management
Marketing, communications and media relations
People & Culture




Skills and competencies you will develop at the Forum

Sense of Mission - motivated by the organization's mission and a commitment to improving the state of the world
Teamwork and Collaboration - ability to work cooperatively in diverse teams, contributing to group goals and supporting colleagues.
Communication - verbal and written communication abilities to effectively convey ideas and collaborate with team members and stakeholders.
Problem-Solving - critically evaluate information, identify patterns, and develop insights to support decision-making processes.
Adaptability and Resilience - embrace change and quickly adjust to new environments, technologies, and methodologies.







Why work at the Forum:




The Forum believes that progress happens by bringing together people from all walks of life who have the drive and the influence to improve the state of the world by building awareness and cooperation, shaping mindsets and agendas, and driving collective action. Join us and become a driver for positive change!

Title: AI Training Director
Description:
About Us

At Visium, we enable enterprise executives in defining their AI & Data strategy, execute large scale transformations and implement AI across operations, ensuring their organization becomes future-proof.

With expertise in strategy, architecture, cloud engineering, analytics, artificial intelligence and machine learning, we empower our clients to unleash and scale the power of their data.

We're on a mission to pioneer a bright future and build future-proof and ethical organizations . Join the curious, the ambitious, the doers, the good-hearted, the ones who build a world we're all in awe of - our Visumees.

Ready to become one?

Role

As the AI Training Director, you will spearhead our AI education and adoption efforts. You'll design and lead engaging workshops, guide clients through their AI journeys, and develop training programs that demystify AI while driving strategic innovation. You'll be a key partner in shaping how organisations use AI to unlock value.

This could be part of your next challenge:


AI Education & Enablement
Design and lead tailored AI workshops for executives, teams, and technical audiences
Translate complex AI concepts into accessible, engaging training experiences
Develop scalable learning paths, from AI literacy to applied innovation
Client Transformation & Innovation
Guide enterprise clients through AI adoption strategies, use case identification, and roadmap development
Partner with business and technical leaders to drive AI maturity within their organizations
Infuse innovation thinking into all engagements, challenging conventional approaches with AI-driven possibilities
Sales & Growth Support
Collaborate with sales and business development teams to position training as a strategic offering
Participate in pre-sales conversations, client briefings, and proposal development
Identify new business opportunities and help shape custom training and innovation engagements
Thought Leadership & Strategy
Represent the company in external events, webinars, and executive roundtables as a subject matter expert
Stay ahead of AI and LLM trends, incorporating emerging technologies into offerings
Continuously improve and evolve training content based on client feedback and market needs



Requirements

This should be part of your background to apply:


8 - 10 years in a combination of roles such as AI consulting, technical training, enterprise transformation, or innovation leadership
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science or equivalent experience
Solid grasp of AI/ML concepts, tools, and industry applications. Experience with generative AI (e.g., GPT, Claude, Gemini) is a strong plus
Proven ability to lead workshops and executive briefings with clarity, empathy, and authority
Prior experience with enterprise AI adoption projects
Familiarity with change management and organizational learning principles
Ability to bridge the gap between technology and business strategy, with a focus on practical impact
Exceptional communicator, skilled in simplifying technical subjects for non-technical audiences
Passion for exploring emerging technologies and applying them creatively to solve business problems
Fluent in English and French or German is a must



Benefits

What we offer


A competitive compensation package
A yearly education budget to steep your learning curve
A yearly sport budget because a fit body leads to a fit mind
A flexible working culture because your work-life balance matters to us
A position that enables you to have an impact on 1'000s of people, and the whole company's growth
An international, knowledgeable, and passionate team with a strong collaborative mindset


Check our LinkedIn and website to learn more about us & don't hesitate to contact us if you have any questions.

Title: MLOps Engineer (f/m/d)
Description:
Who we are

At viboo, we‚Äôre pioneering the way to operate commercial buildings. Since buildings are one of the largest sources of carbon emissions globally, we made it our mission to reduce their environmental impact. Our easy-to-retrofit, cloud and AI-native Building Management Systems (BMS) minimizes heating energy consumption while helping owners cut operational costs and enhance occupant comfort.

We're looking for an ML/MLOps Engineer to join our purpose-driven ETH spin-off‚Äîeither immediately or by mutual agreement. In this role, your expertise in deploying, operating, and maintaining machine learning services will be instrumental in making our vision becoming reality.




About the job

As an ML/MLOps Engineer, you will be responsible for:

Designing, building, and maintaining end-to-end ML-pipelines using Kubeflow, ensuring scalability and robustness.
Implementing advanced testing strategies for ML-pipelines ‚Äì such as simulation-based testing ‚Äì to support continuous integration and ensure reliability.
Develop and maintain reliable deployment strategies for ML-pipelines and models (e.g. canary deployment).
Ensure consistent and reliable model operation across a variety of execution modes: scheduled jobs, integration within constrained optimization frameworks (Model Predictive Control), or real-time inference.
Implement and manage monitoring solutions to detect model drift, control performance drops, etc. using Grafana and Prometheus.
Orchestrate and manage containerized ML workloads using Kubernetes and Kubeflow on Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Conducting peer reviews of code written by other developers, debugging issues, and optimizing overall platform performance.




What you offer

Background in Computer Science, Data Science, or related technical field.
5+ years of professional experience in MLOps, with a strong track record of delivering production-grade solutions.
Proven expertise in deploying and managing machine learning workloads using Kubernetes and Kubeflow.¬†
Hands-on experience in developing time series ML models, including feature engineering, hyperparameter tuning, and model evaluation in Python.
Experience working with public cloud platforms, particularly Google Cloud Platform (GCP) is an advantage.
Familiarity with monitoring and alerting tools. Grafana and Prometheus is beneficial.¬†¬†
Experience with PostgreSQL or similar relational databases is considered a plus.¬†
Independent work style, hands-on mentality, and strong teamwork skills.
Fluent in English (at least C1 level) and excellent communication skills in general.




What we offer

An international, smart, and enthusiastic team with a clear vision.
A meaningful job in a DeepTech startup committed to sustainability.
Exciting insights into the rapidly growing and emerging AI industry.
Short decision paths, flat hierarchies, and the opportunity to shape the company.
Competitive salary package, including an employee stock option plan (ESOP).
Hybrid/remote work options and flexible working hours.
A steep learning curve to accelerate your career and individual training opportunities.
Regular team events.




Interested? Please send an email with your motivation and CV to benjamin.huber@viboo.io

Title: Carriera Diplomazia Profilo I (anno di nascita 1995 o successivo)
Company: Federal Department of Foreign Affairs FDFA
Description:
Direzione delle risorse DR, 100-100%, Zollikofen e all'estero

Il contributo che pu√≤ dare


Rappresentare gli interessi e i valori della Confederazione Svizzera sulla base della strategia di politica estera del Consiglio federale
Raccogliere e fornire informazioni, analisi e altri contenuti a sostegno del processo decisionale in materia di politica estera e rispondere alle richieste delle istituzioni politiche (Consiglio federale e Parlamento) e della popolazione svizzera
Sviluppare e curare reti di contatti
Assumersi la responsabilit√† dei dossier in ambito politico, economico, giuridico, scientifico, culturale, tecnologico ecc. e promuoverli in contesti bilaterali e multilaterali
Lavorare su progetti in svariati settori
Fornire sostegno alle imprese e ai cittadini svizzeri nel Paese ospite


Che cosa La contraddistingue


Diploma universitario (almeno bachelor e master, v. dettagli pi√π in basso)
Sono auspicate esperienze professionali pregresse (minimo 1 anno) ed esperienze all'estero (minimo 6 mesi)
Eccellente comprensione della politica svizzera
Mentalit√† aperta, predisposizione all'apprendimento, spirito d'iniziativa, intraprendenza e approccio interdisciplinare
Flessibilit√†, capacit√† di adattamento e resistenza allo stress
Eccellenti capacit√† di comunicazione, intelligenza emotiva, competenze interculturali e sociali
Capacit√† di riflettere in maniera critica, di considerare diversi punti di vista e di rappresentare le posizioni della Svizzera indipendentemente dalla propria opinione
Livello C1 in due lingue ufficiali e in inglese

Questa funzione permette di contribuire attivamente a forgiare la politica estera della Svizzera. Diploma, incl. attestato con note

Che cosa ci rende speciali

Il Dipartimento federale degli affari esteri (DFAE) coordina e definisce, su mandato del Consiglio federale, la politica estera della Svizzera, tutela gli interessi del Paese e promuove i valori della Svizzera.

Lavorare per la SvizzeraCi adoperiamo per il modello di successo svizzero e lavoriamo per il benessere della popolazione.

Vivere la diversit√†La concretizzazione delle pari opportunit√† ci consente di esprimere al meglio le nostre competenze e di contemplare punti di vista differenti.

In forma sul posto di lavoroForniamo supporto e consulenza alle nostre collaboratrici e ai nostri collaboratori sulla tematica della salute fisica e mentale.

Prospettive professionaliGrazie a un'offerta di formazione e di formazione continua sempre aggiornata, promuoviamo lo sviluppo personale e professionale delle nostre collaboratrici e dei nostri collaboratori.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?

At the core of Epic‚Äôs success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it‚Äôs building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we‚Äôre always innovating.

Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We‚Äôre constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.

ENGINEERING - UNREAL ENGINE

What We Do

Unreal-powered projects have been on the bleeding edge of real-time entertainment for over 20 years. Our team of engineering experts are always innovating to improve the tools and technology that empower content developers worldwide.

What You'll Do

We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to push the limits of our NeuralNetworkEngine (NNE). NNE is the backbone of many ML applications in and outside Epic and comprises multiple inference backends running on various target systems. You will work closely with the team and other teams across Epic to keep UE‚Äôs ML inference engine at the forefront of the industry and thus you will be part of the foundational pillar for many ML products.

In this role, you will


Improve the MLIR/LLVM compiler toolchain to produce more performant ML code
Optimize neural network shader kernels within Unreal Engine
Update, maintain and extend different inference backends inside NNE
Collaborate with teams across Epic to integrate NNE into their products



What We're Looking For


Programming skills in C/C++ and Python
Experience with GPU programming (CUDA, DirectX or Metal) and shader languages (HLSL or GLSL)
Experience with ML frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or JAX
Experience optimizing ML models for real-time inference on GPUs
Strong collaboration and communication skills
Ability to design and train a neural network given a problem would be an asset
Experience with MLIR and LLVM would be an asset



EPIC JOB + EPIC BENEFITS = EPIC LIFE

Our current benefits package includes sick pay and insurance, supplementary accident insurance (100% employer paid), as well as, a generous pension plan. We also offer a robust mental well-being program through Modern Health, which provides free therapy and coaching for employees & dependents.

About Us

Epic Games spans across 25 countries with 46 studios and 4,500+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we've been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic's award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.

Like what you hear? Come be a part of something Epic!

Epic Games deeply values diverse teams and an inclusive work culture, and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. Learn more about our Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Policy here.

Note to Recruitment Agencies: Epic does not accept any unsolicited resumes or approaches from any unauthorized third party (including recruitment or placement agencies) (i.e., a third party with whom we do not have a negotiated and validly executed agreement). We will not pay any fees to any unauthorized third party. Further details on these matters can be found here.
Show more

Title: Biotechnologist
Description:
Our client, a global market leader in the production and process support of active pharmaceutical ingredients, both in the chemical and biotechnology sectors, is looking for a







Biotechnologist ‚Äì 6529







Our client is a leading pharmaceutical company focused on biopharmaceuticals, is currently recruiting for a Biotechnologist with relevant experience to support the team




This role is an initial contract starting as soon as possible until the end of the year, with extension already planned, to be based in Visp, Switzerland.







Main Responsibilities:

Executes manufacturing activities in the area of Drug Product according to cGMP guidelines, ensuring batch execution, evaluating test results, resolving issues, troubleshoot manufacturing equipment and make recommendations for resolution.
Provides front line technical and procedural support, working with the manufacturing team.
Securing each batch is manufactured safely, on time, in compliance with the batch instructions and quality requirements
Responsible for establishing timely and with high quality the required production documentation (preparation, execution and review of batch records) or other relevant GMP documents for the assigned production area.
Supports process related investigations and assists in decision making on production issues
Supports process changes and CAPAs related to processes within required timelines
Performs training activities of relevant areas as operator and supports others and new joiners.
Operating, setting up and cleaning production equipment and premises for the production of liquid and freeze-dried drug forms (e.g.:compounding, parts washing, autoclaving, filter integrity testing, visual inspection))







Qualifications and Experience:

Relevant working/residency permit or Swiss/EU-Citizenship required
2-4 years of experience GMP environment on the shopfloor (preferably in sterile manufacturing of Drug Product)
Fluent in either English or German (preferably both)
Familiarity with GMP requirements, quality procedures and SOP execution
Strong team orientation
Effective communication skills and interaction with a variety of interfaces within the organization
Structured, focused, and well-organized working attitude
High motivation and dynamic drive
IT knowledge and knowledge in SAP and MES is a benefit
Prepared to work in 2 shifts pattern

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Gen AI)
Description:
Summary

The AI & Computational Science (AICS) team at Biomedical Research, Novartis is at the forefront of innovating drug discovery with AI. Our mission is to accelerate the development of transformative medicines for patients worldwide. AICS is looking for a highly motivated technical and scientific leader in the field of Generative AI to push the boundaries of disease understanding and drug discovery. In this role, you will have the opportunity to create impact at the intersection of scientific research, drug discovery, and AI.

About The Role

What you will bring to the role:


Designing, developing, implementing, training, testing, and refining modern deep learning AI models for data that is typically represented as sequences, such as text, graphs, or biological sequences (e.g., DNA, RNA, or proteins).
Applying a deep understanding of foundation models, including pre-trained and large language models, to build generative AI applications in the domains of biology, chemistry, and text.
Designing and developing innovative AI model architectures that leverage principles from encoder/decoders, jointly trained models, Siamese-twin models, VAEs, GANs, etc. You will also be involved in advanced training methods such as GPT and Diffusion, and developing/refining learning objectives including self-supervision.
Taking a hands-on role and delivering on highly visible projects.
Conducting applied AI experiments using scientific, rigorous, and reproducible methodologies on internal and public datasets to ensure publishable results.
Serving as an ambassador for AI/Data Science by presenting and publishing articles.
Building bridges between academia, technology, and industry partners.
Keeping up-to-date with the latest developments in the field and mentoring associates.
Being part of a unique organization and working with an interdisciplinary team of highly accomplished scientists to push the frontiers of AI in disease understanding and drug discovery.


Minimum Requirements


Master‚Äôs degree (PhD is highly desirable) in a computational field including, but not limited to: AI, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Computational Biology/Chemistry, Engineering, Statistics, and Physics
3 - 5 years of deep, hands-on experience working on AI projects with clear evidence of significant projects personally developed and delivered and/or publication track record
3 - 5 years of experience in working with large scale, realistic data sets and analyzing results towards specific business/scientific outcomes
Extensive experience with Large Language Models (LLMs), including prompt engineering, use of embeddings, RAG, LangChain, and application architectures using LLMs.
Expert-level Python programming skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team and elevate the team's performance in all aspects.
Cloud computing optimization for high-performance AI model training.
Experience in pharma, biotech, or healthcare is a big plus but not essential as a strong tech background with the willingness to adapt to pharma is acceptable.


Novartis is committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve.

Why Novartis: Helping people with disease and their families takes more than innovative science. It takes a community of smart, passionate people like you. Collaborating, supporting and inspiring each other. Combining to achieve breakthroughs that change patients‚Äô lives. Ready to create a brighter future together? https://www.novartis.com/about/strategy/people-and-culture

Join our Novartis Network: Not the right Novartis role for you? Sign up to our talent community to stay connected and learn about suitable career opportunities as soon as they come up: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

Benefits and Rewards: Read our handbook to learn about all the ways we‚Äôll help you thrive personally and professionally: https://www.novartis.com/careers/benefits-rewards

Title: Research & Development Application Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
At DuPont, our purpose is to empower the world with essential innovations to thrive. We work on things that matter. Whether it‚Äôs providing clean water to more than a billion people on the planet, producing materials that are essential in everyday technology devices from smartphones to electric vehicles, or protecting workers around the world. Discover the many reasons the world‚Äôs most talented people are choosing to work at DuPont. Why Join Us | DuPont Careers

INTRODUCTION

This is a Research & Development Application Engineer/ Chemist position within the Electronic and Industrial Finishing (EIF) Group, part of Qnity. This role is located in our Innovation Lab, Luzern Switzerland.

Your role will be highly involve in development and improvement of metallization products for telecom, data center, consumer, and other electronics end markets. You will work in partnership with our global team of scientists and engineers to develop and commercialize industry-leading metallization products that deliver enhanced performance for the diverse electronics markets we serve. You will focus on the development and improvement of chemistries and processes within the metallization research platform.

YOUR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:


Evaluate and refine existing or new metallization products, including plating on plastic, via routine testing and analysis
Compliance with environmental health and safety best practices
Produce and provide samples of existing and early-stage products to customers for evaluation, feedback, and iteration
Provide on-site technical assistance to customers during early installations of new products
Conduct experiments and evaluations independently and as part of a team while exhibiting a strong commitment to safety at all levels
Participate in team approach to product development by sharing knowledge, ideas, and creativity
Evaluate and communicate customer's critical requirements for successful product implementation
Collaborate with R&D and other functions to successfully meet commercialization requirements



EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS:


Experience with applied electrochemistry and electroplating techniques, inorganic chemistry, corrosion science, surface science and/or metallization techniques is required
A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Chemistry or a relevant applied science with industrial experience in galvanizing / electroplating, material science, electronic components final finishing is required. A PhD degree can be considered.
Experience with a wide range of analytical techniques including surface and material analysis methods SEM/EDS, XRF, XRD and soldering; wet chemical techniques and related analysis methods, Titrations, UV-vis method, IR analysis, HPLC, ICP and AAS
Background in formulating new products, track record of innovation, and excellent practical laboratory skills is preferred
Good problem-solving skills and ability to quickly become competent in an unfamiliar area of work
Effective verbal and written communication in both German and English on all aspects of program activity, including demonstrated ability to make clear, persuasive, concise, and well-organized oral presentations
Excellent time management skills and strong bias for action
Must be able to work well in teams and to work independently with limited supervision
Strong commitment to core safety values and best practices for safety including review of risk assessments, job safety analyses, standard operating procedures and MSDS
Position may require some travel to customer facilities.



Join our Talent Community to stay connected with us!

On May 22, 2024, we announced a plan to separate our Electronics and Water businesses in a tax-free manner to its shareholders. On January 15, 2025, we announced that we are targeting November 1, 2025, for the completion of the intended separation of the Electronics business (the ‚ÄúIntended Electronics Separation‚Äù)*. We also announced that we would retain the Water business. We are committed to ensuring a smooth and successful separation process for the Future Electronics business. We look forward to welcoming new talent interested in contributing to the continued success and growth of our evolving organization.


The separation transactions are subject to satisfaction of customary conditions, including final approval by DuPont's Board of Directors, receipt of tax opinion from counsel, the filing and effectiveness of Form 10 registration statements with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, applicable regulatory approvals, and satisfactory completion of financing.‚ÄØ For further discussion of risks, uncertainties and assumptions that could impact the achievement, expected timing and intended benefits of the separation transactions, see DuPont‚Äôs announcement.

HTML:
At DuPont, our purpose is to empower the world with essential innovations to thrive. We work on things that matter. Whether it‚Äôs providing clean water to more than a billion people on the planet, producing materials that are essential in everyday technology devices from smartphones to electric vehicles, or protecting workers around the world. Discover the many reasons the world‚Äôs most talented people are choosing to work at DuPont. Why Join Us | DuPont Careers

INTRODUCTION

This is a Research & Development Application Engineer/ Chemist position within the Electronic and Industrial Finishing (EIF) Group, part of Qnity. This role is located in our Innovation Lab, Luzern Switzerland.

Your role will be highly involve in development and improvement of metallization products for telecom, data center, consumer, and other electronics end markets. You will work in partnership with our global team of scientists and engineers to develop and commercialize industry-leading metallization products that deliver enhanced performance for the diverse electronics markets we serve. You will focus on the development and improvement of chemistries and processes within the metallization research platform.

YOUR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Evaluate and refine existing or new metallization products, including plating on plastic, via routine testing and analysis
  • Compliance with environmental health and safety best practices
  • Produce and provide samples of existing and early-stage products to customers for evaluation, feedback, and iteration
  • Provide on-site technical assistance to customers during early installations of new products
  • Conduct experiments and evaluations independently and as part of a team while exhibiting a strong commitment to safety at all levels
  • Participate in team approach to product development by sharing knowledge, ideas, and creativity
  • Evaluate and communicate customer's critical requirements for successful product implementation
  • Collaborate with R&D and other functions to successfully meet commercialization requirements


EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Experience with applied electrochemistry and electroplating techniques, inorganic chemistry, corrosion science, surface science and/or metallization techniques is required
  • A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Chemistry or a relevant applied science with industrial experience in galvanizing / electroplating, material science, electronic components final finishing is required. A PhD degree can be considered.
  • Experience with a wide range of analytical techniques including surface and material analysis methods SEM/EDS, XRF, XRD and soldering; wet chemical techniques and related analysis methods, Titrations, UV-vis method, IR analysis, HPLC, ICP and AAS
  • Background in formulating new products, track record of innovation, and excellent practical laboratory skills is preferred
  • Good problem-solving skills and ability to quickly become competent in an unfamiliar area of work
  • Effective verbal and written communication in both German and English on all aspects of program activity, including demonstrated ability to make clear, persuasive, concise, and well-organized oral presentations
  • Excellent time management skills and strong bias for action
  • Must be able to work well in teams and to work independently with limited supervision
  • Strong commitment to core safety values and best practices for safety including review of risk assessments, job safety analyses, standard operating procedures and MSDS
  • Position may require some travel to customer facilities.


Join our Talent Community to stay connected with us!

We look forward to welcoming new talent interested in contributing to the continued success and growth of our evolving organization.

Title: Spontaneous application
Description:
About you




You want to use your skills to address climate change. You‚Äôd be excited to work in a dynamic, friendly, fast-growing startup. You bring any experience, skill and passion that you believe we need. And you feel excited about the responsibility of shaping the direction of a pre-seed startup product. Sounds like you? Read on‚Ä¶




About us




Optiml is fast-growing startup with a mission to decarbonise real estate as ‚Äúthe trusted software provider for sustainable and profitable real estate portfolios‚Äù. We spun out of ETH Zurich in fall 2022 and raised our $1.6m pre-seed from top-notch US & EU funds: Innovation Endeavors (San Francisco ‚Äì fund of former Google CEO Eric Schmidt) and Planet A (Berlin). In short: although we‚Äôre only 1.5 years old, we‚Äôre getting a lot of interest, and we‚Äôre at the stage where we need more entrepreneurial and talented colleagues to join our team.


Tasks


Key responsibilities





Well‚Ä¶ this is spontaneous ‚Ä¶ surprise us?



Requirements


Who we are looking for





Highly Self-Motivated: You are able to quickly and efficiently execute tasks, demonstrating strong initiative and self-drive.


You Get Things Done: You prioritize speed and flexibility, adept at making swift compromises to maintain momentum.


Analytical and Self-Reflective: You analyze your performance and continuously seek ways to improve.


Compassionate and Humorous: You bring kindness and humor to the team, enhancing both morale and collaboration.



Benefits


Benefits





Direct impact on the product and go-to-market direction of Optiml from the earliest days


Unique opportunity to learn: try, fail, iterate, and build new skills every day - in a culture that values growth & development individually and as a team


Learning and development budget of CHF 1k (conferences, certificates, etc.).


Shit happens: 100% accident non-occupational accident insurance (UVG) covered.


25 days paid vacation, flexible parental leave.


Note: We work primarily from our Z√ºrich office, but offer the possibility of some remote work and flexible hours..

Title: UEFA Academy Programme Coordinator
Description:
Job information

Division/Unit: National Associations / UEFA Academy

Contract type: Permanent

Start date: Ideally 01.09.2025 or as soon as possible

Application deadline: 02.06.2025

Main goal

The UEFA Academy Programme Coordinator plays a key role in the design, coordination and delivery of educational initiatives across UEFA. This position involves close collaboration with various UEFA divisions and units to ensure that learning programmes are strategically aligned, pedagogically sound and operationally effective.

Key Responsibilities

Coordinating programmes across divisions


Acting as the primary liaison between the UEFA Academy and other UEFA divisions/units to co-develop and implement educational programmes
Serving as a learning and development business partner, engaging in frequent consultations with other divisions and units to support the development of educational initiatives
Coordinating the pedagogical and logistical delivery of existing flagship initiatives, including: UEFA Football Law Programme, Fight the Fix, Sustainability in Football compact course and Innovation in Action


Developing on-demand education


Coordinating the creation and delivery of bespoke educational programmes tailored to the needs of external stakeholders (e.g. national associations, clubs, private organisations)
Ensuring each programme is aligned with the UEFA Academy‚Äôs standards of excellence and stakeholder expectations


Programme Coordination Responsibilities

For each programme, the Programme Coordinator's role typically includes:


Co-designing and refining the programme's structure, content and pedagogical approach in cooperation with internal and external partners
Producing support materials and resources for the programme
Overseeing promotion and the recruitment process
Coordinating logistical elements, including venue booking, accommodation, catering, transport and event set-up
Managing the programme's budget, ensuring cost-effectiveness and financial accountability
More generally, optimising the learning journey of programme participants and maximising the impact of the programme on both participants and their organisations

Requirements

Experience:


At least three years of experience in vocational education and/or learning and development
Experience in international organisations, ideally in sports
Experience in organising seminars and other types of events


Education:


Master‚Äôs degree


Languages:


English: Proficient
French: A strong asset
Any other major international language: A strong asset


Other requirements:


Knowledge of AI tools and able to use them confidently
Excellent presentation skills
Strong project management skills
Comfortable and energised working in multicultural environments
Ability to handle tight deadlines and stressful situations
Service-orientated
Available and willing to travel for official trips
Broad curiosity and eagerness to learn
Highly collaborative and committed to the success of others
Willingness to experiment, take risks and continuously challenge oneself


Want to stay updated on our latest job opportunities, events, and behind-the-scenes insights? Join us on LinkedIn.

UEFA welcomes applications from all, actively working to ensure that we are an inclusive employer that finds the best candidate for our positions, regardless of aspects such as sex, gender identification, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity or nationality.

Title: Research Scientist - Neuroscience (60-70%*)
Description:
Summary

The Neuroscience Department within BioMedical Research at Novartis Pharma AG in Basel, Switzerland, is searching for a motivated and experienced Research or Senior Scientist. This individual will assume a hands-on role within the in vivo neuroinflammation team and contribute to several research projects focused on the development of new therapies for neurodegenerative disorders, potentially helping improve the lives of millions of patients worldwide suffering neurodegenerative illnesses and conditions.

The main focus will be on novel neuroimmune cell pathways to elucidate the mechanisms at the molecular, cellular and ex vivo/in vivo level.

Joining our team you will independently but with close collaboration with the other members of the Neurosciences group plan, execute, document, analyze and interpret experiments.


Please note that this is a part time job share position with a maximum 70% working time


About The Role

Your responsibilities will include:


Designing, conducting and protocolling independently in vivo studies with specific focus on neuroinflammatory pathways
Establishment of new in vivo models for neuroinflammatory/neurodegenerative diseases
Performing and interpreting ex vivo analyses with emphasis on histology, biochemistry, FACS and molecular biology
Development and execution of in vitro cellular assays for assessing inflammatory processes
Presenting data and putting it in a complex context
Supporting general laboratory duties


Your Profile


University degree (MSc) or equivalent qualification, preferably in neuroscience, immunology, cell biology. *Please note that PhD candidates will not be considered for this position*
Minimum 2-3 years relevant lab based work experience in an industrial or academic setting
Previous experience in neuroscience drug discovery area would be an advantage.
60-70% job position
Strong expertise in in vivo rodent work e.g. different routes of dosing, surgery, stereotactic brain injections, behavior, perfusion. Relevant animal experiment course available (e.g. LTK1)
Experience in different histological methods, microscopy and image analyses
Experience in RNA/DNA technologies and biochemistry, e.g. qPCR technologies, Westernblot
Good knowledge of immunology and immunological methods such as flow cytometry, HTRF, ELISA
Good knowledge in cell culture work, e.g. primary cells, iPSCs
Used to evaluating large datasets, strong documentation capabilities and interest to use new informatics analysis tools
Eager to learn and combine new techniques and concepts, to present results within the lab, to use and apply literature data, to perform exploratory activities and to work independently and as a team member
Scientific curiosity, initiative, commitment, flexibility and good organization skills
Track record of successful collaborations, open communication with different stakeholders, strong team player and networker
Excellent oral and written English


Accessibility and accommodation

Novartis is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to all individuals. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the recruitment process, or in order to receive more detailed information about the essential functions of a position, please send an e-mail to inclusion.switzerland@novartis.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Please include the job requisition number in your message.

Why Novartis: Helping people with disease and their families takes more than innovative science. It takes a community of smart, passionate people like you. Collaborating, supporting and inspiring each other. Combining to achieve breakthroughs that change patients‚Äô lives. Ready to create a brighter future together? https://www.novartis.com/about/strategy/people-and-culture

Join our Novartis Network: Not the right Novartis role for you? Sign up to our talent community to stay connected and learn about suitable career opportunities as soon as they come up: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

Benefits and Rewards: Read our handbook to learn about all the ways we‚Äôll help you thrive personally and professionally: https://www.novartis.com/careers/benefits-rewards

Title: Football Technologies Assistant
Description:
Job information

Division/Unit: Football/Football Operations

Contract type: Maximum-term contract

Start date: 01.07.2025 or as soon as possible

End date: 30.06.2027

Application deadline: 02.06.2025

Main goal

The Football Technologies Assistant supports the Football Operations team in overseeing the correct use and implementation of the various football technologies, with a particular focus on VAR and player tracking for the relevant UEFA competitions. The position-holder collaborates to help the unit achieve its project objectives with the appropriate level of service and quality.

Key Responsibilities


Supporting project management and coordinating the delivery of football technology services at the various UEFA competitions
Supporting the analysis and development of tracking and event data projects using Python or similar tools, including data processing, cleaning and transformation; quality assurance checks and generating insightful analyses and reports
Ensuring the correct implementation of video and data services for team analysts
Recording, reporting, monitoring and filing incidents involving football technologies

Requirements

Experience:


From 1 to 3 years' experience in a technical or data-related role in the sports industry


Education:


Bachelor's degree, ideally in data science, data analytics or equivalent


Languages:


English: Proficient
Any other European language would be an asset


Other requirements:


Project management: Intermediate
Strong analytical and administrative skills
Proficient in Python for data cleaning, analysis and visualisation
A demonstrable interest in football

The Football Technologies Assistant supports the Football Operations team in overseeing the correct use and implementation of the various football technologies, with a particular focus on VAR and player tracking for the relevant UEFA competitions. The position-holder collaborates to help the unit achieve its project objectives with the appropriate level of service and quality.

Key Responsibilities

  • Supporting project management and coordinating the delivery of football technology services at the various UEFA competitions
  • Supporting the analysis and development of tracking and event data projects using Python or similar tools, including data processing, cleaning and transformation; quality assurance checks and generating insightful analyses and reports
  • Ensuring the correct implementation of video and data services for team analysts
  • Recording, reporting, monitoring and filing incidents involving football technologies

Requirements

Experience:

  • From 1 to 3 years' experience in a technical or data-related role in the sports industry

Education:

  • Bachelor's degree, ideally in data science, data analytics or equivalent

Languages:

  • English: Proficient
  • Any other European language would be an asset

Other requirements:

  • Project management: Intermediate
  • Strong analytical and administrative skills
  • Proficient in Python for data cleaning, analysis and visualisation
  • A demonstrable interest in football

Want to stay updated on our latest job opportunities, events, and behind-the-scenes insights? Join us on LinkedIn. Apply now and join UEFAPeople

UEFA welcomes applications from all, actively working to ensure that we are an inclusive employer that finds the best candidate for our positions, regardless of aspects such as sex, gender identification, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity or nationality.

Title: Data Scientist ‚Äì Constrained Optimization
Description:
Expleo offers a unique range of integrated engineering, quality and strategic consulting services for digital transformation. At a time of unprecedented technological acceleration, we are the trusted partner of innovative companies. We help them develop a competitive advantage and improve the daily lives of millions of people.

Joining Expleo Switzerland means working for 19,000 people in 30 countries:


Technical and human support for each project and effective career management
Training to develop your professional skills
Take part in special dedicated events
Join a dynamic team !


To support our growth in French Part Switzerland, we are looking for Geneva area a Data Scientist ‚Äì Constrained Optimization consultant to join our team to develop and refine high-value models

Responsibilities

Your Responsibilities:

As Part Of a Large-scale Project, We Are Looking For a Data Scientist With a Strong Mathematical Background And a Strong Interest In Algorithms And Constrained Optimization


Design and implement constrained optimization models
Work on the mathematical modeling of complex problems
Collaborate with business teams to understand real-world constraints
Participate in the implementation of efficient and robust algorithms
Document, test, and continuously improve proposed solutions


Desired Skills

Your Profile :


Master Degree in applied mathematics, data science, computer science, or a related field
Strong knowledge of algorithms and data structures
Experience of 2 years (or academic training) in constrained optimization (linear, combinatorial, etc.)
Proficiency in Python (or other data science-related languages)
Experience with libraries such as Pyomo, OR-Tools, Gurobi, CPLEX is an asset
Fluent English (international working environment) and French
Very good communication skills, rigor and scientific curiosity.

Title: Biotechnologist
Description:
Position Summary

We are seeking a highly motivated Manufacturing Technician to support Drug Product operations in a GMP-compliant environment. The successful candidate will be responsible for executing manufacturing processes for liquid and lyophilized drug forms, ensuring safety, compliance, and timely delivery of batches. This role requires hands-on operation of production equipment, documentation, and collaboration across departments.




Key Responsibilities

Execute day-to-day manufacturing activities in compliance with cGMP, SOPs, and batch instructions
Operate, set up, clean, and maintain production equipment used in compounding, parts washing, autoclaving, filter integrity testing, and visual inspection
Ensure all batch production activities are conducted safely, on time, and in accordance with quality requirements
Prepare, execute, and review batch records and other relevant GMP documentation with high accuracy and timeliness
Provide technical and procedural support on the shop floor to ensure seamless batch execution
Troubleshoot equipment and process issues, recommend and implement solutions
Participate in investigations of deviations or production issues and contribute to decision-making processes
Support implementation of process changes and CAPAs within defined timelines
Conduct training activities for new staff and support team development
Maintain cleanliness and operational readiness of manufacturing areas




Qualifications and Experience

2‚Äì4 years of experience in a GMP-regulated manufacturing environment, preferably sterile Drug Product manufacturing
Fluent in English or German (preferably both)
In-depth knowledge of cGMP, SOPs, and quality assurance requirements
Experience with SAP and MES systems is a strong plus
Strong attention to detail, structured and organized work ethic
Demonstrated ability to work effectively within a team and communicate across multiple stakeholders
Proactive, adaptable, and dynamic mindset
Willingness to work in a rotating 2-shift schedule




What We Offer

An engaging and collaborative work environment
Opportunities for personal and professional development
Competitive salary and benefits package
A role in a purpose-driven company contributing to life-saving medicines

Z√ºrich

(zu Beginn zwei Monate 50% und anschliessend 80-100%, befristet bis 30. September 2026)

Ihre Aufgaben

Sie rekrutieren, instruieren und f√ºhren etwa 25 Freiwillige, haupts√§chlich Migrant*innen und Personen aus dem Asylbereich (√úbersetzer*innen, Kurier*innen, Versandhilfen, Fotograf*in).
