Title: AI Research Scientist, Media (Image & Video Models) - Generative AI
Description:
Meta is looking for a Research Scientist to join our Media Models team. We are seeking recognized experts in diffusion/flow-matching applied to image/video generative models. The ideal candidate will be passionate about advancing scientific research and applying it to develop novel distillation techniques. Our goal is to achieve state-of-the-art quality with the lowest possible latency, enabling adoption of generative models at global scale.

AI Research Scientist, Media (Image & Video Models) - Generative AI Responsibilities:


Lead, collaborate, and execute on research that pushes forward the state of the art in multimodal reasoning and generation research.
Work towards long-term ambitious research goals, while identifying intermediate milestones.
Directly contribute to experiments, including designing experimental details, implement reusable code, running evaluations, and organizing results.
Work with a large team.
Contribute to publications and open-sourcing efforts.
Mentor other team members. Play a significant role in healthy cross-functional collaboration.
Prioritize research that can be applied to Meta's product development.


Minimum Qualifications:


PhD in the field of Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.
3+ years experience in AI.
Experience in diffusion / flow matching.
Publications in areas of machine learning or computer vision.
Experience implementing software and executing complex experiments involving large AI models and datasets.
Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization throughout employment.


Preferred Qualifications:


Direct experience in generative AI and LLM research.
First author publications experience at peer-reviewed AI conferences (e.g., NeurIPS, CVPR, ICML, ICLR, ICCV, and ACL).
Fluent in Python and PyTorch.


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today‚Äîbeyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: Biotechnologist
Description:
Contract: 09/06/2025 to 31/12/2025

Location: Visp

Language: English or German or both




We are hiring for a Biotechnologist role. This role involves hands-on production of liquid and freeze-dried medicines in a GMP-regulated environment. The person is responsible for operating, setting up, and cleaning equipment, ensuring safe and timely batch production, and following strict quality and documentation standards.

Key responsibilities:

Executing daily manufacturing tasks (compounding, filtration, inspection)
Ensuring compliance with cGMP and batch instructions
Preparing, reviewing, and completing GMP documentation
Supporting investigations, process improvements, and CAPAs
Assisting in training and onboarding new staff
Working closely with teams across production, quality, and technical functions

Must Haves:

2‚Äì4 years of experience in GMP/sterile manufacturing
Strong attention to detail and a structured way of working
Fluent in English or German (ideally both)
Team player with good communication skills
Familiar with SOPs, SAP, MES, and GMP documentation
Willingness to work in 2-shift patterns

Title: Analytical Analyst
Description:
üìå Job Title: Analytical Analyst

Location: Switzerland (Remote / Flexible Work Environment)

Employment Type: Full-time

Start Date: ASAP or by arrangement

Work Mode: Remote-first within CET ¬±2 hrs




üß† About the Role:

We are seeking a detail-oriented and data-savvy Analytical Analyst to support our clients in making informed, data-driven decisions. You‚Äôll work closely with cross-functional teams to extract insights from complex datasets, build dashboards, and contribute to strategic business recommendations across industries such as finance, retail, logistics, and tech.

This is a remote-based position open to candidates based in Switzerland or nearby countries.




üíº Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources (databases, APIs, spreadsheets)
Build and maintain data dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Looker
Collaborate with internal teams and clients to understand analytical needs
Translate raw data into actionable insights and business recommendations
Conduct trend analysis, forecasting, and performance tracking
Present findings in a clear, concise manner to stakeholders
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and privacy compliance




‚úÖ Required Skills & Qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Business Analytics, Data Science, or a related field
2‚Äì4 years of experience in data analysis or business intelligence
Proficient in Excel and SQL; Python or R is a plus
Experience with BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Qlik)
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills
Excellent communication skills in English (German or French is a plus)
Comfortable working remotely and independently, while staying aligned with a distributed team




üåç Why Join Us:

Remote-friendly workplace with flexible hours
Competitive compensation in the Swiss market
Projects across high-impact industries (finance, e-commerce, logistics, tech)
Collaborate with international experts in data, AI, and consulting
Personal development support (courses, certifications, and mentorship)
Inclusive and open company culture that values initiative

Title: Clinical Trial Coordinator
Description:
Clinical Trial Coordinator - 12-Month Contract

Location: Allschwil, Switzerland

Schedule: Full-Time (100%)

Start Date: ASAP




Are you looking to take the next step in your clinical research career? We're seeking a Clinical Trial Coordinator to support the operational management of global clinical trials from start-up through to close-out. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to impactful research while working with a dedicated, high-performing team.




Your Key Responsibilities

Study Coordination: Assist in the setup, conduct, and archiving of clinical trials, ensuring smooth operations throughout each phase.
Documentation Management: Prepare, review, and distribute operational trial-related documents and site-specific materials, including Investigator Site Files and clinical study communications.
Systems & Compliance: Maintain key trial data in CTMS and eTMF systems; ensure proper filing and document archiving within regulatory timelines.
Supplies & Contracts: Coordinate the delivery of study-related non-clinical supplies and oversee contract finalization with trial sites and third parties.
Stakeholder Support: Collaborate with global clinical trial teams, including legal and strategic sourcing, to manage contracts, invoices, and confidentiality agreements.
Quality Oversight: Conduct regular document reviews, ensuring ongoing compliance with SOPs, regulatory requirements, and quality standards.




What You Bring

A degree in Life Sciences, Nursing, Pharmacy, or a related field
At least 2 years of experience in clinical research or a similar setting
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English
High attention to detail and ability to multitask under tight deadlines
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications and clinical trial software (CTMS, eTMF)
A proactive and team-oriented mindset, with a problem-solving approach
Willingness to travel occasionally (less than 10%)




Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. We encourage early submission, as this is a highly sought-after opportunity.

Title: Combustion Engineer
Description:
The Ansaldo Energia Group is one of the world's leading power generation companies. Its core business is the supply and service of components and technological solutions for power generation with rotating machines. The company designs and manufactures turbines and generators, and provides service and continuous improvement. Headquartered in Genoa, the Group employs more than 3,300 people and has a strong international presence with more than 30 offices around the world. Ansaldo Energia is one of the leading players in the transformation and decarbonisation of power generation. Its turbogas fleet is already capable of burning between 40 and 70 per cent hydrogen, with the aim of reaching 100 per cent by 2030.

Position:

The Combustion & Emission Engineer is responsible for the site tuning of combustion and thermodynamic of the gas turbines of the installed fleet. She/He provides support for the execution of service contracts, extensions and product upgrades based on broad knowledge & passion for Ansaldo‚Äôs gas turbines.

Your tasks

Plan, prepare and execute combustion related tasks on- and off-site for the installed and serviced gas turbines fleet (GT36, GT26, AE/V94.3A, AE/V64.3A, AE/V94.2)


Lead execution of parameters acquisition and combustion tuning personal presence or remotely as per project requirements
Coordinate with counterparts in other Ansaldo office locations (Italy, Switzerland & Abu Dhabi)
Develop into thermodynamic performance related tasks
Provide extended engineering support for Plant Support topics for combustion & emissions
Ensure that all work is performed according to EHS-, quality- & schedule requirements
Deploy simplifications and lean processes in your area.


Requirements:

Your profile

University degree, background relevant to gas turbines


Motivating, passionate, reliable & goal-oriented personality ‚Äì required
Being flexible & able to work under pressure and willing to travel worldwide (up to 40% globally, also on short notice) ‚Äì required
Professional planning & presentation skills. Good knowledge of MS Office applications & Lotus Notes ‚Äì preferred
Excellent command of English; German and/or French preferred, Italian strongly advantageous.


Other information:

Your benefit with us

Working with passionate people


Participating in environmental sustainability
Challenging work
Attractive and exciting products
Interaction with international colleagues
Flexible working conditions
Place of work in a beautiful small Swiss city rich in culture and history in the heart of Switzerland, close to the metropoles like Zurich and Basel.


If you are interested in a future-oriented company, take the chance and provide us with your complete application documents (motivation letter and CV in English, diplomas/certificates, reference letters from former employers).

Please note that only applications containing all required documents will be considered. For any questions please contact us at jobs@ansaldoenergia.com

Title: Intern Python GUI Development
Description:
About Us

H55 is at the forefront of sustainable aviation revolution. Our mission is to enable the aviation industry to reach net zero by providing certified electric propulsion solutions. The Swiss based H55 is a technological spin-off of Solar Impulse, the first electric airplane to fly around the world. The company develops cutting-edge certified electric propulsion and battery management systems that enable cleaner, quieter, and more sustainable air travel. H55 is driving innovation to accelerate the aviation industry's transition toward zero-emission solutions

Joining our team means working with talented professionals and gaining firsthand experience in a dynamic and innovative environment. We value individuals who think outside the box, take initiative, and are passionate about the aerospace industry.

Your Role

We are seeking a passionate and quick-learning intern to support the development of GUI applications for controlling test systems in Battery Management Systems (BMS) and Electric Propulsion Systems for aerospace applications.

Specifically, you will:


Design and implement GUI applications in Python for Windows, using frameworks such as Qt (PyQt/PySide) or equivalent
Work with networking protocols (especially UDP) to interface with test systems and devices
Contribute to software process automation using Jenkins, including building dashboards and analyzing KPIs for continuous integration and test workflows


Your Profile


Ongoing Bachelor or Master's student in computer engineering
Basic knowledge of XML and HTML for data handling and interface configuration
Exposure to graphical tools like Qt Designer, Blender, or other visualization environments
Experience or familiarity with simulation environments using MathWorks toolchain (MATLAB/Simulink) is a plus
Fast learner, rigorous, hands-on problem-solving, ability to document properly
Fluency in English (oral and written)


Additional Information

Location: Sion, Switzerland

Start Date: Summer 2025

Duration: 6 months or longer.

We hope this role sounds exciting and could be your next step, if so follow the steps to apply, we are looking forward to receivingyour application.

H55 is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals regardless of race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on competence, performance, and business needs.

Title: Laborista in chimica Analisi ambientale
Description:
Agroscope, 80 - 100, 8046 Z√ºrich (per 01.07.2026: 1725 Posieux)

Il contributo che pu√≤ dare


Estrarre campioni di suolo secondo i metodi di riferimento svizzeri e misurare macronutrienti (P, K, Ca, Mg) e inquinanti (Cu, Co, Cr, Ni, Pb, Zn, Hg, Cd, Mo, U e altri) con i metodi F-AAS, ICP-OES, Hg-AFS e la fotometria
Misurare macronutrienti e metalli pesanti in estratti vegetali tramite ICP-OES
Misurare parametri tipici del suolo come pH, tessitura, tenore di humus
Controllare la qualit√† dei valori misurati e riportarli nel LIMS

Title: Research Scientist - Neuroscience (60-70%*)
Description:
Summary

The Neuroscience Department within BioMedical Research at Novartis Pharma AG in Basel, Switzerland, is searching for a motivated and experienced Research or Senior Scientist. This individual will assume a hands-on role within the in vivo neuroinflammation team and contribute to several research projects focused on the development of new therapies for neurodegenerative disorders, potentially helping improve the lives of millions of patients worldwide suffering neurodegenerative illnesses and conditions.

The main focus will be on novel neuroimmune cell pathways to elucidate the mechanisms at the molecular, cellular and ex vivo/in vivo level.

Joining our team you will independently but with close collaboration with the other members of the Neurosciences group plan, execute, document, analyze and interpret experiments.


Please note that this is a part time job share position with a maximum 70% working time


About The Role

Your responsibilities will include:


Designing, conducting and protocolling independently in vivo studies with specific focus on neuroinflammatory pathways
Establishment of new in vivo models for neuroinflammatory/neurodegenerative diseases
Performing and interpreting ex vivo analyses with emphasis on histology, biochemistry, FACS and molecular biology
Development and execution of in vitro cellular assays for assessing inflammatory processes
Presenting data and putting it in a complex context
Supporting general laboratory duties


Your Profile


University degree (MSc) or equivalent qualification, preferably in neuroscience, immunology, cell biology. *Please note that PhD candidates will not be considered for this position*
Minimum 2-3 years relevant lab based work experience in an industrial or academic setting
Previous experience in neuroscience drug discovery area would be an advantage.
60-70% job position
Strong expertise in in vivo rodent work e.g. different routes of dosing, surgery, stereotactic brain injections, behavior, perfusion. Relevant animal experiment course available (e.g. LTK1)
Experience in different histological methods, microscopy and image analyses
Experience in RNA/DNA technologies and biochemistry, e.g. qPCR technologies, Westernblot
Good knowledge of immunology and immunological methods such as flow cytometry, HTRF, ELISA
Good knowledge in cell culture work, e.g. primary cells, iPSCs
Used to evaluating large datasets, strong documentation capabilities and interest to use new informatics analysis tools
Eager to learn and combine new techniques and concepts, to present results within the lab, to use and apply literature data, to perform exploratory activities and to work independently and as a team member
Scientific curiosity, initiative, commitment, flexibility and good organization skills
Track record of successful collaborations, open communication with different stakeholders, strong team player and networker
Excellent oral and written English


Accessibility and accommodation

Novartis is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to all individuals. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the recruitment process, or in order to receive more detailed information about the essential functions of a position, please send an e-mail to inclusion.switzerland@novartis.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Please include the job requisition number in your message.

Why Novartis: Helping people with disease and their families takes more than innovative science. It takes a community of smart, passionate people like you. Collaborating, supporting and inspiring each other. Combining to achieve breakthroughs that change patients‚Äô lives. Ready to create a brighter future together? https://www.novartis.com/about/strategy/people-and-culture

Join our Novartis Network: Not the right Novartis role for you? Sign up to our talent community to stay connected and learn about suitable career opportunities as soon as they come up: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

Benefits and Rewards: Read our handbook to learn about all the ways we‚Äôll help you thrive personally and professionally: https://www.novartis.com/careers/benefits-rewards

Title: Football Technologies Assistant
Description:
Job information

Division/Unit: Football/Football Operations

Contract type: Maximum-term contract

Start date: 01.07.2025 or as soon as possible

End date: 30.06.2027

Application deadline: 02.06.2025

Main goal

The Football Technologies Assistant supports the Football Operations team in overseeing the correct use and implementation of the various football technologies, with a particular focus on VAR and player tracking for the relevant UEFA competitions. The position-holder collaborates to help the unit achieve its project objectives with the appropriate level of service and quality.

Key Responsibilities


Supporting project management and coordinating the delivery of football technology services at the various UEFA competitions
Supporting the analysis and development of tracking and event data projects using Python or similar tools, including data processing, cleaning and transformation; quality assurance checks and generating insightful analyses and reports
Ensuring the correct implementation of video and data services for team analysts
Recording, reporting, monitoring and filing incidents involving football technologies

Requirements

Experience:


From 1 to 3 years' experience in a technical or data-related role in the sports industry


Education:


Bachelor's degree, ideally in data science, data analytics or equivalent


Languages:


English: Proficient
Any other European language would be an asset


Other requirements:


Project management: Intermediate
Strong analytical and administrative skills
Proficient in Python for data cleaning, analysis and visualisation
A demonstrable interest in football

Title: Data Scientist ‚Äì Constrained Optimization
Description:
Expleo offers a unique range of integrated engineering, quality and strategic consulting services for digital transformation. At a time of unprecedented technological acceleration, we are the trusted partner of innovative companies. We help them develop a competitive advantage and improve the daily lives of millions of people.

Joining Expleo Switzerland means working for 19,000 people in 30 countries:


Technical and human support for each project and effective career management
Training to develop your professional skills
Take part in special dedicated events
Join a dynamic team !


To support our growth in French Part Switzerland, we are looking for Geneva area a Data Scientist ‚Äì Constrained Optimization consultant to join our team to develop and refine high-value models

Responsibilities

Your Responsibilities:

As Part Of a Large-scale Project, We Are Looking For a Data Scientist With a Strong Mathematical Background And a Strong Interest In Algorithms And Constrained Optimization


Design and implement constrained optimization models
Work on the mathematical modeling of complex problems
Collaborate with business teams to understand real-world constraints
Participate in the implementation of efficient and robust algorithms
Document, test, and continuously improve proposed solutions


Desired Skills

Your Profile :


Master Degree in applied mathematics, data science, computer science, or a related field
Strong knowledge of algorithms and data structures
Experience of 2 years (or academic training) in constrained optimization (linear, combinatorial, etc.)
Proficiency in Python (or other data science-related languages)
Experience with libraries such as Pyomo, OR-Tools, Gurobi, CPLEX is an asset
Fluent English (international working environment) and French
Very good communication skills, rigor and scientific curiosity.

Title: Manipulation Software Engineering Internship
Description:
ANYbotics is a fast-growing tech company dedicated to shaping the future of mobile robotics across multiple industries. Join our highly talented and motivated team of more than 190 people and work on cutting-edge robot technology.

The Opportunity

We are advancing the frontier of robotics by developing a state-of-the-art manipulation research platform that integrates the quadruped robot ANYmal with a 6DOF robotic arm. As a Robotic Manipulation Software Intern, your primary mission will be to seamlessly integrate these two robotic systems in software and ensure flawless operation in both simulation and physical environments. You will leverage existing software frameworks, test control algorithms, and validate system performance through rigorous experimentation.

The preferred starting date is July and the initial duration of the full-time paid internship is six months, with the possibility of extension.

Market & Our Technology

ANYbotics transforms industrial plants in the energy, process, and utility sector by introducing robotics to a wide range of novel applications that so far were beyond reach. Our customers are large asset operators and industrial service providers pioneering the use of robotics technology for inspection and maintenance. Our mobile robot ANYmal uses legs for extreme mobility in complex environments, camera- and LIDAR-based sensing for full autonomy and obstacle avoidance, and AI for high-quality and consistent inspection results. We develop numerous customized hardware systems, including the entire robotic platform, actuators, sensors, inspection payloads, charging systems, and all related ANYbotics mechanical hardware.

Your Contributions


Develop and integrate software to enable mobile manipulation using ANYmal and a 6DOF robotic arm
Test robotics systems in simulation and validate performance in physical experiments
Identify and validate models for control systems
Adapt and optimize control algorithms for real-world applications
Collaborate closely with senior engineers to ensure project success
Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code
Troubleshoot and solve challenges related to hardware-software integration



Your Profile


Currently a masters, Ph.D or recent graduate in computer science, robotics or related fields at a top ranked university (preferably in Switzerland or EU citizen)
Fluent in English
Experience with object-oriented programming in C++
Experience with software architecture
Experience with system modelling and control
Familiarity with robotic manipulation
Strong collaborative skills with the ability to work independently
Foundational knowledge in control theory



Please note that we are only able to consider applications from Students enrolled in a Swiss University who reside in Switzerland.

We offer you a very exciting and dynamic work environment, the opportunity to become part of a fast-growing company and an ambitious team that is on a mission to change the industrial inspection market, a chance to leverage your experience and bring in your own ideas, a fair market salary, an attractive employee stock ownership plan, and a job in the city of Zurich.
Show more
HTML:
ANYbotics is a fast-growing tech company dedicated to shaping the future of mobile robotics across multiple industries. Join our highly talented and motivated team of more than 190 people and work on cutting-edge robot technology.

The Opportunity

We are advancing the frontier of robotics by developing a state-of-the-art manipulation research platform that integrates the quadruped robot ANYmal with a 6DOF robotic arm. As a Robotic Manipulation Software Intern, your primary mission will be to seamlessly integrate these two robotic systems in software and ensure flawless operation in both simulation and physical environments. You will leverage existing software frameworks, test control algorithms, and validate system performance through rigorous experimentation.

The preferred starting date is July and the initial duration of the full-time paid internship is six months, with the possibility of extension.

Market & Our Technology

ANYbotics transforms industrial plants in the energy, process, and utility sector by introducing robotics to a wide range of novel applications that so far were beyond reach. Our customers are large asset operators and industrial service providers pioneering the use of robotics technology for inspection and maintenance. Our mobile robot ANYmal uses legs for extreme mobility in complex environments, camera- and LIDAR-based sensing for full autonomy and obstacle avoidance, and AI for high-quality and consistent inspection results. We develop numerous customized hardware systems, including the entire robotic platform, actuators, sensors, inspection payloads, charging systems, and all related ANYbotics mechanical hardware.

Your Contributions

  • Develop and integrate software to enable mobile manipulation using ANYmal and a 6DOF robotic arm
  • Test robotics systems in simulation and validate performance in physical experiments
  • Identify and validate models for control systems
  • Adapt and optimize control algorithms for real-world applications
  • Collaborate closely with senior engineers to ensure project success
  • Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code
  • Troubleshoot and solve challenges related to hardware-software integration


Your Profile

  • Currently a masters, Ph.D or recent graduate in computer science, robotics or related fields at a top ranked university (preferably in Switzerland or EU citizen)
  • Fluent in English
  • Experience with object-oriented programming in C++
  • Experience with software architecture
  • Experience with system modelling and control
  • Familiarity with robotic manipulation
  • Strong collaborative skills with the ability to work independently
  • Foundational knowledge in control theory


Please note that we are only able to consider applications from Students enrolled in a Swiss University who reside in Switzerland.

We offer you a very exciting and dynamic work environment, the opportunity to become part of a fast-growing company and an ambitious team that is on a mission to change the industrial inspection market, a chance to leverage your experience and bring in your own ideas, a fair market salary, an attractive employee stock ownership plan, and a job in the city of Zurich.

Title: Analytical Analyst
Description:
üìå Job Title: Analytical Analyst

Location: Switzerland (Remote / Flexible Work Environment)

Employment Type: Full-time

Start Date: ASAP or by arrangement

Work Mode: Remote-first within CET ¬±2 hrs




üß† About the Role:

We are seeking a detail-oriented and data-savvy Analytical Analyst to support our clients in making informed, data-driven decisions. You‚Äôll work closely with cross-functional teams to extract insights from complex datasets, build dashboards, and contribute to strategic business recommendations across industries such as finance, retail, logistics, and tech.

This is a remote-based position open to candidates based in Switzerland or nearby countries.




üíº Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources (databases, APIs, spreadsheets)

Collaborate with internal teams and clients to understand analytical needs
Translate raw data into actionable insights and business recommendations
Conduct trend analysis, forecasting, and performance tracking
Present findings in a clear, concise manner to stakeholders
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and privacy compliance

Experience with BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Qlik)

Inclusive and open company culture that values initiative

Title: Clinical Trial Coordinator
Description:
Clinical Trial Coordinator - 12-Month Contract

Location: Allschwil, Switzerland

Schedule: Full-Time (100%)

Start Date: ASAP




Are you looking to take the next step in your clinical research career? We're seeking a Clinical Trial Coordinator to support the operational management of global clinical trials from start-up through to close-out. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to impactful research while working with a dedicated, high-performing team.




Your Key Responsibilities

Study Coordination: Assist in the setup, conduct, and archiving of clinical trials, ensuring smooth operations throughout each phase.
Documentation Management: Prepare, review, and distribute operational trial-related documents and site-specific materials, including Investigator Site Files and clinical study communications.
Systems & Compliance: Maintain key trial data in CTMS and eTMF systems; ensure proper filing and document archiving within regulatory timelines.
Supplies & Contracts: Coordinate the delivery of study-related non-clinical supplies and oversee contract finalization with trial sites and third parties.
Stakeholder Support: Collaborate with global clinical trial teams, including legal and strategic sourcing, to manage contracts, invoices, and confidentiality agreements.
Quality Oversight: Conduct regular document reviews, ensuring ongoing compliance with SOPs, regulatory requirements, and quality standards.




What You Bring

A degree in Life Sciences, Nursing, Pharmacy, or a related field
At least 2 years of experience in clinical research or a similar setting
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English
High attention to detail and ability to multitask under tight deadlines
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications and clinical trial software (CTMS, eTMF)
A proactive and team-oriented mindset, with a problem-solving approach
Willingness to travel occasionally (less than 10%)




Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. We encourage early submission, as this is a highly sought-after opportunity.

Title: Leadership Professionals - Looking for a new option
Description:

Role Overview

Title: Una / uno specialista procedura d'asilo
Company: State Secretariat for Migration SEM, Switzerland
Description:
Segreteria di Stato della migrazione SEM, 80-100%, Berna e lavoro a domicilio

Il contributo che pu√≤ dare


Condurre audizioni rilevanti ai fini della procedura d'asilo
Redigere decisioni motivate d'asilo e di allontanamento in lingua tedesca
Trattare ulteriori compiti nell'ambito della procedura d'asilo e di ricorso (misure istruttorie specifiche al caso, richieste alle ambasciate, diritto di audizione, consultazioni con il Tribunale amministrativo federale, accertamenti d'identit√†)
Gestire la corrispondenza con autorit√† e organizzazioni esterne all'Amministrazione federale e con i fornitori di servizi per la tutela giuridica nella procedura ampliata


Che cosa La contraddistingue


un diploma universitario (laurea, master), preferibilmente in giurisprudenza
ottime capacit√† redazionali e spiccato pensiero analitico e concettuale
un comportamento sicuro, elevata motivazione al rendimento e resilienza
prontezza di comprensione, capacit√† di lavorare in modo autonomo e mirato
buona conoscenza di una seconda lingua ufficiale e dell'inglese


In sintesi

Conducete procedure di asilo e di espulsione in conformit√† con le basi giuridiche nazionali e internazionali e interrogate i richiedenti asilo sui motivi della loro fuga.

La migrazione ci riguarda

La Segreteria di Stato della migrazione (SEM) √® competente per le questioni di diritto migratorio in Svizzera. il settore Asilo della SEM esamina e decide sulle domande d'asilo presentate in Svizzera.

La Divisione Procedura d'asilo e Prassi (DPAP) garantisce le informazioni necessarie per una pratica d'asilo uniforme, aggiornata e giuridicamente corretta in relazione ai paesi di origine e alle tematiche specialistiche.

Che cosa offriamo

Lavorare per la SvizzeraCi adoperiamo per il modello di successo svizzero e lavoriamo per il benessere della popolazione.

Vivere la diversit√†La concretizzazione delle pari opportunit√† ci consente di esprimere al meglio le nostre competenze e di contemplare punti di vista differenti.

In forma sul posto di lavoroForniamo supporto e consulenza alle nostre collaboratrici e ai nostri collaboratori sulla tematica della salute fisica e mentale.

Informazioni complementari

Per il momento il posto √® limitato fino al 31.12.2025, con possibilit√† di proroga.

Title: Head of Switzerland
Description:
About Titanbay

About Titanbay At Titanbay we are on a mission to open up private market investing for wealth managers, private banks and their customers. We are deeply committed to delivering unmatched value and service to our clients by offering innovative solutions that empower our customers to navigate private markets with confidence and success.

Our ethos revolves around customer obsession and our ability to solve difficult problems well for our customers, and we believe in fostering a culture of transparency, integrity and accountability where every team member is empowered to take ownership, act with urgency and earn the trust of our colleagues, clients and partners.

Join us on our journey to reshape the future of private market investing and unlock new opportunities for wealth managers and investors alike.

About The Role

Titanbay is expanding rapidly across Europe and as such, we are looking to grow our Sales & Distribution team with a Zurich-based Head of Region.

As a strategic leader, you will be responsible for establishing and nurturing key partnerships, fostering relationships with private banks and wealth managers, and expanding Titanbay's market presence in Switzerland.

Responsibilities


Oversee Titanbay's operations and strategy in Switzerland, ensuring alignment with global objectives.
Identify and prospect new partnership opportunities across the region and manage existing relationships.
Be responsible for selling through private banks and wealth managers to drive AUM via Titanbay's platform.
Translate Titanbay's offerings and products into seamless proposals outlining benefits for our partners.
Develop strategies to grow new and existing accounts with intermediaries.
Analyse partner needs and develop tailored solutions, providing timely and accurate reporting on pipeline activities.
Research target markets, create distribution presentations, and negotiate contracts.
Maintain working knowledge of asset management solutions and broader capabilities to best serve our partners.
Create, manage, and execute a sales plan focused on delivering AUM at scale.
Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations and work closely with the compliance team to maintain up-to-date knowledge of the requirements.


Requirements


Demonstrable experience developing institutional client relationships with a successful track record of delivering AUM.
Proven leadership skills, with experience managing a regional team or division.
An entrepreneurial self-starter, highly motivated and very organised.
A can-do attitude and a desire to succeed in a fast-growth investment and technology company.
Ability to manage complex prospect and client requirements and support across internal channels.
Enjoy working in a collaborative and focused team environment.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English and German.
Strong CRM discipline.
Show more

Title: Combustion Engineer
Description:
The Ansaldo Energia Group is one of the world's leading power generation companies. Its core business is the supply and service of components and technological solutions for power generation with rotating machines. The company designs and manufactures turbines and generators, and provides service and continuous improvement. Headquartered in Genoa, the Group employs more than 3,300 people and has a strong international presence with more than 30 offices around the world. Ansaldo Energia is one of the leading players in the transformation and decarbonisation of power generation. Its turbogas fleet is already capable of burning between 40 and 70 per cent hydrogen, with the aim of reaching 100 per cent by 2030.

Position:

The Combustion & Emission Engineer is responsible for the site tuning of combustion and thermodynamic of the gas turbines of the installed fleet. She/He provides support for the execution of service contracts, extensions and product upgrades based on broad knowledge & passion for Ansaldo‚Äôs gas turbines.

Your tasks

Plan, prepare and execute combustion related tasks on- and off-site for the installed and serviced gas turbines fleet (GT36, GT26, AE/V94.3A, AE/V64.3A, AE/V94.2)


Lead execution of parameters acquisition and combustion tuning personal presence or remotely as per project requirements
Coordinate with counterparts in other Ansaldo office locations (Italy, Switzerland & Abu Dhabi)
Develop into thermodynamic performance related tasks
Provide extended engineering support for Plant Support topics for combustion & emissions
Ensure that all work is performed according to EHS-, quality- & schedule requirements
Deploy simplifications and lean processes in your area.


Requirements:

Your profile

University degree, background relevant to gas turbines


Motivating, passionate, reliable & goal-oriented personality ‚Äì required
Being flexible & able to work under pressure and willing to travel worldwide (up to 40% globally, also on short notice) ‚Äì required
Professional planning & presentation skills. Good knowledge of MS Office applications & Lotus Notes ‚Äì preferred
Excellent command of English; German and/or French preferred, Italian strongly advantageous.


Other information:

Your benefit with us

Working with passionate people


Participating in environmental sustainability
Challenging work
Attractive and exciting products
Interaction with international colleagues
Flexible working conditions
Place of work in a beautiful small Swiss city rich in culture and history in the heart of Switzerland, close to the metropoles like Zurich and Basel.


If you are interested in a future-oriented company, take the chance and provide us with your complete application documents (motivation letter and CV in English, diplomas/certificates, reference letters from former employers).

Please note that only applications containing all required documents will be considered. For any questions please contact us at jobs@ansaldoenergia.com

Title: Intern Python GUI Development
Description:
About Us

H55 is at the forefront of sustainable aviation revolution. Our mission is to enable the aviation industry to reach net zero by providing certified electric propulsion solutions. The Swiss based H55 is a technological spin-off of Solar Impulse, the first electric airplane to fly around the world. The company develops cutting-edge certified electric propulsion and battery management systems that enable cleaner, quieter, and more sustainable air travel. H55 is driving innovation to accelerate the aviation industry's transition toward zero-emission solutions

Joining our team means working with talented professionals and gaining firsthand experience in a dynamic and innovative environment. We value individuals who think outside the box, take initiative, and are passionate about the aerospace industry.

Your Role

We are seeking a passionate and quick-learning intern to support the development of GUI applications for controlling test systems in Battery Management Systems (BMS) and Electric Propulsion Systems for aerospace applications.

Specifically, you will:


Design and implement GUI applications in Python for Windows, using frameworks such as Qt (PyQt/PySide) or equivalent
Work with networking protocols (especially UDP) to interface with test systems and devices
Contribute to software process automation using Jenkins, including building dashboards and analyzing KPIs for continuous integration and test workflows


Your Profile


Ongoing Bachelor or Master's student in computer engineering
Basic knowledge of XML and HTML for data handling and interface configuration
Exposure to graphical tools like Qt Designer, Blender, or other visualization environments
Experience or familiarity with simulation environments using MathWorks toolchain (MATLAB/Simulink) is a plus
Fast learner, rigorous, hands-on problem-solving, ability to document properly
Fluency in English (oral and written)


Additional Information

Location: Sion, Switzerland

Start Date: Summer 2025

Duration: 6 months or longer.

We hope this role sounds exciting and could be your next step, if so follow the steps to apply, we are looking forward to receivingyour application.

H55 is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals regardless of race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on competence, performance, and business needs.

Powered by JazzHR

Title: Laborista in chimica Analisi ambientale
Description:
Agroscope, 80 - 100, 8046 Z√ºrich (per 01.07.2026: 1725 Posieux)

Il contributo che pu√≤ dare


Estrarre campioni di suolo secondo i metodi di riferimento svizzeri e misurare macronutrienti (P, K, Ca, Mg) e inquinanti (Cu, Co, Cr, Ni, Pb, Zn, Hg, Cd, Mo, U e altri) con i metodi F-AAS, ICP-OES, Hg-AFS e la fotometria
Misurare macronutrienti e metalli pesanti in estratti vegetali tramite ICP-OES
Misurare parametri tipici del suolo come pH, tessitura, tenore di humus
Controllare la qualit√† dei valori misurati e riportarli nel LIMS
Organizzare in modo indipendente il lavoro di analisi, la supervisione delle apparecchiature di analisi, la guida del personale di laboratorio e ausiliario nelle attivit√† di laboratorio
Collaborare in maniera trasversale all'interno del gruppo di ricerca


Che cosa La contraddistingue


Formazione di base completata come laborista in chimica AFC, preferibilmente con indirizzo in chimica inorganica
Esperienza in analisi (estrazioni, ICP-OES, fotometria)
Metodo di lavoro autonomo, preciso e sistematico
Personalit√† che ama lavorare in team, comunicativa e impegnata, con un interesse per la significativit√† e il contesto dei risultati
Utilizzo sicuro dei comuni programmi MS Office e capacit√† di familiarizzare rapidamente con i software di vari dispositivi
Conoscenza di due lingue ufficiali e dell'inglese


In sintesi

Nell'ambito dei vari metodi analitici, sar√† responsabile della buona qualit√† delle misure e del completamento delle analisi entro le scadenze previste, contribuendo cos√¨ a molti progetti di ricerca in corso.

Mangiar bene in un ambiente sano

Agroscope √® il centro di competenze della Confederazione per la ricerca nel settore agroalimentare e appartiene al Dipartimento federale dell'economia, della formazione e della ricerca (DEFR). I ricercatori svolgono le loro attivit√† in diverse sedi in Svizzera, quella principale si trova a Berna-Liebefeld (Posieux FR dal 2026).

Che cosa offriamo

Lavorare per la SvizzeraCi adoperiamo per il modello di successo svizzero e lavoriamo per il benessere della popolazione.

Vivere la diversit√†La concretizzazione delle pari opportunit√† ci consente di esprimere al meglio le nostre competenze e di contemplare punti di vista differenti.

In forma sul posto di lavoroForniamo supporto e consulenza alle nostre collaboratrici e ai nostri collaboratori sulla tematica della salute fisica e mentale.

Informazioni complementari

Il Gruppo di ricerca Analisi ambientale sostiene e serve i ricercatori di Agroscope nelle questioni chimico-analitiche. Inoltre, contribuisce a migliorare la comprensione del futuro e del comportamento delle sostanze nell'antroposfera, nell'agricoltura e nell'ambiente attraverso lo sviluppo di metodi e i propri progetti di ricerca. I suoi analiti target spaziano dai metalli pesanti fino ai microinquinanti organici, passando per le microplastiche.

I suoi analiti target spaziano dai metalli pesanti fino ai microinquinanti organici, passando per le microplastiche.

Title: Banco de Talentos - Visita Liceu
Description:
Hello, candidate! At Air Liquide, we value inclusion and diversity, so we are pleased to inform you that you are participating in an anonymous selection process, meaning that no personal information will be available. Your assessment will be based on your technical skills and, later, in your behavioral interview. Please fill out all fields of your application with as much detail as possible, remembering that this is essential for your assessment in the anonymous selection process.

About Air Liquide

Through the passion and diversity of its people, Air Liquide leverages the energy and environmental transition, healthcare changes and digitalization, and delivers greater value to all its shareholders.

Join us for a stimulating experience: you will find a world of learning and development opportunities where creativity is at the heart of what we do, in an open, collaborative and respectful environment.

How will you CONTRIBUTE and GROW?

Voc√™ tem sede de inova√ß√£o, paix√£o por desafios e quer fazer a diferen√ßa em um mundo em constante evolu√ß√£o? A Air Liquide, l√≠der global em gases, tecnologias e servi√ßos para a Ind√∫stria e Sa√∫de, est√° te chamando!

Somos uma multinacional francesa presente em mais de 75 pa√≠ses, com mais de 67.000 colaboradores. Nosso prop√≥sito? Criar valor a longo prazo, contribuindo para um mundo mais sustent√°vel e uma sociedade mais saud√°vel. Aqui na Air Liquide, voc√™ n√£o apenas encontrar√° um emprego, mas uma jornada de aprendizado cont√≠nuo, inova√ß√£o e crescimento profissional.

Estamos √† procura de jovens talentos com curiosidade, proatividade, vontade de aprender e, acima de tudo, um brilho nos olhos para transformar o mundo. Se voc√™ √© estudante universit√°rio, t√©cnico ou rec√©m-formado em √°reas como engenharia, qu√≠mica, tecnologia, ci√™ncias da sa√∫de, neg√≥cios ou afins, e busca uma carreira com prop√≥sito em uma multinacional de peso, a Air Liquide √© para voc√™!

______________________________

Do you have these requirements?

Inscreva-se agora mesmo no nosso Banco de Talentos e venha construir um futuro inovador e sustent√°vel com a Air Liquide!

Your differences drive our performance

At Air Liquide, we are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace, which means that, regardless of your gender identity, sexual orientation, color, age, religion, nationality or disability, we value a work environment made up of true stories, built by true people.

Our processes reflect this, being diverse and free from any prejudice, therefore, we do not collect information such as date of birth, gender, marital status or full address in our selection stages. If this information is sent, it will be disregarded.

We strongly believe that a diverse organization opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively, and helps foster our ability to innovate by living our fundamentals, acting for our success and creating an engaging environment in a changing world.

Here you can be you!!

Title: Officer trattamento economico
HTML:
La Croce Rossa Italiana (CRI) √® un‚ÄôAssociazione di diritto privato senza fini di lucro e di interesse pubblico, posta sotto l'alto patronato del Presidente della Repubblica ed iscritta di diritto nella sezione Organizzazioni di Volontariato del registro unico nazionale del Terzo settore, applicandosi ad essa, per quanto non diversamente disposto dal D.Lgs. n. 178/2012, il Codice del Terzo Settore (D.Lgs. n. 117/2017).

La CRI √® Societ√† volontaria di soccorso ed assistenza, ausiliaria dei pubblici poteri in campo umanitario.

L'Associazione della Croce Rossa Italiana fa parte del Movimento Internazionale della Croce Rossa e Mezzaluna Rossa. Nelle sue azioni a livello internazionale si coordina con il Comitato Internazionale di Croce Rossa (CICR) e con la Federazione Internazionale di Croce Rossa e Mezzaluna Rossa (FICR).

In quanto Associazione di diritto privato, non trovano applicazione le disposizioni previste in materia di concorsi pubblici.

Posizione:

Servizio/Unit√† Operativa/Direzione: U.O. Risorse Umane

Sede di lavoro: Roma, Comitato Nazionale

Numero unit√†: 1

Tipologia contrattuale: T. indeterminato cat. D - CCNL CRI

RAL: 28 K

Scopo della funzione: La risorsa sar√† inserita all'interno dell'U.O. Risorse Umane ‚Äì Servizio Trattamento Economico e si dovr√† occupare della gestione delle presenze, paghe, contributi e adempimenti connessi, nonch√© di tutte le attivit√† relative all'amministrazione del personale.

Compiti e responsabilit√†:

Nell‚Äôambito degli scopi della funzione sopra delineati assicura, a titolo esemplificativo e non esaustivo, i seguenti compiti e responsabilit√†:

  • Elaborazione dei cedolini paga: gestione completa del ciclo payroll, dall‚Äôacquisizione dei dati fino alla chiusura del cedolino con adempimenti contributivi e fiscali;
  • Amministrazione del personale: gestione delle presenze, ferie, malattie, infortuni e maternit√†.
  • Rapporti con enti previdenziali e assicurativi: gestione delle comunicazioni obbligatorie con INPS, INAIL, Agenzia delle Entrate e altri enti;
  • Gestione di tutti gli eventi relativi al personale che possono avere un impatto sull'elaborazione dei cedolini paga (monitoraggio presenze, gestione timbrature e assegnazione badge, malattie, infortuni, detrazioni, maternit√†, etc.);
  • Gestione delle relazioni con il team HR: supporto nell‚Äôelaborazione di reportistica interna.

Requisiti:

Requisiti obbligatori:

Titolo di studio ed esperienza: Laurea triennale ed almeno tre anni di esperienza professionale nel ruolo o diploma di scuola superiore di secondo grado con almeno 5 anni di esperienza professionale nel ruolo.

Competenze tecniche:

  • Conoscenza dei principali CCNL e della normativa sul lavoro;
  • Conoscenza dei principali eventi relativi alla gestione del personale (malattie, infortuni, detrazioni, maternit√†, etc) e della relativa gestione;
  • Conoscenza degli adempimenti post paghe e delle dichiarazioni mensili/annuali (INPS, INAIL, CU, 770, etc);
  • Conoscenza del pacchetto Office (con particolare riferimento all'applicativo Excel);
  • Conoscenza della suite Infinity Zucchetti e degli applicativi Presenze Project, Paghe Web e Analytics.

Requisiti migliorativi

  • Master in gestione del personale
  • Abilitazione alla professione di consulente del lavoro

Competenze trasversali:

  • Riservatezza nella gestione delle informazioni;
  • Capacit√† relazionali, attitudine al lavoro in team e puntualit√† nella gestione delle scadenze;
  • Precisione, affidabilit√† e buone doti organizzative.

Altre informazioni:

ITER SELETTIVO

  • MODALITA‚Äô DI PRESENTAZIONE DELLA CANDIDATURA

Le candidature dovranno pervenire entro e non oltre le ore 12:00 del 29 maggio 2025

  • Ciascun candidato potr√† presentare la propria candidatura esclusivamente attraverso la registrazione sulla piattaforma In-Recruiting, compilando il web form pubblicato sul sito istituzionale dell‚ÄôAssociazione, avendo cura di inserire tutti i dati richiesti ed allegare copia aggiornata del CV, documento di identit√† e foto, pena l'esclusione;
  • all‚Äôinvio della candidatura, il candidato ricever√† un messaggio, all'indirizzo e-mail indicato, di avvenuta registrazione all'annuncio.
  • SVOLGIMENTO DELLA SELEZIONE

Test preselettivo

  • Per poter proseguire l'iter di selezione, ogni partecipante dovr√† effettuare un test preselettivo, che trover√† alla sezione ‚ÄúQuestionari‚Äù della propria pagina personale di In-Recruiting, consistente in 30 quiz, con tre opzioni di risposta di cui una sola corretta, sulle materie di cultura generale, ragionamento numerico-verbale, conoscenza generale di Croce Rossa Italiana ed inglese, da svolgere in 25 minuti e comunque entro e non oltre 1 ora dall‚Äôavvenuta registrazione all'annuncio;
  • saranno ammessi alla successiva fase di selezione i candidati che abbiano conseguito il punteggio minimo del 60% delle risposte esatte (ossia almeno 18/30 punti) e consegnato il test nei tempi previsti dall‚Äôiter selettivo (un'ora e 25 minuti dalla registrazione all'annuncio);
  • ai fini del superamento della fase preselettiva, in caso di invio multiplo del test da parte del candidato, verr√† ritenuto valido solo e soltanto il primo test inviato, i successivi non verranno presi in considerazione;
  • il test una volta avviato non potr√† essere interrotto e/o sospeso e non sar√† inoltre possibile avviarlo nuovamente;
  • non √® possibile candidarsi all'annuncio pi√π volte utilizzando indirizzi e-mail diversi, pena l'esclusione dalla selezione;
  • eventuali problematiche di natura tecnica che dovessero insorgere in fase di registrazione o di svolgimento del test preselettivo devono essere comunicate in tempo reale all'indirizzo e-mail recruiting@cri.it, al fine di consentire la verifica e la risoluzione della problematica;
  • l‚Äôesito del test preselettivo non concorre alla formazione del punteggio complessivo valido per la graduatoria finale, ma verr√† utilizzata ai soli fini di accesso alle fasi successive di selezione.

Prove di selezione

  • I candidati saranno chiamati a svolgere una o pi√π prove di selezione le cui modalit√† verranno comunicate a mezzo e-mail contestualmente alla convocazione.

Colloquio

  • In caso di superamento delle prove di selezione e di verifica del possesso dei requisiti, i candidati saranno ammessi ad un colloquio tecnico-motivazionale, nel quale verranno approfonditi e valutati il background professionale, le competenze e l‚Äôesperienza nello svolgimento delle attivit√† richieste dalla job description pubblicata;
  • al termine dei colloqui, chi avr√† superato positivamente le prove di selezione ed il colloquio e risulter√† in possesso dei requisiti obbligatori sar√† inserito in una lista di idonei che rimarr√† valida 24 mesi e che potr√† essere utilizzata per la copertura di eventuali posizioni analoghe che dovessero risultare vacanti all‚Äôinterno dell‚ÄôAssociazione. Il punteggio di ciascun candidato idoneo sar√† derivante dalla somma del punteggio ottenuto nella/e prova/e di selezione.
  • ALTRE INFORMAZIONI ‚Äì ITER SELETTIVO
  • Saranno considerate valide le sole candidature che risulteranno in possesso dei requisiti obbligatori al momento della presentazione della stessa;
  • il mancato possesso dei requisiti obbligatori previsti comporter√† l‚Äôesclusione dalla procedura di selezione in qualsiasi momento;
  • in caso di titolo di studio conseguito all'estero o di titolo estero conseguito in Italia, √® necessario aver completato l'iter di riconoscimento previsto dalla normativa vigente;
  • in considerazione di possibili variazioni del presente iter selettivo, i candidati sono invitati a monitorare il proprio indirizzo e-mail e la piattaforma In-Recruiting, all‚Äôinterno della quale verranno date eventuali comunicazioni in merito;
  • si fa presente che la selezione potrebbe subire modifiche in esito ad interpelli interni all‚ÄôAssociazione in corso di svolgimento;
  • l‚ÄôAssociazione si riserva, a suo insindacabile giudizio, di modificare, sospendere o annullare la presente procedura, senza che i candidati possano avanzare pretese di qualsiasi genere o natura;
  • l'assunzione dei profili idonei sar√† subordinata alla verifica del possesso dei titoli di studio dichiarati.

Per qualsiasi ulteriore informazione o richiesta di chiarimento √® possibile inviare una e-mail all'indirizzo recruiting@cri.it, avendo cura di indicare nell'oggetto la dicitura "Officer trattamento economico".

Title: Opportunit√† per ingegneri e professionisti in ambito Logistica e Corriere Espresso
Description:
Entra a far parte della rete logistica pi√π grande d‚ÄôItalia!




Poste Italiane √® alla ricerca di giovani talenti e professionisti appassionati di logistica, desiderosi di intraprendere un percorso di crescita nella principale realt√† del settore logistico d‚ÄôItalia.

Con circa 120.000 dipendenti, 45 milioni di clienti e una gamma di servizi che spazia dalla logistica ai pagamenti digitali, dal settore finanziario a quello assicurativo, dalla telefonia mobile all‚Äôenergia, Poste Italiane √® oggi protagonista dell‚Äôinnovazione tecnologica e della coesione sociale del Paese.




Contribuisci alla trasformazione logistica e sostenibile del Paese!

Il nostro obiettivo √® offrire un‚Äôesperienza finalizzata alla gestione end-to-end dell'intera filiera della supply chain che mira ad essere sempre pi√π efficiente, sostenibile e customizzata.

L‚Äôautomazione avanzata, le tecnologie intelligenti e le piattaforme per l‚Äôintegrazione dei flussi fisici e digitali sono le leve su cui costruiamo il futuro della logistica.




Chi cerchiamo:

Professionisti e laureati in ingegneria o economia, appassionati del settore, che nel ricoprire i diversi ruoli (Logistic Engineer, Gestore Commessa, Specialista Trasporti, Ingegnere di Processo, Gestione Operativa), contribuiranno al miglioramento continuo e all‚Äôottimizzazione dei processi logistici e di corriere espresso.




Requisiti:

laurea in ambito STEM
ottima conoscenza di Excel
disponibilit√† a lavorare su turni (se richiesta)
flessibilit√†, spirito di iniziativa, curiosit√† e attitudine all‚Äôinnovazione

Costituiscono titolo preferenziale:

master specialistico in ambito logistico/supply chain
conoscenza di applicativi specialistici del settore (WMS) e metodologie Lean Manufacturing

Title: SAINT LAURENT Department Manager
Description:
Summary

Founded in 1961, Yves Saint Laurent was the first couture house to introduce the concept of luxury pr√™t-√†-porter in a 1966 collection called ‚ÄòRive Gauche‚Äô, synonymous with youth and freedom. This shift represented a first critical step in the modernization of fashion and revolutionized the socio-cultural landscape.
In 1999, the luxury goods division of the Kering Group acquired Yves Saint Laurent and, under the creative direction of Anthony Vaccarello since April 2016, continues to position the house at the summit of the luxury universe.
Today, Saint Laurent collections include women‚Äôs and men‚Äôs ready-to-wear, shoes, handbags, small leather goods, jewelry, scarves, ties and eyewear.

Job Description

Role

Reporting to the Assistant Store Director the Department Manager is a professional in the category they oversee and is responsible for promoting brand engagement to customers in order to guarantee the quantitative and qualitative goals assigned for the department involved.¬†

He/she represents the company and is a proactive sales professional who operates according to the policies fixed by the Store and Assistant Director. He/ She leads, motivates, coaches the team of the Department, is responsible of his/ her Department staff development and of their assigned target and tasks achievement.

Mission

A Business developer:

Assure the recruitment, development and retainment of customers

Implement action plans defined with the HQ and Store director and guarantee follow up at store level

Communicate high quality relevant feedback and reporting to the Assistant Store Director / Store Director or staff

A Talent Leader and Developer:

Create and maintain a positive and motivating work environment

Motivate and challenge the team on a daily basis in your department

A Brand Promoter:

Promote the culture of the brand internally and externally

Build a network of people who have an impact on local and international luxury

business in order to promote customer loyalty, especially with Top Clients and VIPs.

Ensure store atmosphere upholds brand image

A Process Manager:

Ensure that all the processes are in compliance with legal, safety, internal

requirements, sustainability, HR and stock organization

Challenge current processes to ensure efficiency and effectiveness in your

department

Profile


Commitment to take part in an innovative project
Product sensitivity and a strong market and fashion trends knowledge, a good general culture level
Significant experience in the sale of luxury goods or retail: customer portfolio
Managerial experience (Ability to provide constructive, straightforward feedback and coach your team to success)
High sensitivity to customers experience and loyalty
Precision, organizational skills
Being organized and able to prioritize tasks based on the needs of the business
Adaptability, openness, listening abilities, curiosity
High availability, responsiveness
Product and Fashion sensitivity
Excellent interpersonal skills and a passion for providing excellent customer service
A positive attitude and a willingness to learn and improve


Saint Laurent is committed to building a diverse workforce. We believe diversity in all its forms ‚Äì gender, age, nationality, culture, religious beliefs and sexual orientation ‚Äì enriches the workplace. It opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to adapt to a changing world. As an Equal Opportunity Employer we welcome and consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their background

Job Type

Regular

Start Date

2025-06-01

Schedule

Full time

Organization

SL Luxury Retail S.r.l.

Title: data scientist
Company: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS
Description:
BANDO PNRR-MCNT2-2023-12378380 Finanziato dall‚ÄôUnione Europea ‚Äì NextGenerationEU per Data Scientist addetto CON CONTRATTO DI BORSA DI STUDIO




Data di pubblicazione: 26 maggio 2025

Scadenza presentazione domanda: 26 giugno 2025

CODICE RIF. BANDO: PNRR-MCNT2-2023-12378380

La Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS, World‚Äôs Best Hospital per il terzo anno consecutivo secondo la classifica Newsweek e unico italiano nella top 40 a livello mondiale.

La sua Mission √® quella di affermarsi nelle seguenti aree di maggior rilievo:

Innovazione, Cura, Ricerca e Solidariet√†




CHI CERCHIAMO?

La Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS √® alla ricerca di persone con spirito d'iniziativa e capacit√† innovative, approccio alla multidisciplinariet√† e al lavoro di gruppo, con voglia di intraprendere un percorso insieme nell‚Äôeccellenza professionale sanitaria in un contesto sfidante ed internazionale.

Sei pronto a metterti in gioco?

La Fondazione nell‚Äôambito della sua attivit√† di ricerca scientifica seleziona Data Scientist addetto da inserire nel Progetto: PNRR-MCNT2-2023-12378380 DAL TITOLO ‚ÄúTIRESIA: Digital Twin, Immunity, and microRNA in the Evolution of Stroke In the Acute phase.‚Äù

CUP: C83C23001100007

La risorsa sar√† inserita nell‚Äôambito della Direzione Dipartimento di Neuroscienze

ATTIVITA‚Äô DEL RUOLO:

La risorsa si occuper√† di:

Analisi dati mediante approcci ed algoritmi avanzati di intelligenza artificiale
Analisi statistiche e multi-omiche
Creazione e validazione di modelli predittivi
Supporto nella redazione di pubblicazioni e protocolli




PROFILO DEL CANDIDATO:

Laurea in Data Science, Ingegneria Biomedica, Informatica, Fisica
Esperienza lavorativa nello sviluppo di modelli predittivi di machine learning e deep-learning
Conoscenza avanzata dei sistemi operativi Linux e Windows
Conoscenza avanzata di linguaggi di programmazione: Python, MatLAB&Simulink, R, C++
Conoscenza della sperimentazione clinica e traslazionale in team multidisciplinari
Conoscenza della lingua inglese B2

COSTITUISCE TITOLO PREFERENZIALE:

Affidabilit√†
Aggiornamento delle conoscenze
Lavoro di squadra
Problem solving
Inclusivit√†
Capacit√† di comunicazione
Conoscenza applicativi informatici

TIPOLOGIA CONTRATTUALE OFFERTA:

Borsa di studio.




TERMINI E MODALITA‚Äô DI PRESENTAZIONE DELLE DOMANDE

Le domande di partecipazione alla selezione dovranno pervenire entro e non oltre il giorno 26 giugno 2025 rispondendo all‚Äôannuncio mediante l‚Äôinvio del proprio CV datato e sottoscritto e la compilazione del modulo di ammissione online.

Saranno prese in considerazione unicamente le domande complete della documentazione richiesta e trasmesse secondo la modalit√† sopra indicata.




MODALITA‚Äô DI SELEZIONE E PROCEDURA DI VALUTAZIONE

La selezione del candidato ideale avverr√† mediante una valutazione per titoli ed un colloquio orale, operata da una Commissione esaminatrice.

La Commissione esaminatrice √® composta da: Direttore Scientifico e/o suo/suoi delegato/i, Direttore Risorse Umane e Organizzazione e/o suo/suoi delegato/i e dal Principal Investigator del Progetto e/o suo/suoi delegato/i.

La nomina della Commissione esaminatrice avverr√† mediante l‚Äôadozione di un provvedimento che sar√† pubblicato sul sito internet della Fondazione Policlinico Universitario A. Gemelli IRCCS.

La Commissione dispone complessivamente di 100 punti per la valutazione di ciascun candidato ammesso alla selezione, di cui:

fino a 60 punti per i titoli e l‚Äôesperienza maturata
fino a 40 punti per il colloquio.

La Commissione stabilir√† i punteggi da assegnare ai titoli e all‚Äôesperienza maturata da utilizzare congiuntamente ai punti assegnati all‚Äôesito del colloquio al fine di costituire una graduatoria finale.

La Commissione prender√† in esame le domande pervenute verificandone la completezza e l‚Äôammissibilit√† e provveder√† alla valutazione successiva dei titoli.

La valutazione della Commissione esaminatrice consister√† nell‚Äôesame del curriculum formativo del candidato, dei titoli e delle esperienze professionali e in un colloquio volti ad accertare il possesso delle conoscenze tecniche/ professionali e delle attitudini personali dei candidati richieste dal bando.

Saranno ammessi al colloquio unicamente i candidati in possesso dei requisiti di ammissione richiesti.

Le date dei colloqui saranno pubblicate sul sito istituzionale e comunicate personalmente agli interessati via mail e/o telefonicamente. La mancata presentazione al colloquio, per qualsiasi motivo, sar√† ritenuta rinuncia alla selezione.

A conclusione della procedura sar√† pubblicata sul sito la graduatoria di merito finale.







COSA TROVERAI

La Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS offre un‚Äôesperienza unica dal punto di vista umano e professionale, che consiste nel far parte di team che lavorano per obiettivi comuni sposando i valori dell‚ÄôEtica e del Rispetto.

Un ambiente stimolante e sfidante che abbraccia il cambiamento in ogni sua forma
La possibilit√† di lavorare in modalit√† agile e flessibile all‚Äôinterno di spazi di co-working nuovi e pensati per la collaborazione
Apprendimento continuo per lo sviluppo del sapere professionale, scientifico e tecnico attraverso percorsi formativi personalizzati
Una realt√† che persegue obiettivi sostenibili allo scopo di salvaguardare il nostro pianeta e le nostre Persone
Una struttura che favorisce la Diversity ed Inclusion. Lavorerai in team con Persone di et√† diverse, culture diverse, storie diverse. Crediamo che la Diversit√† crei scambio di Idee e lo scambio di Idee crei Valore.
L‚Äôopportunit√† di accesso a percorsi di carriera nel rispetto dei principi di equit√† e valorizzazione del merito.




GLI INGREDIENTI CHE ACCOMUNANO LE NOSTRE PERSONE

La Passione per il cosa si fa: √® ci√≤ che muove tutti noi a lavorare quotidianamente con competenza e professionalit√† al fine di Migliorare la Vita di ognuno di Noi.

L‚ÄôImpegno per l‚ÄôInnovazione: in quanto centro di Ricerca accogliamo il cambiamento ed il progresso continuo.

La Responsabilit√† etica e sociale: ci dedichiamo costantemente a realizzare progettualit√† legate alla sostenibilit√† sociale, perch√© riteniamo che ognuno di noi pu√≤ dare il proprio contributo lavorando con integrit√†, trasparenza ed onest√† in tutte le azioni







SU DI NOI

La Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS si conferma come il luogo in cui competenze scientifiche e tecniche, sensibilit√† umana, etica e valori cattolici diventano un impegno concreto per cure eccellenti e accessibili all‚Äôintera comunit√†. Il valore che viene quotidianamente posto al centro dell‚Äôoperare √®, fin dalle origini, la cura della persona malata, nel rispetto integrale della sua dignit√†, dei suoi bisogni, della sua sofferenza e della sua speranza.




LO SAPEVI CHE?

BANDO PNRR-MCNT2-2023-12378380 Finanziato dall‚ÄôUnione Europea ‚Äì NextGenerationEU per Data Scientist addetto CON CONTRATTO DI BORSA DI STUDIO


Data di pubblicazione: 26 maggio 2025

Scadenza presentazione domanda: 26 giugno 2025

CODICE RIF. BANDO: PNRR-MCNT2-2023-12378380

La Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS, World‚Äôs Best Hospital per il terzo anno consecutivo secondo la classifica Newsweek e unico italiano nella top 40 a livello mondiale.

La sua Mission √® quella di affermarsi nelle seguenti aree di maggior rilievo:

Innovazione, Cura, Ricerca e Solidariet√†


CHI CERCHIAMO?

La Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS √® alla ricerca di persone con spirito d'iniziativa e capacit√† innovative, approccio alla multidisciplinariet√† e al lavoro di gruppo, con voglia di intraprendere un percorso insieme nell‚Äôeccellenza professionale sanitaria in un contesto sfidante ed internazionale.

Sei pronto a metterti in gioco?

La Fondazione nell‚Äôambito della sua attivit√† di ricerca scientifica seleziona Data Scientist addetto da inserire nel Progetto: PNRR-MCNT2-2023-12378380 DAL TITOLO ‚ÄúTIRESIA: Digital Twin, Immunity, and microRNA in the Evolution of Stroke In the Acute phase.‚Äù

CUP: C83C23001100007

La risorsa sar√† inserita nell‚Äôambito della Direzione Dipartimento di Neuroscienze

ATTIVITA‚Äô DEL RUOLO:

La risorsa si occuper√† di:

  • Analisi dati mediante approcci ed algoritmi avanzati di intelligenza artificiale
  • Analisi statistiche e multi-omiche
  • Creazione e validazione di modelli predittivi
  • Supporto nella redazione di pubblicazioni e protocolli


PROFILO DEL CANDIDATO:

  • Laurea in Data Science, Ingegneria Biomedica, Informatica, Fisica
  • Esperienza lavorativa nello sviluppo di modelli predittivi di machine learning e deep-learning
  • Conoscenza avanzata dei sistemi operativi Linux e Windows
  • Conoscenza avanzata di linguaggi di programmazione: Python, MatLAB&Simulink, R, C++
  • Conoscenza della sperimentazione clinica e traslazionale in team multidisciplinari
  • Conoscenza della lingua inglese B2

COSTITUISCE TITOLO PREFERENZIALE:

  • Affidabilit√†
  • Aggiornamento delle conoscenze
  • Lavoro di squadra
  • Problem solving
  • Inclusivit√†
  • Capacit√† di comunicazione
  • Conoscenza applicativi informatici

TIPOLOGIA CONTRATTUALE OFFERTA:

Borsa di studio.


TERMINI E MODALITA‚Äô DI PRESENTAZIONE DELLE DOMANDE

Le domande di partecipazione alla selezione dovranno pervenire entro e non oltre il giorno 26 giugno 2025 rispondendo all‚Äôannuncio mediante l‚Äôinvio del proprio CV datato e sottoscritto e la compilazione del modulo di ammissione online.

Saranno prese in considerazione unicamente le domande complete della documentazione richiesta e trasmesse secondo la modalit√† sopra indicata.


MODALITA‚Äô DI SELEZIONE E PROCEDURA DI VALUTAZIONE

La selezione del candidato ideale avverr√† mediante una valutazione per titoli ed un colloquio orale, operata da una Commissione esaminatrice.

La Commissione esaminatrice √® composta da: Direttore Scientifico e/o suo/suoi delegato/i, Direttore Risorse Umane e Organizzazione e/o suo/suoi delegato/i e dal Principal Investigator del Progetto e/o suo/suoi delegato/i.

La nomina della Commissione esaminatrice avverr√† mediante l‚Äôadozione di un provvedimento che sar√† pubblicato sul sito internet della Fondazione Policlinico Universitario A. Gemelli IRCCS.

La Commissione dispone complessivamente di 100 punti per la valutazione di ciascun candidato ammesso alla selezione, di cui:

  1. fino a 60 punti per i titoli e l‚Äôesperienza maturata
  2. fino a 40 punti per il colloquio.

La Commissione stabilir√† i punteggi da assegnare ai titoli e all‚Äôesperienza maturata da utilizzare congiuntamente ai punti assegnati all‚Äôesito del colloquio al fine di costituire una graduatoria finale.

La Commissione prender√† in esame le domande pervenute verificandone la completezza e l‚Äôammissibilit√† e provveder√† alla valutazione successiva dei titoli.

La valutazione della Commissione esaminatrice consister√† nell‚Äôesame del curriculum formativo del candidato, dei titoli e delle esperienze professionali e in un colloquio volti ad accertare il possesso delle conoscenze tecniche/ professionali e delle attitudini personali dei candidati richieste dal bando.

Saranno ammessi al colloquio unicamente i candidati in possesso dei requisiti di ammissione richiesti.

Le date dei colloqui saranno pubblicate sul sito istituzionale e comunicate personalmente agli interessati via mail e/o telefonicamente. La mancata presentazione al colloquio, per qualsiasi motivo, sar√† ritenuta rinuncia alla selezione.

A conclusione della procedura sar√† pubblicata sul sito la graduatoria di merito finale.



COSA TROVERAI

La Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS offre un‚Äôesperienza unica dal punto di vista umano e professionale, che consiste nel far parte di team che lavorano per obiettivi comuni sposando i valori dell‚ÄôEtica e del Rispetto.

  • Una struttura che favorisce la Diversity ed Inclusion. Lavorerai in team con Persone di et√† diverse, culture diverse, storie diverse. Crediamo che la Diversit√† crei scambio di Idee e lo scambio di Idee crei Valore.
  • L‚Äôopportunit√† di accesso a percorsi di carriera nel rispetto dei principi di equit√† e valorizzazione del merito.


GLI INGREDIENTI CHE ACCOMUNANO LE NOSTRE PERSONE
